loans.name: Mrs. Nub Sor Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The nine members of the group live in Svay Bakav village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Nub S. is a village bank president. She is 49 years old and the mother of five children. Three of her children work in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. She has 0.5 hectare plot on which she cultivates rice for a living. Unfortunately, her field is infertile. To rectify the problem, Mrs. Nub S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to increase her crop yield. Her husband, Mr. H. S., helps her with the farm.

This is a village bank loan consisting of end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 26-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Mohamad has been working as a tiler for five years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a generator for his business. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

The loan has influenced his life in a good way by increasing his income. Mohamad is special because he is particularly good in his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. In the future, Mohamad plans to purchase a tile machine.

loans.use: to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Trinidad Antonio

texts.es: Trinidad Antonio U. S. tiene 66 años, está casado, y tiene un  hijo. Hace más de trece años que Don Trinidad tiene de poseer este negocio, pero anteriormente, laboraba como albañil. Además, debido a la edad es que no pudo seguir laborando en este tipo de oficio. Más tarde, decidió establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación, y con la ayuda de los préstamos realizados a fundación, Trinidad Antonio ha podido realizar avanzar. Al final, sus deseos son proporcionarle mejoras a su humilde vivienda. El monto que solicita Don Trinidad es de C$ 15.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Trinidad Antonio U. S. is a 66-year-old married father with one son. Mr. Trinidad has been in business for over 13 years. He previously worked as a bricklayer, but was unable to continue with that trade due to his age. He later decided to set up a general store in his house. With the help of loans made to him by the foundation, Trinidad Antonio has been able to get ahead. He now hopes to improve his humble home. Mr. Trinidad is requesting a loan for C$15,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Reyna vive en el distrito de Quinua en donde tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Reyna vende ropa en épocas de fiestas y ferias.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite.
Reyna sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Communal Bank of Wiñarisun, which means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. Reyna is 48 and single with two children. She lives in the Quinua District where she has a small store. She sells groceries, produce, and drinks every day of the week. Additionally, Reyna sells clothes in times of fairs and festivals. Reyna needs a loan of 2,000 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta and oil. Reyna dreams of constructing her own house in the city of Ayacucho and of continuing to build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta  and oil.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. A. is 45 years old, married, and a mother of five children. Currently, three are in school. She is very hard-working and resourceful. She sells charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes. Abena obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Mampong and other some parts of the Brong Ahafo region. She purchases the charcoal from villages like Ejura and A in the Amantin in the Ashanti region, where she lives and sells them to her customers.

She plans to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to pay for her children's educational fees. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyamekye’. She is requesting a loan of $450 (600 GHS) to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: Buy a bulk supply of charcoal

loans.name: Dmytryi

texts.en:
Dmytryi is married. He lives in Kherson and sells women’s clothing at the Central market. Dmytryi’s discipline and orderly approach along with two previous loans has helped his business grow steadily over the past 5 years. Today he has about invested a large portion of his income in his business. 

Dmytryi is very gregarious and has a unique gift of understanding people and building good relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him become successful in the competitive clothing market. Dmytryi’s biggest dream is financial independence and decent livelihood for his family. He hopes the current loan will promote further growth of his business and help him see his dream come true.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory

loans.name: Husain

texts.en:
Husain is a 44-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region with his wife and their five children. Husain has owned a grocery store since 2007. He has requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Husain has requested a loan.

Husain sees himself as special in his business because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Husain decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Fiza Mai M. Zafar Ali Group

texts.en:
Fiza mai baji is the wife of M. Z. A. who lives in a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan city is famous for its shrines and handmade items. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 14 years. Her husband runs a clothes-selling business.

Fiza mai baji sells clothes in the community and earns income. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Tasleem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy school bags to sell.

Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (eggs and bread) to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Danaya de l’association Sindiya AMIDEF est un regroupement de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.) 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt précédent. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente du  bois de chauffe, du savon traditionnel, des condiments alimentaires et divers  autres petits articles.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 300 morceaux de savons traditionnels (farakourouni), 4 paquets de condiments et d’autres petits articles. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues la plupart au comptant, dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 11.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et l’autre partie  investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Danaya, of the association Sindiya AMIDEF, is a group of married women who have an average of age of 36 and four children. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer needs and are now on their second solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been repaid. The women run diverse businesses, including the sale of firewood, traditional soap, condiments, and various and sundry goods. With this new loan, they intend to buy a truck-load of firewood, 300 bars of traditional soap (farakourouni), 4 packets of condiments, and other items. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold mostly in cash transactions at the different markets of Sikasso and in the districts. Their customers are composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 11,500 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be put into savings, and the other portion will be invested in business. Their ambition is to increase their turnover, so as to satisfy their customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey R., 42, is a villager living in the Province of Siem Reap, working in construction. He is married with two kids who are enrolled in primary school, while his wife works selling sweets for pupils in the local public school. Rey R. will be using a loan to add to his saving to buy an old motor for riding to work and for his family’s traveling needs.

loans.use: To buy an old motor for riding to work

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is thirty-two-year-old Rukia L. from Mbeya. She is a widow with one  eight-year-old child.  Rukia has been running a shop since 2004, selling home cooking items like rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and salt. She works at the business for nine to twelve hours a day, six days a week, assisted by one employee. Rukia currently earns about $80 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase an additional supply of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Rukia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil and soda

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es:
la sra Aura Estela M.  tiene 47 años de edad, ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, dicho alimento es muy consumido por todos los pobladores de Honduras, este alimento es indispensable en muchas familias en los tres tiempos de comida, (desayuno, almuerzo y cena.
ella elabora sus tortillas en su casa de habitacion, tiene la ayuda de su hija para dicha produccion. este tipo de negocio es la fuente de ingresos que ella tiene, siempre le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. en estos momentos ella necesita el credito para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las torillas, ya que la situacion que atravieza el pais es dificil y todo se esta poniendo mas caro, ella quiere comprar al por mayor para abaratar los costos.
texts.en:
Sra. Aura Estela M. is 47 years old. She makes and sells corn tortillas, a food consumed by all Hondurans. It is an essential food for many families at every meal – breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

Sra. Aura makes the tortillas at home and her daughter helps with the production. This business provides her with a source of income and allows her to always help her husband with the living expenses.

At the moment, she needs a loan to buy ingredients for making tortillas. The economic situation throughout her country is difficult and everything is getting more expensive. She wants to buy products at wholesale in order to reduce her costs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, lime & firewood

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda J. is 29-years old with two children. She is married to a policeman based at Buluk police headquarters, Juba. Emelda currently sells cooking oil and tomatoes and is asking for a loan to purchase fish to resell. With the extra profits from her loan, she plans to pay school fees for her children.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Madame Dédé est une femme qui habite le quartier Dèmakpoe à Lomé. Elle s’est spécialisée depuis 2005 dans le commerce d’alimentation générale. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge ; elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle a ouvert sa boutique dans sa maison, ce qui évite les frais de location. Elle est très connue par les gens de son  quartier, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bonnes affaires. Pour renouveler son stock presque fini, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz, 05 sacs de sucre, 03 boîtes de tomates, 01 boîte de lait et bien d’autres produits.
texts.en:
Ms. Dédé is a woman who lives in the Dèmakpoe district in Lomé. In 2005, she became specialized in the commerce of grocery items. This business enables her to support herself. She is not married and has no children to support. She has opened a store in her house, and this avoids the cost of leasing. She is well-known by people in her area, and business has been good as a result. To renew her almost-depleted inventory, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 10 containers of oil, 5 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of sugar, 3 boxes of tomatoes, a box of milk, and many other goods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Felipe Hernaldo

texts.es: El señor Felipe P. de 50 años de edad, trabaja en auto lavado y vulcanización desde hace 14 años, se ha esforzado por lograr tener un trabajo digno y propio. Reside en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian para lograr tener a futuro una carrera profesional, el inicio este negocio con una vulcanización la cual aun la conserva para tener ingresos y poder costearse los costos y salir adelante con el negocio. Sus planes es poder remodelar el local para brindar cada día un mejor servicio al público. Con este préstamo comprara llantas, aceite y otros productos para el auto lavado, con este inversión traerá mucho beneficios ya que incrementara el inventario y ventas lo cual generara ganancias para sus gatos y pago. A si como mejorar la infraestructura para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Felipe P. is 50 years old and has been working at a car wash and tire repair shop for the past 14 years. He has worked hard to establish his own modest business. He lives in the neighborhood of Casimiro Sotelo in the capital of Managua. He and his wife have three children who are studying to become career professionals in the future.

He started his tire repair shop in order generate an income, and he has been able to maintain a successful business. He plans to remodel his shop so that he can provide good service to the public every day. With this loan, he will buy tires, wax, and other car wash products. He believes this investment will provide many benefits and will increase his sales. Therefore, he will bring home more income and be able to make his loan payments. He plans to improve the infrastructure of his home in the future for the sake of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires, wax, and other car wash products

loans.name: Chansokha Sam’S Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chansokha S. (shown in the picture his group member) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group are two families including him. All the group's members live on an island in MeK. River approximately 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

1-Mr. Chansokha S., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sreylot K., 28, were married in 2003 and just a 2 year-old son. He has been a silk weaver for over 10 years, a skill he learned from his aunt, while his wife is a garment factory worker. In the past, she used to be a silk weaver as well. 

By the way, the house where he lives breaks down in some parts he wants to repair it, but he doesn’t have money. So, he is requesting a loan of $250 to make the repairs.

2-Mrs. Sokhen K., 30, and her husband, Mr. Thol Pho, 33, were married in 2001 and just a young daughter-who attends school. Sokhen has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old and taught her husband to become a silk weaver as well. 

She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To repair a house where he lives.

loans.name: Younish

texts.en:
Younish P. currently sells cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc. at a shop and is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. Younish is 40 years-old and is married with a husband that is a farmer. She has eight children and they go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a restaurant.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Purevdagva

texts.en:
G. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and two youngest children in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son lives and works in Korea and the younger two sons both attend university. G.’s husband is a carpenter who makes a variety of wooden products and she operates a grocery business in town. G. began her general store business in 1990 with working capital of 10,000 tugrugs (~7 USD). After years of hard work and diligence, she has managed to increase her working capital to 150,000 tugrugs (~105 USD). She says, “All I want is to help my children lead happy lives.” G. is requesting an 800,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase goods for her business and wood for her husband’s business. About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her general store and wood for her husband’s carpentry business

loans.name: Béranger

texts.fr: K. Béranger est née le 26 Mai 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Béranger est mariée à DOSSOU-YOVO Luc, un dépaneur. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés. C’est depuis 15 ans que Béranger vit à Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Béranger n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Béranger vend depuis cinq ans déjà, des chaussures, des sacs et parfois des tissus de façon ambulante. Béranger fait ses approvisionnements à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. Béranger a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à ALIDé qu’elle a bien remboursé. En vue d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et sa part de marché, Béranger sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Béranger K. was born on 26 May, 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Béranger is married to Luc Dossou-Yovo, a repairman. The couple have two children, both in school. For 15 years, Béranger has lived in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou. The household expenses are met by both husband and wife. Béranger never went to school. To provide for herself and for her children, Béranger has been selling shoes, bags, and sometimes fabric door-to-door for the past five years. Béranger gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Lomé, Togo, a country bordering Benin. Béranger has already benefited from one loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which she repaid properly. In order to increase her sales and market share, Béranger is seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three dozen pairs of shoes and two dozen bags

loans.name: Martina Sirri

texts.en:
Martina Sirri is married with seven children living in Musang, Mankong, Cameroon. Martina and her entire family are currently living in a house with one room. She has had to overcome some challenges in her life such as inadequate funds to pay her children's school fees, ill health, and the recent death of close relatives.

Martina has been eking out a living through the sale of chopped wood and the sale of corn and groundnuts. She plans to invest this loan in buying wood, corn, and groundnuts. This will be Martina's forth loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2005. To date, she has been quite successful in her business projects which can be credited to the location of her business and her reasonable prices. Also, her experience has led to good profits from her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying wood, corn and groundnuts

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married, with one son. She sells women's clothing at Crystal market in Kherson town. Natalya has been in this business for three years. Her hard work and entrepreneurial skills have helped Natalya make this business a stable source of income for her small family.

Natalya would like to borrow 14,600 UAH to purchase additional items of clothing to increase her assortment of stock. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan is 50 years old and lives with his wife and 20-year-old son in a house in Darhan-Uul province, Mongolia. His son, Erdenebayar, is a university student and Bayarsaihan's wife helps with the family business.

Bayarsaihan operates a door-to-door meal business in his town. His wife is responsible for making the meals at their home and he is responsible for delivering the meals to customers. They make and sell between twenty and thirty meals per day.

Bayarsaihan started his business in 2008 after he incurred too many injuries while working as a plumber for several years. Even though he has been in operation for a short period of time, he is well known amongst his customers and he is planning to expand his business further. For the future, he is planning to have his own food cafe in his town.

Bayarsaihan is a very hardworking man with a good personality. He says, "I want to buy a car with the loan. With my own car I can more easily deliver my products to my customers." He is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug loan to purchase a car to use in his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car to use in his business

loans.name: Galyna

texts.en: Galyna is divorced with one adult son. She sells women's underwear at one of the markets in Nova Kahovka city. Galyna has been in this business for 10 years. Even though she has many competitors, Galyna just likes her business and clients feel this. Galyna has many repeat clients who buy merchandise from her for themselves as well as for gifts. Galyna would like to borrow 12,200 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase the inventory

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 61 años, está felizmente casado y tiene 8 hijos, casi todos son independientes. No tiene casa propia, por lo que vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 12 años en el comedor popular de su barrio.

Él es una persona multifacética, pues realiza diferentes actividades como chofer, soldador y comerciante, todo esto para obtener mayores ganancias económicas, pero su negocio principal es la vende de quesos. El producto que el vende es de la ciudad de Huancayo (sierra central peruana), que donde él nació, y donde elaboran quesos muy ricos, es por ello que sus vecinos le hacen pedidos constantemente.
Al principio viajaba hasta su pueblo para comprar carne y quesos, pero hoy en el día ya tiene proveedores que le traen estos productos a un bajo precio. Gracias a estos negocios, Guillermo pudo educar a sus numerosos hijos, pero lo que le apena es no haber podido comprar un terreno para tener una casa propia, pero aun así  se siente feliz porque siempre trató de darle lo mejor a sus hijos, menciona. 

Este es su 19avo préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecido por la oportunidad brindada con reiterados créditos, pues han sido y siguen siendo de gran apoyo para que siga trabajando con su negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de más quesos y carne, para incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a very hard-working man of 61. He is happily married and has 8 children, nearly all of them grown and independent. Because he does not have his own home, he lives together with his wife and his 12-year-old daughter in his neighborhood's soup kitchen. He is a multi-faceted person who carries out a range of activities, including driver, welder and salesman. He does all of this to obtain additional income, but his main business is selling cheese. The product he sells comes from the city of Huancayo (in Peru's central highlands), where he was born. The cheese from Huancayo is very delicious, and so his neighbors are constantly ordering it from him. At the beginning, he traveled to his village to buy meat and cheeses, but today he has suppliers who bring him these products at a low price. Thanks to these businesses, Guillermo has been able to educate his numerous children; however, it bothers him that he could not buy a piece of land in order to have a house of his own. However, he mentions that he still feels happy, since he has always tried to do his best for his children. This is his 19th loan with MFP, and he is very grateful for the opportunity provided to him through these repeated loans. They have been, and continue to be, of great help to him so that he can continue operating his business. He plans to invest the funds he is currently requesting in purchasing more cheeses and meat, in order to increase his sales and his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying larger quantities of merchandise

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, el señor Rodolfo N. se dedica a la producción agropecuaria, dentro de lo que desarrolla una serie de rubros tanto agrícolas como pecuarios y los que mas desarrolla son la crianza de ganado porcino, bovino y ovino también establece cultivos como son sandia, tomate, yuca, ayote, maíz, y algunos pepinos.

El señor Rodolfo se destaca por ser muy trabajador y la mayoría de su producción la comercializa en el mercado local y cuyos ingresos son utilizados para la mantención de su hogar y el estudio de sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado será empleado en la inversión agropecuaria en la compra de herramientas para la mejora de sus cercas de las fincas y animales y la compra de herramientas para mejorar el sistema de riego que posee en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo Antonio N. F.devotes himself to farming production in the Somotillo municipality. He does different work, as much agricultural as raising livestock. What he does the most is raise pigs, cattle, and sheep. He also grows crops like watermelon, tomato, yucca, squash, corn, and some cucumbers. Rodolfo Antonio F.works from six in the morning until one in the afternoon. He sells most of his production in the local market. His income is used to support his household and for his children’s education. The loan he is requesting will be used to improve his fences and to improve the watering system that he has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de herramientas para mejorar la cerca

loans.name: Urbanus

texts.en: Urbanus is a 35-year-old hardworking father of three.  He has a motorcycle transport business located in a busy environment.  Besides, he is employed, has semi-permanent rental houses and he does livestock farming together with his wife.  He wants a loan of Kes.70,000 from Faulu Kenya to purchase a motorbike.  He hopes to upgrade his rental houses to become permanent houses.  He sees himself becoming a stable businessman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: My God Is Able Women Group

texts.en: For more than 10 years, Jaqueline J. has been selling fresh fish, chicken and meat at the Fiamah market in Monrovia, Liberia. She is 37 years old and single with two children, ages 12 and 15 years old. She did not continue her education through college, but she is now preparing to go back to college. Jaqueline sells quality goods at good prices which keeps customers returning but she has problems with few customers coming to buy. She started selling with 200 Liberian dollars (LRD) as working capital. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to purchase more pig feet, chicken and meat. Her goal is to own a cold storage unit and build a house for her children. Jaqueline is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "My God Is Able". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jaqueline is the one holding the sign and Marian L. is inset at the lower right. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more pig feet, chicken and meat

loans.name: Ledy Jane's Group

texts.en:
Ledy Jane S. is is 55 years old and from the village of Brgy. Uddiawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ledy Jane is married and has two adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Ledy Jane has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ledy Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ledy Jane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Audaces Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama las audaces porque simplemente se les ocurrio al grupo en general.  Las UDEs son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunir semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de la colonia ejidal en el estado de Veracruz.  El grupo está conformado por  12 integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama Ana Karen N. M.. Karen  es casada, tiene 21 (años), estudió hasta la secundaria (3) año, y tiene en total 1 hijos (1 mujer y varones).  Ella se dedica a venta de ropa y necesita el préstamo para comprar y mas variedad de modelos, tallas y colores.  Sus clientes dicen que tiene buenos precios y que es muy amable y tiene mucha ropa muy bonita. Ella sale cada ocho o cada quince días a fortín para surtirse de ropa. Karen desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para poder poner un local en su comunidad y así no caminar tanto y poder tener un lugar fijo donde vender su mercancía.

Lizet O. C. es parte  de este grupo, Las Audaces.  Ella tiene 29 (años), estudió hasta la preparatoria (3) año, y no tiene hijo es soltera y ayuda a sus padres.  Ella se dedica a la bisutería y necesita el préstamo para invertir en perfumes, bolsas de dama, caballero, regalos etc. Sus clientes dicen que es muy trabajadora y que siempre busca la manera de salir delante de una u otra forma. Lizet  desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para crecer su negocio y en un futuro tener un local aunque sea chico para vender sus productos.

Los otros 10 integrantes se llaman Ángela Juárez Suárez, Sadi  Ayelin O. C., Olga  lidia Z. Rodríguez, Leticia  Montero Hernández, Norma Leticia C. T., María del Rosario V. H., Jessica Vianey R. C., Rosa Elena E. Rodríguez, Eloisa O. M., Jorge Luis N. R. y quieren préstamos para venta de ropa, bisutería, antojitos, perfumería, etc.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is named Las Audaces simply because in the women in the group are audacious and bold. The group is made up of more than 10 people who meet every week or two to make their payments. They have a representative and a governing committee. This group is located in the the Ejidal community in Veracruz. In total there are 12 members. The leader of the group is named Ana. She is 21 years old and has a middle school education and one daughter. She sells clothing and requests a loan to purchase a wider variety of styles, sizes, and colors. Her customers say that she her merchandise is very well-priced, and that she is very nice and has very pretty clothing. Every week or two she goes to Fortín to stock up on clothing. She would like this loan to expand her business and establish herself in a fixed location in her community so that she does not have to walk so much. Lizet is also part of the Las Audaces group. She is 29 years old and has a high school education. She is single without kids, but helps her parents. She sells jewelry and requests a loan to invest in perfumes, purses, small gifts, etc. Her customers say that she is very hard working and always looks to move forward one way or another. Lizet would like to expand her business and establish a store to sell her products. The other members of the group are Ángela Juárez Suárez, Sadi Ayelin O. C., Olga lidia Z. Rodríguez, Leticia Montero Hernández, Norma Leticia C. T., María del Rosario V. H., Jessica Vianey R. C., Rosa Elena E. Rodríguez, Eloisa O. M., and Jorge Luis N. R.. They would like loans to sell clothing, costume jewelry, traditional Mexican dishes, perfume, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and materials for their businesses

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Mrs. Nheb S. is 43 years old and she is a villager who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Kun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice on. Aside from being farmers, they are also beef sellers who can earn a small income to support their family. For their beef business, Mrs. Nheb S. decided to ask for a loan to buy beef to sell. This couple has three children who all are students and also help with their parents' business. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy beef

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn P. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 42 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Anelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling both food and daily use products. Anelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Anelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support her children's education. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Enhzaya

texts.en: Enhzaya G. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 3-year-old child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Enhzaya operates a used clothing retail business in the Narantuul market, one of the largest and most crowded markets in Ulaanbaatar. She began her business in 2005 and now she works at a rented stall at Harhorin Market and is getting more customers every day. This successful business has allowed Enhzaya and her husband to buy their own ger where the family lives. Enhzaya would one day like to have her own workplace. She is a very hard working and easygoing person. Her husband helps to pick up items from wholesalers and they sell together at the market.  “What we want is to expand our business and possess our own shoe store someday, ” Enhzaya says. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase men's shoes for spring and fall at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine M. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. Catherine has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Catherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Catherine is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy piñata making supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer esforzada, vive junto con su familia, el cual todo se apoyan  para ayudar en su pequeño negocio una pulpería que ha venido administrando desde hace doce años.
Y que junto con Afodenic ha venido creciendo. Ya que cuando comenzó era poco el inventario a través de los financiamientos ha invertido en ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, y más en granos básicos ofreciendo al cliente 
Lo mejor.
Sus productos los compra en el mercado a proveedores, para lograr mejor precio y dar a buen precio al cliente.
Logrando a si mantener la clientela, lo que esta contenta ya que es su fuente de entrada para ayudar  a su esposo con los gastos.
Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos, golosinas, cajas de leche, caja de jabón, productos lácteos, ropa, zapatos, cosméticos.
texts.en:
Gloria is a resourceful woman who lives with her family: they all help her out with her activity, a small corner shop she has been running for twelve years, and which has been growing thanks to Afodenic’s support. She started with a small stock, and thanks to the loans she has managed to invest in clothes, shores, cosmetics and more basic grains, thus offering the best products to her customers. She buys her products in the wholesale market in order to obtain the best rates and so be able to offer fair prices that allow her to keep her customers, something she is happy about as this provides her with an income she can use to help her husband facing family expenses. This loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, sweets, milk cartons, bars of soap, dairy products, clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different products for her corner shop.

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en:
Bryan S. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 25 years old. Bryan is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Bryan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to breed. Bryan has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bryan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bryan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bryan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sony

texts.en: Sony C.'s main source of income comes from operating a motor transport service. He is 27 years old, married and has one small child. They are from Langcangan, Oroquieta City. Sony has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Sony joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Sony has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60,000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be his fifth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle for better service

loans.name: Helena Da Conceicao

texts.pt:
Helena Da Conceição S. nasceu na Província de Manica, Centro de Moçambique, mãe de 6 filhos de 9 aos 29 anos de idade, os 4 mais novos é que se encontram a estudar. Fez somente 6ª classe não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com sua família e responsabiliza se pela sua mãe que vive com ela em sua casa.

Após o casamento Helena muda se com seu marido para o Distrito de Namaacha, onde fixa sua casa e inicia seu próprio negócio de pasteleira com ajuda do seu marido. Hoje é proprietária de uma lanchonete sita na Escola Secundária da Namaacha, conta com dois empregados que auferem 1.500.00mt cada. Tem como melhor produto de venda pastéis, chamuças, bolos e outros que tem feito por encomendas para baptismos, casamentos e aniversários. Consegue obter de lucro 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria com ajuda do marido.    

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é quarto empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (farinha de trigo, óleo alimentar e outros) para o fabrico de bolos, pasteis e chamuças. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 18.000.00, 30.000.00 e 15.000.00mt foram usados para a mesma finalidade. 

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir a obra do seu armazém no mercado informal shoprite e meter mercadoria pois ela pretende vender a grosso.
texts.en:
Helena Da Conceição S. was born in the Province of Manica, in central Mozambique.  She is mother of 6 children, ages 9 to 29.  The four youngest attend school.  Helena only completed school through the 6th grade due to an early pregnancy.  She lives in her own home with her family, and also supports her mother who lives with her.  

After marrying, Helena moved with her husband to the District of Namaacha, where she set up her home and started her own bakery business with the help of her husband.  Today she is the owner of a luncheonette located in the Namaacha high school.  She has two employees who earn 1.500.00mt each.  Her best selling items are pastries, samosas, sweet rolls, and other items that she makes on special order for baptisms, weddings, and birthdays.  She earns 10.000.00mt monthly, which she uses for household expenses and she also saves money in her bank account with her husband's help.  

She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are clients of this organization.  This is her fourth loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.) to make sweet rolls, pastries and samosas.  Her prior loans were for 18.000.00, 30.000.00, and 15.000.00mt, which were used for the same purpose.  

She is confident that she will repay the loan before it is due and request a new loan to finish construction a storage unit in the shoprite informal market and stock it because she plans to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: purchase products (wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Tomasa

texts.es: Maria Tomasa es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, ella trabaja todos los dias para sacarlos adelante ya que estan en edad escolar, se be, en la necesidad de trabajar para darles lo que nececitan, porque no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie doña Tomasa se dedica a la Venta de tortillas y bebidas gaseosas,vende todos los dias en una caseta ubicada en el mercado Municipal de San Martin, biaja todos los dias para llegar a su negocio ya que vive un poco lejos, en la aldea donde vive tambien tiene crianzas de pollos y marranos los vende cada mes y de esa actividad obtiene ganacias solicita el credito para comprar Marranos maiz y bebidas gaceosas, para seguir con su negocio y asi sobrevivir agradese a fape por la ayuda brindada manifiesta que es una institucion distinta a las demas por su forma de trabajo, su sueño es tener un comedor propio para ya no seguir alquilando y que sus hijos llegen a ser unos profesionales.
texts.en: Maria Tomasa is a single mother, she has two children, and she works every day to help get them ahead as they are of school age. She needs to work to give them what they need, because she does not have support from anyone. Ms Tomasa sells tortillas and fizzy drinks, she sells them daily at a stand located at the Municipal Market of San Martin, she travels daily to get to her business as she lives a distance away. In the village where she lives she also raises chickens and pigs she sells them each month and from this business she gains profits. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs, corn and fizzy drinks, to continue with her business and therefore survive. She is grateful to FAPE for the help provided, it has shown that it is an institution different from the others by its type of work. Her dream is to have her own dining room so she does not have to keep renting and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase pigs, corn and drinks

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es: El Sr. Santos Evaristo A. N. él se dedica  a la siembra de granos como frijoles, maíz etc,  tiene  quince años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de insumos y granos para prepararse para la siembra los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Santos Evaristo A. N. is dedicated to the cultivation of grains such as beans, corn etc. He has been devoted to this activity for fifteen years. He has had two loans with field partner CEPRODEL and with each he has purchased supplies and grain to prepare for planting. He has benefited greatly from the loans with CEPRODEL as he has been able to improve living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and grain and pay rent for his land.

loans.name: Blanca Yesenia

texts.es: Blanca Yesenia T. D. S. D. 31 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 12 y 5 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Blanca posee un comedor en el mercado municipal D. San Martín, en el cual elabora y venD. desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa bebidas frías y calientes. Debido a que ya posee muchos años D. tener este negocio, cuenta con una amplia clientela, la cual asiste a su comedor ya que la consideran como una persona D. mucha confianza, así mismo les agrada el buen trato que ella les brinda. Blanca solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que ella espera poder comprar, verduras, arroz, frijoles, maíz y una mayor cantidad D. bebidas. Esto debido a que ella cuenta con la ilusión D. aumentar sus ventas en este fin D. año, es por ello que desea poder brindarles un mejor servicio D. comida a sus clientes y así mismo obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en: 31 year old Blanca lives in the town of Soyapango along with her husband and two children of 12 and 5 years of age who are in school. Blanca has a cafeteria in the municipal market of San Martín where she cooks and sells breakfasts and lunches and also sells hot and cold drinks. Because she has had this business for many years, she has many customers who come to her cafeteria and who consider her to be a very reliable person and they also appreciate the good treatment she gives them. Blanca is requesting a loan so that she can increase her sales. She hopes to buy vegetables, rice, beans, corn, and a greater quantity of drinks. This is because she wants to increase her sales during the end of the year and she wants to be able to offer a better food service to her customers and in this way also gain new customers.

loans.use: To buy grains, fruits, and more, to supply her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; La socia tiene 58 años D. edad, ella es casada; la socia tiene 5 hijos; la socia trabaja vendiendo ropa D. cama, ella compra al por mayor D. las fábricas en la ciudad D. Lima y las trae a Cusco para la venta al por menor, la socia venD. D. forma ambulante ella ofrece a las instituciones y a sus amigas luego a las amigas y compañeras D. trabajo D. estas y así logra vender su producto, la socia desea a provechar esta temporada para viajar y traer con motivos naviD.ños una nueva colección D. invierno y navidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. ropa D. cama parea esta nueva temporada.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "LOS LIDERES" communal bank.  The communal bank is located in the Huanchac district which belongs to the Cusco province and department.

Mrs. Carmen is 58 years old, married and has five children.  She buys wholesale bed linen products from factories in Lima and then sells them retail in Cusco.  Her work consists of door-to-door sales to institutions, friends and colleagues.  She wants to take advantage of the season and bring new products for the winter and Christmas season.  She is applying for a loan to buy bed linens for the new season.

This member expresses her gratituD. for the loan and is committed to paying her monthly quotas as required.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan for the purchase of bed linens for this new season.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is member of Sunshine Self-Help group. To raise her family, she sells curios. She has been in the business for five years. Jennifer is a hardworking lady who hopes to become financially stable in the future. For this reason, she works hard in her business. Jennifer has requested a 20,000 Kes loan to buy beads, wood carvings and sandals made from beads and leather.

loans.use: To buy beads, wood carvings, and sandals made from beads and leather.

loans.name: Kansé

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kansé C. a plus de 31 ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur C. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au commerce qui lui a souri et il dispose de nos jours de deux boutiques: une pour les Prêt à Porter et une pour l’Alimentation, à la gare routière de Sikasso. Avec plus de 10 ans d’expérience dans le domaine, il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y environ trois année. Après avoir correctement remboursé ses deux prêts précédents, il est à son troisième prêt individuel.
 Ce troisième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 chemises différentes, 17 pantalons de qualité différentes, 15 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 5 complets de veste, 10 Tee-Shirt, 5 complets de sous-vêtement, etc. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de voyageurs et surtout de routiers.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Kansé C. is more than 31 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (in the third administrative district in the Republic of Mali).

Mr. C., having headed several business without success, has found the business that has smiled on him and he now has two boutiques: one for ready-to-wear clothing and one for food, at the bus station in Sikasso. With more than 10 years of experience in the field, he is highly sought after by his customers for the quality of his wares.

In order to satisfy his continually growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After having properly repaid his two previous loans, he is on his third individual loan.

This third loan will allow Mr. C. to buy 15 assorted shirts, 17 pairs of pants of various qualities, 15 assorted pairs of footwear (sturdy shoes that cover the whole foot, Ferardine shoes, etc.), 5 suits, 10 t-shirts, 5 sets of underwear, etc. He purchases his stock from the wholesalers in Bamako before re-selling it at retail to a customer base mostly made up of travelers, particularly truck drivers.

With this loan, Mr. C. hopes to make a monthly profit of 250,000 CFA francs, which will mainly be used to grow his business, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: Buying clothing.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل في الزراعة له اكثر من 10 سنوات يحب عمله ويريد ان يزيد من مدخوله يحب عائلته
ويسعى دائما الى تطوير عمله كمزارع له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة تلقى دعم كامل من عائلته احمد منظم ومتطور يحب ان يتقن 
عمله لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة فقد لزيادة مدخول الارض عنده يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء شتل وحبوب للزرع
زبائنه هم من جيرانه واصدقائه
texts.en: Ahmad, married, is a father of five children. He has been working as a farmer for 10 years. Ahmad likes his work and wants to increase his income. He works hard to improve himself as a farmer. He loves his family and enjoys its full support. Ahmad is systematic, proficient and likes to be up to date. He wants to get a loan from A. Majmoua to buy seedlings and seeds. His clients are from his neighborhood and his circle of friends.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Milly has a business selling fruits and vegetables, which she has run for one year.
To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Milly hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Milly hopes to own a plot of land. Milly is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by changing her behaviors to more positive ones.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Jesmin

texts.es:
La señora Jesmin es socia del banco comunal María Montessori, del distrito de Manantay y Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 31 años, está casada y tiene un hijo.
Jesmin tiene un negocio de pasamanería, ya tiene varios años trabajando y los préstamos que sacó de Manuela Ramos le han servido para incrementar mas su negocio, la mercadería la trae de la ciudad de Lima, para poder obtener mejores precios y mayores  ganancias.

La señora Jesmin invertirá su nuevo préstamo de S/.2,500.00 nuevos soles en la compra de 1 doc. de ganchos, ½ ciento de peines, ½ ciento de espejos, 1 paquete de cintas de colores, 1 ciento de adornos, 1 ciento de aplicaciones, 2 cientos de botones de diferentes tamaños y modelos.
La señora  Jesmin trabaja al igual que su esposo para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y para lograr, más adelante, dar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jesmin is a member of the María Montessori communal bank in Mantantay district, Ucayali department.  She is 31 years old, married and has a son.

Jesmin sells notions and has been working for several years.  Loans she took out at Manuela Ramos have helped her increase her business still more.  She brings her merchandise from the city of Lima in order to get better prices and higher profits.

Jesmin will use her new 2500 new sol loan to buy a dozen hooks, 50 combs, 50 mirrors, 1 package of colored ribbons, 100 decorations, 100 appliqués, 200 buttons in assorted sizes and styles.

Jesmin works just like her husband to be able to meet household expenses and to manage later on to provide their son with a good education.

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise like hooks, zippers, combs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty S. lives in the Makerere neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Betty has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 15 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Betty sells her product from home. Betty has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling water.

The main business challenge for Betty is transportation. She aspires to build rental rooms   Betty lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves, D. 52 años, es una mujer muy cautelosa y observadora. Vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su esposo LiB., D. 62 años ya que sus 4 hijos son mayores y vive fuera con sus respectivas familias.  Hace más D. 10 años doña Nieves en su casa, después D. sus labores domesticas, se dedica a tejer tapetes a crochet, chompas, prendas que tiene mucha demanda en la temporada D. invierno, asimismo venD. bisutería en general. En todo este tiempo, esta emprendedora madre D. familia con los  ingresos que se generaba, junto con su esposo educó a sus hijos; que ahora son personas D. bien. Por ello, con mucha pasión realiza cada uno D. sus trabajos manuales, que tiene buena aceptación en el mercado. Por lo tanto, se ha propuesto nuevos planes; que es el D. vender papel bond y hojas cuadriculadas en su casa, D. ese modo logrará solventar las necesidades D. su hogar. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a su compañera con quien trabaja por muchos años y que los dos se apoyan y tratan D. salir adelante. D. obtener el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. papeles bond, asimismo desea comprar materiales para la elaboración D. chompas como, lanas e hilos D. colores.
texts.en: Nieves is 52 years old, a prudent and careful woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband LiB., 62 years old, since their 4 children are grown and live with their respective families.  For more than 10 years, Nieves, after doing her housework, has maD. crocheted runners, sweaters, and garments that are very much in demand in the winter.  She also sells costume jewelry.  During all this time, this enterprising mother, with the income generated, along with her husband, raised her children, who are now doing well.  Thus, she works enthusiastically when performing her manual tasks, which is well received in the market.  Therefore, she has new plans; she will start selling only bond and graph paper out of her home, and thus cover household expenses.  This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she promises to pay the installments punctually, since she does not wish to cause problems for her companion, whom she has worked with for many years, for the two of them support one another and try to get ahead.  If she secures the requested loan, she will buy bond paper as well as buying materials for the fabrication of sweaters, such as wool and colored thread.

loans.use: To buy bond paper, wool, thread

loans.name: Luis Eusebio

texts.es:
Luis es padre de familia de cuatro hermosos hijos. Cuenta con su propio negocio el servicio de taxi con trece años de experiencia. Iniciando con un carro personal que tenia, el  cual vendió y compro un lada el cual ha sido su fuente de trabajo.
Cuanta con el apoyo de su esposa quien también labora para el apoyo de la familia, en donde junto han logrado hacer mejora a su vivienda con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado mediante cinco ciclos.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo dará mantenimiento a su taxi, en el motor, compra de aceite, filtro, banda, con el objetivo de seguir laborando en mejores condiciones como dar un buen servicio de viaje a  sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis is the father of four beautiful children.  He has his own business offering a taxi service and he has thirteen years experience in the business.  He started out with a car that he already owned.  He then sold his car and bought a Lada which has been his source of work.

Luis has the support of his wife who also works to support their family.  Together they have managed to improve their home with loans that Afodenic have granted them over five loan cycles.

Luis will use this new loan to have some maintenance work done on his taxi's engine.  He will buy oil, filters and belts.  This way, he will be able to continue working in better conditions and provide his customers with a good service.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his taxi's engine, buying oil, filters and belts, in order to provide his customers with a better service

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Vanesa V. le está haciendo falta las protecciones de las ventanas, colocar puerta al frente y pintar su vivienda al frente.
Esta solicitando el préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar las mejorar que requiere su vivienda. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una tienda de muebles para el hogar, en el aria de vendedoras. 
Ya que su esposo el señor  Pedro Arturo De La Cruz se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como agente de ventas de una tienda de electrónicos y aparatos para el hogar.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Vanesa V. lacks the protection of windows and a front door, as well as paint on the exterior.

She is requesting a loan since she currently does not have the necessary funds to make the improvements that her home requires. Vanesa plans to repay the loan with the income that she earns from her job at a home furnishings store located in a shopping center.

Her husband Sr. Pedro Arturo De La Cruz is in charge of the family expenses with the salary he earns from his job as a sales agent at an electronics and home appliances store.

loans.use: To pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh B. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and 6-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a one-bedroom studio apartment that he bought with savings from when he and his family used to work in Korea. 

Batmunkh has operated a taxi service in the city since 2008 and has gained a lot of experience. He enjoys transporting people and is a trusted driver for his many customers. 

Batmunkh is a humble and optimistic person. He is planning to buy a two-bedroom apartment in the future. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy some spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Biyinzika Group,bulenga-Kampala

texts.en: Ronald N. is 45 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school.  He is a stickler for diligence and hard work, which have positively impacted not only on his six-year clothing sales business but also his family's standards of living. He has given a new lease on life to his family with earnings from his clothing sales business, which he operates in Bulenga, a growing suburb in the metropolis of Kampala. To get established in this business, Ronald relied on a loan to purchase clothing. What has made his business grow successful is the fact that Ronald strives to bring in new bales of clothing to sell almost every week, which is popular with both his old clientele and his new clients. The future looks bright for Ronald and he says with this loan, his business will continue to imporve. At present, this business generates weekly profits of 120,000 shillings. He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more bales of clothes that he can resell and make additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase of more bales of clothes

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Pablo Antonio es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa Del Peñón del departamento de León. ES felizmente casado y tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo a los que debe proporcionarle las condiciones de vida para que ellos se desarrollen.

Pablo cuanta con una casa de habitación pero tiene problemas con el techo. Es por este motivo que el destino del crédito es para la compra de zinc para el mejoramiento de su techo, ya que esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su vivienda y así cuando entre el invierno no tener problemas y así beneficiar a su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo Antonio lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Penon of the department of Leon. He is married and he has 4 children in his care. 

His house is in a poor state of repair and there are problems with the roof. This loan will be used to purchase zinc to improve the roofing. This will help him keep his home in better condition, especially when the winter comes. This will help him maintain his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase zinc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 45 years old, married and living in the village of Rizaluna Cordon, Isabela. She has three children who are generally adult-aged. Cristina has been in the businesses of motorcycle transport and retail shop for almost four years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 monthly. Cristina would be thankful if her requested loan would be approved because she would buy new wheels and sprockets for her motorcycle. 

In the future, Cristina hopes and prays that she can maintain the business she manages for her children's needs and for the development and expansion of her business. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000.

loans.use: to buy new wheels and sprockets for her motorcycle

loans.name: Juana Felicitas

texts.es: Juana Felicitas, es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras, tiene 62 años es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. comida, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes para la preparación D. alimentos. Juana tiene un puesto D. venta D. comida en el mercado Santa Clara. Le gusta FINCA Perú por sus capacitaciones y porque le dan crédito a base D. confianza, se pueD. ahorrar, con sus ahorros construyó su casa y está educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana Felicitas is a member of the “Emprendedoras” communal bank.  She’s 62 years old, married and has 7 children.  She sells food.  She will use the loan to buy groceries used to prepare her food.  Juana has a food sales stand in the Santa Clara market.  

She likes FINCA Perú because of the training and because loans are granted based on trust, because one can save.  She used her savings to build her house and is educating her children.

loans.use: to buy stock items at wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia lives in Uganda and is a single mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members (a cousin and her daughters). Leonia has operated a pub business for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT in order to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local brews.

Leonia also gets additional income by selling piped water. She works from her home seven days a week. Leonia's business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She hopes to see her business grow big, to own a fully stocked bar, to buy a plot of land and to educate her children up to university. Leonia lives in a two-room house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy beer and local gin

loans.name: Elva

texts.fr:
Cliente de 32 ans, mariée avec 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 12 ans. A l'obtention de son Brevet d'études Technique , n'ayant pas trouve du boulot elle ouvre un restaurant en 2007, ou elle vend des plats de poissons d'eau douce , de poisson sale, de bouillon de viande et poissons grilles.
Elle vend en moyenne 27.000 a 35.000 fr par jour et ses potentiels clients sont les vendeurs dans le marche ou elle vend.
Des qu'elle va recevoir son prêt elle va faire des stocks et s'approvisionner en produits qu'elle n'arrive pas a acheter a cause des moyens,tel que cartons de soles, capitaines , cartons de queue de bœuf, cartons de morue, bidon de 25l d'huile, aménager son restaurant et ajouter quelques couverts.

A l'avenir avec ses benefices ,elle compte épargner et ouvrir un restaurant moderne.
texts.en:
A 32-year-old client, married with 3 children ranging from 2 to 12 years old.  In 2007, after earning her technical degree, and being unable to find work, she opened a restaurant where she sells dishes of freshwater and saltwater fish, meat broth, and grilled fish.

She brings in an average of 27,000 to 35,000 Congolese francs each day, and her potential customers are salespeople in the market that she sells in.

Once she receives her loan, she plans on purchasing supplies that she is having difficulty affording right now: boxes of sole, nile perch, boxes of oxtail, boxes of cod, a 25-liter jug of oil, equipment for her restaurant and several table settings.

In the future, she wants to save her profits to open a modern restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase saltwater fish, smoked fish, ocean fish, jugs of oil and bags of onions.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
José Rolando tiene 36 años de edad, el vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el caserío llamado Arbusto Punto 9 en el distrito de Lambayeque, en una zona rural del este distrito.

José Rolando se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte público, el cuenta con una mototaxi (moto, con cabina para transportar personas). Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años.  En este tiempo el a adquirido clientela fija, experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente cría animales los acules al alcanzar su peso y tamaño ideal los vende en el mercado local a negociantes de la zona o eventualmente a vecinos y amigos del lugar.
	
José Rolando está  solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800  nuevos soles para poder realizar un mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, y para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales.
 
José Rolando es una persona bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las personas que lo conocen lo consideran una persona amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás.
texts.en:
Jose Orlando, 36, lives with his parents in a rural area of Peru's Lambayeque district.

Jose Orlando has operated a taxi business for 2 years. He owns a mototaxi (a motorcyle with an attached cabin for passengers).
