He is an experienced businessman now and has a regular group of customers for the business.  He earns extra money raising and selling animals.  When the animals are ready for market, he sells them to local merchants or to friends and neighbors.  

Jose Orlando is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new soles loan to pay for work on his mototaxi and for supplies for his livestock business.

Jose Orlando is a hard-working man, striving from day to day to get ahead in the world and improve his quality of life.  The people that know him consider him to be friendly and always willing to help others.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance for his taxi business.

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es: Carmen Beatriz: de 24 años de edad,y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles,ya que esta convencida de que le falta capital para trabajar,ella nos cuenta que le a hido bien en su negocio,ya que sus clientes han aumentado, el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande y distribuir el producto a las otras tiendas y darles un futuro de muchas oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en: Carmen Beatriz, 24, has two children.  She sells groceries.  She is asking for this loan to buy foodstuffs because she’s convinced that she needs working capital.  She tells us that she’s done well in her business because her clientele has increased.  Her dream is to have a larger locale and to distribute products to other stores and to provide many opportunities for her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.es: Sabrina, de 32 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en casa de su padre junto a su hermano, abuelita, cuñada, tres sobrinos, sus dos hijos y su esposo.El trabajo de Sabrina consiste en salir a ofrecer sus productos, ella vende ropa de segunda en los caseríos y comunidades nativas cerca de la ciudad, además ella invierte parte de su dinero en la compra de sierras y discos de aserraderos, este trabajo lo hace ya varios años, y la venta de ropa desde hace un año.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disponer de tiempo para sus dos actividades, además que siempre hay ingresos, en estos momentos esta bien con su negocio, prefiere mantenerlo así y espera poder consolidarse en lo que hace.Este es el séptimo préstamo entre Sabrina y la institución MFP, se siente bien en el grupo que conforma pues dice que todos son muy responsables, además refiere estar súper contenta con trabajar con la institución pues le dan la oportunidad de crecer en su economía.Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará ropa de segunda, además de discos de aserradero para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Sabrina, age 32, is a happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her father’s house with her brother, grandmother, sister-in-law, her brother’s three children, her two children, and her husband.

Sabrina’s work consists of going to sell her products.  She sells second hand clothes in the villages and indigenous communities that are close to the city.  She also invests part of her money by purchasing saws and saw blades.  She has been doing this for several years.  She has been selling clothes for one year.

What she likes about her work is being able to have time for both business activities.  Also, there is always income.  She is now doing well with her business, and she prefers to keep it that way.  She hopes to be able to consolidate what she does.

This is Sabrina’s seventh loan with the MFP institution.  She feel good being in her group, and she says that they are all very responsible.  Also, she reports that she is super happy working with the institution.  They give her the opportunity to grow financially.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy second hand clothes and discs for saws that she will later sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes and discs for saws that she will later sell.

loans.name: Malik

texts.ru: Малик проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Малик у себя дома имеет мельницу. Он занимается производством муки. В этой области он более пяти лет. Кредит берет для закупа пшеницы.
texts.en: Malik lives in the Rudaki region. He is 49 years old. He is married and has six children. His wife is a homemaker. Malik has a mill at home and does flour production. He has been in this business for more than five years. He is taking out the loan to buy wheat.

loans.use: to buy wheat

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 39 years old. She lives in the village Bardubani with her son Tornike, 20 years old, and daughter Natia, 18 years old. 

Tamar is leading the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have three milk cows. Tamar produces 60 kg of cheese per month and sells it on the local market. Also they own vineyard with 2000 grape vines and sell grapes. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Tamar requested credit to change the roof of their house. Their roof is already old and can’t keep out the rain and snow. After repairing the roof, the house will become more comfortable and the family members will have improved their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for changing the roof of their house.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has six years of experience working as a home electrician. He works upon request from clients. He assists his father who works as a plumber to satisfy the family needs. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase electrical tools and supplies. He feels positive about his business prospects and looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase electrical tools and supplies

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more charcoal to sell. Felma has been in this business for 18 years. She also earns income from coconut vending.
Felma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stationery

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis tiene 18 años, es soltero y dice que ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque sus padres no tenían los recursos para solventar sus gastos de la escuela. Pero dice que la mejor herencia que sus padres le han dejado es el trabajar la tierra. Dice que también él se dedica a la construcción en la capital del país ya que es donde le pagan un poco mejor y que de ahí sacara para dar los pagos del crédito. El pidió un crédito para la compra de plantas de aguacate por que quiere hacer su propia huerta que es su gran sueño él dice “quiero hacer mi propia huerta para tener algo en donde trabajar y hacerme responsable y tener algo propio para cuando me case pueda sostener a mi familia”. Dice que cuando es temporada de Aguacate el ayuda a sus padres a vender el fruto en diferentes poblaciones. Luis está agradecido por la oportunidad de darle un crédito y de tener confianza en él”.
texts.en: Luis is 18 years old. He is single and says that he could not continue his studies because his parents did not have the resources to pay for his schooling. However, he says that his parents have given him the skills and knowledge to work the land. When it is not growing season, he works in construction in Mexico City, where they pay higher wages, so he can make loan payments. He applied for the loan to purchase avocado trees because he wants to make his own orchard. He says, "I want to have my own orchard to have a place that I am responsible for and that I can use to provide for my family when I get married."  During avocado season he works with his parents selling the fruit in different towns. Luis is thankful for this opportunity and that people are confident in him.

loans.use: grow and sell avocados

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 34 years old and married, with two children, neither of whom attend school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years. Agnes requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for resale. She will use her extra income to pay for her children to attend school.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Vinda

texts.en:
Vinda is a 38 year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 20 and 7 years.   Four of them are in school.  She has had a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan, for two years.

Vinda requested this loan through BRAC,  South Sudan, to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is from Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Joyce is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Joyce is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as candies, shampoo and soaps.  Joyce has been in her business for over ten years and earns approximately PHP 5,955 a month from these activities.

Joyce is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  In 2010, Joyce joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Bertha María

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer de 49 años, divorciada y madre de dos hijos. Ambos están actualmente estudiando, el mayor en el colegio y el menor en la escuela. Viven en la Cooperativa "13 de Abril" de la ciudad de Santo Domingo.
Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Bertha trabaja vendiendo ropa casual desde hace 20 años; trabaja de lunes a sábado durante todo el día. Esto le ha permitido a ella mantener a sus hijos y darles una vida modesta. Ella desea invertir en mercadería ya que en esta época navideña las ventas incrementan considerablemente, lo que le permitiría tener un ingreso extra para así poder seguir adelante con su hogar. A pesar de que la cobranza a los clientes cada día se hace más difícil por la crisis económica ella se mantiene optimista ya que cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes.

Ella espera pasar unas felices navidades junto a su familia y con esta inversión podrá darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 49 year old woman, a divorced mother of two children. Both of her children are in school. The oldest is in high school and the youngest in elementary school. The live in the "13 de Abril" housing cooperative in the city of Santo Domingo.

Santo Domingo de los Colorados is one of the youngest cities in the country, the meeting point of the sierra and the coast. It is a privileged place, not just for its ethnic heritage, but for the unusual landscapes that can be seen at the very entrance to this beautiful city. Santo Domingo de los Colorados belongs now to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was recently formed. The main festival of Santo Domingo is celebrated with many tourists and commerce and cultural exchange. There is a big fair in the facilities of the Cattle Rancher's Association. There the best examples of the different breeds of cattle from the region are shown.  

Bertha has worked selling casual clothing for 20 years. She works from Monday through Saturday all day long. This has allowed her to support her children and give them a modest life. She wants to invest in merchandise since at this Christmas season her sales go up considerably, allowing her to have extra income to get ahead in her home. Despite collecting from her customers, every day it gets harder due to economic crisis. She remains optimist since she has a good clientele.

She hopes to have a merry Christmas with her family and with this investment, she will be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es: Reynalda es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio, tiene 59 años, vende medias e interiores en el Mercado, es madre de 8 hijos, es casada, siente que ha progresado poco a poco, aunque le falta mucho pero le gusta mucho Finca porque  ahorra. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en comprar mas mercadería para fin de año. Reynalda aprendió mucho de las capacitaciones que recibió en su Banco Comunal, como ser responsable y manejar bien su negocio.
texts.en:
Reynalda, age 59, is a member of the Milenio communal bank.  She sells socks and underwear at the market.  She is married and has eight children.

She feels that, little by little, she has progressed, even though she has a long way to go.  She really likes Finca because she saves.

She will use the loan that she is now requesting to buy more merchandise for the end of the year.

Reynalda learned a lot from the trainings that she got in her communal bank.  She learned things like being responsible and managing her business well.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with five children. Gloria is 61 years old, residing at Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Gloria plants and harvests bananas and coconuts for sale to earn a living, and she has been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 6,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, Gloria wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jesus Gabriel

texts.es:
Jesús es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y sus tres pequeños hijos a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Jesús pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta seguir trabajando y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, Jesús trabaja como chofer de taxi, él cuanta con un auto el cual utiliza para poder realizar su labor, adicionalmente Jesús también trabaja brindando servicios de movilidad trasladando a personal a fundos, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Jesús se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento de su auto, compra de un juego de llantas y renovación de documentos de conducir, de esta manera Jesús tendrá su auto en mejores condiciones, así el espera seguir brindando sus servicios y aumentar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su casa propia y así poder brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.

loans.use: Para realizar el mantenimiento de su auto, compra de llantas y renovación de documentos de conducir.

loans.name: Safiya Ali

texts.en: Safiya is 30 years old. She did not marry yet. Safiya graduated from the University of Hargeisa faculty of midwifery. Now she is getting her MBA in midwifery through distance learning. It is not possible to learn online without a computer and she cannot buy a laptop. She struggles with the fee of the University. She approached Kaaba MFI to get the laptop as a loan. Fortunately, Kaaba provided her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments. Now she can access the University website any time and she can download previous lessons and learn easily.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es:
Gloria, de 47 años de edad, vive actualmente en Acapulco en donde tiene su negocio. Está casada y es madre de tres hijos de 29, 30 y 31 años de edad, quienes ya no dependes económicamente de ella.
Hace tres años, inició un negocio que ofrece servicios de papelería, café internet y reparación de computadoras y celulares, ya que de esa manera encontró un ingreso fijo y la forma de ser independiente. 
Su sueño es hacerlo crecer hasta lograr crear una cadena con muchas sucursales. Con esta motivación, Gloria ha solicitado un crédito que le ayudará a comprar más mercancía de papelería para poder incrementar su inventario y sus ventas, dando un mejor y más completo servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: comprar más mercancía para poder incrementar su inventario

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married with six children. He started his business in the year 1992. He has not taken any formal training in rope making. He received an equivalent of $143 as loan from PEMCI to increase his stock which he repaid successfully. With the second loan of $150 he plans to boost his business further and hence his earnings. Ropes play a bigger part in the lives of the local communities as they are used for animals, housebuilding, clothlines etc. He carries the ropes fro one market to another benefitting the  local communities.

loans.use: To Boost rope making/selling business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Mrs. Nancy D. is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is familiar with the TEACH Lending program. She also knows basic accounting principles. She needs a loan of $900 to buy hair dryers.

loans.use: Buying Hair-Drying Machines.

loans.name: Sanah

texts.en:
Sanah is 46 years old and has two children to care for.  The eldest is a boy and the younger one is a girl, both of whom are in school. Since her husband passed away a couple of years ago, Sanah is the only one who supports her family. 

Sanah is a tough and smart lady. She does a simple and small business selling small packs of liquid laundry soap on credit by going around the village. Sanah can earn $8 per day from her business. She needs a loan of $50 and is willing to repay it within a period of a year.

loans.use: to buy more laundry soap

loans.name: Faleata

texts.en: Toddlers, youngsters, and youth within the community love Faleata T.’s baking.  Even better, she sells it by the village school most of them attend.  This is her financial contribution to her family, as she is a 38-year-old wife and mother of four schooling children.  For the previous two years, Faleata's business has been enlarged with the help of the S.P.B.D. loan she received.  It was used to buy ingredients and with the money from sales, Faleata provides for everyday family needs. Now she is asking for another loan to continue to expand her micro-business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for baking

loans.name: Latif

texts.en: Latif is a 36 year old local resident of the Khachmaz Region in Northeast Azerbaijan. He has been a taxi driver for more than three years. He is married. His car is old and brakes down very often. He wants capital to repair his car. He has applied to Normicro's Khachmaz branch to borrow $1000 for this business.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida H. is a 40-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. She has 10 years of experience in this business. Now Valida needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Nyai

texts.en: Nyai J. is 36 years old and has a 13-year-old daughter. She earns about $20 a day selling snacks and household goods at her small grocery store. Her husband, Jamudin, is a laborer who earns about $1 per day. Nyai has applied for a $125 loan to expand her business by acquiring more items to sell in her store. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru:
Ahliddin T. is 31 years old, has graduated from high school, has two children. Ahliddin owns a store dealing in automotive supplies. His store is located on one of the central markets in the city of Yavan. He has been running his business for the last 5 years. Mr. T. is planning to use the money from the loan to expand his stock of merchandise, specifically he is planning to buy a large shipment of spare parts. This loan will help the local car owners to be able to buy spare parts for their vehicles, as the next automotive store is located about 50 miles from Yavan. Mr. T. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Толибов Ахлиддин, возраст – 31 год, образование среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Ахлиддин имеет магазин по продаже запчастей для автомашин. Он иимеет магазин на одном из центральных рынков города Явана. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 5 лет. На полученный кредит Ахлиддин хочет увеличить свой товарооборот, то есть закупить большую партию запачных частей. Этот кредит поможет местным владельцам транспортных средств приобретать необходимые запчаси для своих автомобилей, так как в близлежащий рынок находится в 80 км от города Явана. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Patrick E.

texts.en: Mr. Patrick E. is 44 years old and has 2 children. He hails from Benin-city, Edo-state, Nigeria. He sells drugs and treats patients and has been in business since 1994. He is the secretary of his union and has been a LAPO member for 3 years. He is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for sale

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Born in 1950, Aissatou has been a member of the Village Bank of Hathioume for 7 years and has received 17 loans, all of which she has repaid without problems. She buys and re-sells brooms made in the traditional fashion out of saplings. She is the mother of a family. She has significant experience in this business, and her income allows her to meet the needs of her family. Aissatou is asking for this loan to strengthen her business and intends to repay it at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1950, Aissatou est membre du BV de Hathioume depuis 7 ans et eu à bénéficier de 17 prêts qu'elle a remboursé sans problème. Elle achète et revend des balaies de fabrication artisanale faits à partir de tiges d'arbres. Elle est mère de famille. Elle a une bonne expérience dans l'activité qu'elle mène et ses revenus lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Aissatou sollicite ce prêt pour poursuivre son activité et propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy brooms

loans.name: Azhghar Shah

texts.en: Azhghar Shah lives with his family in District 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has been leasing a retail shop for more than two years, but now requests a loan to complete his purchase of the store in order to increase his profits, thereby enabling him to better support his family.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To complete his lease purchase

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is twenty eight years old and the mother of three children. All the children are in school. She has been selling frozen foods, like chicken, fish and beef, for two years. Her operation has been the main source of income to her family. She must travel twice a week to buy frozen foods from Takoradi, about four hours drive from her village.

She wants to use her loan to buy more cartons of frozen food to increase her inventory and income in order to better support her children’s education. She plans to start savings with this loan so that she can register her family to join the Government’s health insurance scheme. Mary is a member of the group called N. Ye N. (meaning "God is God"). Members guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen foods like chicken, fish, and beef

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. S., 39, is married with 1 child.  She has 2 years of experience in the Canteen/Bingo business. Her canteen sells to the schools, but bingo will be held in the village 5 days per week. This is her second loan from SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (approximately 291 USD).  SPBD loans are Theresa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband has left already for New Zealand.

loans.use: To fund her canteen/bingo business

loans.name: Anyesi

texts.en: Anyesi is a resident of Kitunda area in Dar es Salaam. He runs a shop selling common traditional attire, called kanga and vitenge. He has two shops in Kitunda area and has plans to open more. He is in need of a loan to help him expand his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Olga De Jesus

texts.en:
Olga has worked sewing uniforms for nurses for two years. She is requesting this loan to purchase cloth, buttons, zippers, thread, and other things she needs for the uniforms. She is in the process of developing and expanding her business and, when she is not sewing, she spends a lot of time visiting schools to advertise and take orders from the schools and/or the students. She says that she works specifically in uniforms, as opposed to sewing clothing in general, because she can buy all that she needs for less because she doesn't need as much variety in the supplies and it is therefore more economical. She currently has an order for 50 uniforms, for which she needs to buy two rolls of cloth and other supplies to be able to fulfill the order. This loan would help her a lot with this order and in having a good stock of all her supplies to continue working and expanding her business.

Olga is married and her husband works as a fireman and a nurse. They have five children between the ages of four and twenty-two. Although Olga only had the opportunity to study up to the third grade when she was young, the education of her children is a very important priority for her, and all her children are studying or have already graduated. Additionally, she has worked to continue studying herself, and has studies nursing but hasn't worked as a nurse because she has been raising her children.

Olga has many dreams for her business and her family. She wants to expand her business and would like to include sewing bedding, such as sheets and bedspreads. She says that she would sew elegant and large bedspreads, as there is a lot of demand for these products. She also wants to make improvements to her house. She already has her own house and in a good location, but she would like to add another level. More than anything, she dreams that her children can become professionals and have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Olga ha trabajado cosiendo uniformes de enfermería por dos años. Esta pidiendo este préstamo para comprar tela, botones, zíperes, hilo, y otras cosas que necesita para los uniformes. Ella está en el proceso de desarrollar y aumentar su negocio y, cuando no está cosiendo, pasa mucho tiempo viajando a los colegios para hacer publicidad y para tomar los pedidos de los colegios y/o directo de los estudiantes. Dice que trabaja específicamente en uniformes, en vez de en la costura de ropa en general, porque se puede comprar todo que necesita por menos porque no necesita tanta variedad en las provisiones y, por eso, es mas económico. En este momento tiene pedido 50 uniformes, para que necesite comprar dos rollos de tela y otras provisiones para poder cumplir con este orden. Este préstamo le ayudaría mucho con este orden y en tener una buena reserva de todas las provisiones para seguir trabajando y aumentando su negocio.

Olga es casada y su esposo trabaja como bombero y enfermero. Tienen cinco hijos de edades entre 4 años y 22 años. Aunque Olga solamente tenía la oportunidad de estudiar hasta tercero básico cuando estuvo joven, la educación de sus hijos es una prioridad muy importante para ella, y todos sus hijos están estudiando o ya han graduado. Además, ella misma ha trabajado para seguir estudiando y ha estudiado la enfermería pero no ha trabajado como enfermera porque ha sido cuidando sus hijos.

Olga tiene muchos sueños para su negocio y para su familia. Quiere agrandar el negocio y le gustaría incluir la costura de ropa de cama, como sabanas y cubrecamas. Dice que cosería cubrecamas elegantes y de tamaños grandotes, porque hay mucha demanda por productos así. También tiene ganas de mejorar su casa. Ya tiene casa propia y bien ubicada, pero le gustaría añadir otro nivel. Más que nada, sueña que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales y que tengan una vida mejor.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, buttons, zippers, thread, and other things to sew uniforms

loans.name: Halid

texts.en:
Halid I. is a twenty-five-year-old businessman. He is single and very focused. Halid has been a beef seller for eight years now. He buys his supplies from Techiman, a 50 km distant town, and retails the meat to his customers.

With his meager working capital, he is not able to buy larger quantities to make enough income. With this loan, he wants to buy beef in bulk so as to serve his customers with good quality beef for their meals. He believes the loan will allow him to have the resources to expand his business. He belongs to the community group called Butchers' Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to facilitate repayment of the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of beef for re-sale

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola es D. la tercera edad, pero es una señora muy trabajadora que esta en perfecto estado D. salud. Confecciona guantes D. lana D. alpaca y llama manualmente, vive  en la zona Progreso (ciudad D. El Alto) con su nieta D. 16 años y su esposo en una casa como cuidadora, no paga alquiler . El esposo trabaja D. portero, dicha ocupación es la principal fuente D. ingreso que cubre los gastos familiares. 

Por su edad le negaron créditos en otras instituciones.

Es por eso que con su ayuda Paola piensa usar el l crédito para  comprar materia prima (lana D. alpaca y llama) ya que desea impulsar su negocio incrementando su producción

Es su tercer crédito  con IMPRO, su buen comportamiento D. pago le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Paola is an elderly woman, but she is a very hardworking lady who is in perfect health. She makes gloves from alpaca and llama wool by hand. She lives in the zone Progreso (city of El Alto) with her 16-year-old granddaughter and her husband in a house as a caretaker; she does not pay rent. Her husband works as a doorman, and this occupation is the principal source of income that covers the family expenses. Because of her age, she has been denied loads from other institutions. With your help, Paola plans to use her loan in order to buy raw materials (alpaca and llama wool) that she wants to kick-start her business by increasing production.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi

texts.id:
Walaupun Saat ini Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi sebagai tenaga honorer pada sekolah tingkat kanak-kanak. Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi tetap tidak meninggalkan usahanya beternak babi. Karena sudah mempunyai satu ekor induk Sri Kuntari Dewi ingin mengembangkan usaha ternak dengan memelihara anak babi untuk dipelihara secara pengemukkan dengan harapan pendapatan akan lebih besar. Semua ini dilakukan karena saat ini setelah menikah dengan I Komang Nyeneng belum dikaruniai anak maka masih belum terlalu sibuk sehingga masih dapat memelihara babi sebagai kesibukan yang dapat menghasilkan uang tambahan. 

 Melalui lembaga yang ada didesanya Sri Kuntari Dewi mendapat dana pinjaman  dari Yayasan DINARI. Dana tersebut dipakai untuk membeli tiga ekor bibit babi yang akan dipelihara selama 4 s/d 5 bulan. Selain mendapat dana pinajaman juga memperoleh  pembinaan dan training tentang kesehatan ternak babinya yang dilakukan secara oleh berkala dari Yayasan DINARI.Keuntungan yang diperolah selama  4 s/d bulan  dapat memcapai Rp.400.000,-dari hasil beternaknya ketut sri kuntari dewi dapat memperoleh pendapatan tambahan selain dari  pendapatan I Komang Nyeneng suaminya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi is a contracted employee in a kindergarten school. At home, she raise piglets as her side job. She has had a pig mother and wants to purchase piglets that could be raised to increase income. She has all the time to manage because even though got married with I Komang Nyeneng, they have not had any children yet. Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi earned DINARI foundation's loan through traditional organization in her village. She used the loan to purchase 3 piglets that would be raised for 4 up to 5 months. Not only loan, DINARI Foundation also gave trainings that teach i Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi to take care of the piglets, including to keep the piglets healthy. Ni Ketut Sri Kuntari Dewi could earn Rp 400,000 within 4 up to 5 months, as an additional income to support her family daily life.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana Dyah Kuntari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fodder

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. Los Ceticos Mz. 41 Lt. 3 AAHH. “Próceres de la Independencia”, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio y tiene el apoyo de su hija. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes reparte su mercadería a sus clientes. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 docenas de blusas, 4 docenas de faldas, 3 docenas de pantalones, vestidos para niñas, etc.

Nancy manifiesta alegría por todo lo que ha logrado en la vida. Tiene el deseo de ampliar más su negocio para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the Communal Bank “El Paraíso”, located at Jr. Los Ceticos Mz. 41 Lt. 3 AAHH. “Próceres de la Independencia”, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 44 years old, mother of 5 children, 4 grown and 1 still dependent upon her, she is married and her husband is an independent laborer. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 she invested in selling clothing. She has been working with the communal bank for a year. Today she has that same business and has the support of her daughter. In the mornings she takes care of her home and in the afternoons she distributes her merchandise to her customers. With this loan for S. 1,200, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 2 dozen blouses, 4 dozen skirts, 3 dozen pairs of pants, dresses for girls, etc. Nancy is happy for everything she has achieved in her life. She has the dream of expanding her business for her family’s continued well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 2 dozen blouses, 4 dozen skirts, 3 dozen pairs of pants, dresses for girls, etc.

loans.name: Tayessir

texts.en:
Tayessir is a 47-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2002. He makes doors and windows. Tayessir requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase iron for his business. Tayessir has been a micro-credit client for five years now and has always repaid on time.

A loan had helped Tayessir buy a piece of land on which he could build his shop. He is speciA. in his work because he has a good rapport with his clients and has competitive prices. His clients are his neighbors and others. When he first started, he faced some difficulties; he didn’t have enough cash to start his business. If he decided on doing this work, it is because of his experience and his good quality of work. In the future, he plans to buy merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase iron for his business

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Fredy tiene 21 años, es natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, vive en casa de sus parientes, ya que aun es soltero. Se dedica a la repartición de gas (para las cocinas) a domicilio, en motocicleta recorre las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca  en busca de un mejor porvenir, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años para poder mantenerse, ya que al terminar sus estudios secundarios y no tuvo muchas oportunidades de seguir con los superiores, es por eso que se dedica tanto a su trabajo, pues sabe que gracias a él sale adelante, también está buscando prosperar estudiando una carrera técnica, para lo cual no dispone de mucho tiempo. Lo más difícil de su trabajo y un poco peligroso es tener que correr con su moto por las calles de Juliaca para llegar a tiempo a las casas de sus clientes cuando se lo solicitan. Él se encuentra en su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, sabiendo de la importancia de su responsabilidad, es muy puntual en los pagos. Para bienestar de Fredy el negocio va bien y las ganancias son buenas, pero espera mejorar, por ello, con la cantidad que solicita comprará más balones de gas y así distribuirlos.
texts.en:
Fredy is 21 years old and is from the city of Juliaca. Since he is still single, he lives with relatives. He earns a living by delivering gas (for kitchens) to people’s homes. He crosses the city of Juliaca on his motorcycle, looking for better opportunities. He has done this for the past 3 years in order to support himself. When he finished high school he didn’t have very many opportunities to continue with higher education so he is very dedicated to his work because he knows that thanks to his job, he is getting ahead. He is also looking to study a technical field that won’t take too much time. The most difficult and dangerous part of his job is speeding through the streets of Juliaca on his motorcycle in order to arrive on time at his clients’ houses. This is his 4th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Realizing that this is an important responsibility, he is always on time with his payments. Luckily for Fredy , business is good and his earnings are good, but he hopes for something even better. To improve his business, Fredy will use this loan to buy more gas tanks to distribute.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gas tanks

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: A resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia, Mrs. S. earns a living by growing different kinds of vegetables for sale at the market. She currently runs her business on her own farmland behind her house which is located in a good place for sales. She is 25 years old and a widow who has given birth to one small daughter. To earn additional income and to grow the business, S. would like to ask for a US$ 100 loan to buy more vegetable seeds and fertilizer to help her in growing vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma H. D. G., vive en Lourdes Colon, Vilma es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Vilma se dedica hace cuatro años a la venta D. Cosméticos y ropa D. manera ambulante, es decir casa por casa , Vilma se decidió a llevar asi su negocio para no descuidarse D. sus hijos;  ya que todas las mañanas cuando ellos se van a la escuela , Vilma aprovecha para ir a ofrecer sus productos tocando D. puerta en puerta, y en la tarD. cuando sus hijos ya están en casa ella se queda al pendiente D. ellos,  pero sin dejar su negocio a un lado, ya que los vecinos y clientes D. las colonias aledañas saben que por las tardes Vilma venD. en su casa; toda su variedad D. productos en lociones y ropa. Ana Vilma solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería y poner D. manera formal un pequeño bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
Ana Vilma H. D. G. lives in Lourdes Colon. Vilma is a single mother and she lives with her two young children. Vilma has been selling cosmetics and clothes from door to door over the past 4 years. Vilma decided to do this so that she can be attend to her children at all time. This way, when her kids are at school, she can take advantage of selling her products from door to door. Once the children are off school, she then takes care of them. This doesn't mean that she ignores her business since all the neighbors in the area know or are aware that Vilma sells from her home in the afternoons. She sells a variety of products such as lotion and clothes. Ana Vilma is requesting this loan in order to purchase more products (stock-up) so that one day she will be able to have a designated area in her home where she puts all her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta M. D. L. D. 47 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango junto a su hijo menor. Ella posee una tienda la cual lleva por nombre “Bendición D. Dios”. Como madre soltera Marta debe trabajar muy duro para poder proveer a su hijo D. todo lo necesario y así mismo para mantener su hogar. Es por ello que ella desea mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, ya que no posee un lugar para colocar muchos D. sus productos, esta es la razón por la cual solícita un préstamo, para poder comprar dos estantes D. metal y una vitrina en la cual pueda colocar sus productos y puedan ser visibles para los clientes. Marta desea obtener estos estantes y poder aumentar sus productos, con el fin D. poder obtener más ganancias, las cuales contribuyan a su economía familiar.
texts.en:
Marta M. D. L. is 47 years old and resides in Soyapango together with her younger son. She owns a store by the name of “Blessing of God”. As a single mother, Marta needs to work very hard to be able to proviD. for her son everything necessary as well as to maintain her home, and for this she wants to improve the condition of her business. She does not currently have anywhere to place many of her products and for this reason she is asking for a loan to be able to buy two metal stands and a display cabinet in which she can place her products and they can be visible to customers. Marta wants to obtain these stands and be able to increase her products in order to be able to obtain more income which contributes to her family’s finances.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy display stands for the store

loans.name: Theodora

texts.en: Theodora A. is 35 years old, and married with four children. All her children are currently in school. Theodora runs a hardware business and sells paint, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes etc. at cape coast, a town where she has lived with her family for fifteen years now. She buys her supplies from importers in the greater Accra of Ghana. She also sells used clothing at her store. Theodora requests this loan to expand her shop to include the sale of suitcases. She would be very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of assorted paints, nails, sand paper, hammer and used clothing etc.

loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is engaged in the hog-raising business. She raises hogs for four months before selling them to her customers. One hog costs PHP4,000 to PHP6,000, depending on its size and weight. She wants to purchase additional piglets, so she is requesting a loan of 5,000.00. She will also allot some of the loan to buy a supply of feed.

She is hoping that she could continue to make her business grow, for it really helps her in sustaining the needs of her family and supporting the education of her youngest child. She believes that being patient and diligent in her business is the key to becoming successful in life.

Siony is 38 years old. She is married to Herminigildo, a farmer. They have five children: Heny-Anne, a 21-year-old elementary graduate; Hemaculada, a 20-year-old high-school graduate; Jilbert, a 19-year-old high-school undergraduate; Juan, a 17-year-old elementary graduate; and Jeneva, a 15 year old who is presently studying in high school and hoping that she can pursue her college education. She is hoping that someday, they will able to improve their poor living conditions by means of hard work and patience.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Temurdjon

texts.en:
Since he was a young boy Temurdjon has known how to work. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist, and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of a family he still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents Temurdjon now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can provide his loved ones a more promising life.

Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive, but without them his production will not improve. With the part of the loan he will also buy young cattle. You can help Temurdjon keep moving forward with his development plans.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: For seeds, fertilizer, and young cattle

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en: Bashiru is 60 years old and married with ten children. He has a drinking bar where he sells drinks to make a living.  He is requesting  a loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody belongs to a poor family in their village. She always aims to become successful in life in order to give her child and future children a better and comfortable living condition. In this regard, she encouraged her husband Domingo to earn and save for the future of their family through venturing into a direct-selling business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 10,000 as additional working capital for the said business. Her husband also works as a welder in Subic

They both sacrifice for the future welfare of their children. According to her, she is able to gain a net income of PHP 2,500 monthly which she uses to support their daily needs and to pay some monthly bills and expenses. Through the loan, Melody is hoping that she will be able to help her husband to uplift their living condition into a progressive one someday.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Mohan Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Mohan Maiya R. lives in Tangal, located in Lalitpur district, an area where most people are engaged in small business. Mohan has two sons, one currently studying in grade 12 and the other passing his SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam this year.

Both she and her husband operate a small restaurant, a business they started nine years ago. They sell a variety of items, including tea, coffee and Newari food for which there is a high demand. Now Mohan is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 loan to both expand her business and purchase necessary food materials.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her business.

loans.name: Santos Delfino

texts.es: Don Santos Delfino B. C., cuenta con 34 años de edad casado vive con sus tres hijos reside en el Paraje Pacruz, del Cantón Chuixchimal, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, es graduado en maestro de instrumentos musicales, cuenta con una pequeña Academia de música trabaja como docente en un establecimiento educativo, hace más de 8 años para querer mejorar sus ingresos se acercó a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo, para poder ampliar su academia actual ya que la demanda de varios alumnos esta creciendo y para poder dar servicios a las demás persona necesita comprar más instrumentos musicales para poder tener mejores opciones, así poder darle a su clientela un servicio mucho mejor, también mejorando sus fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Santos Delfino B. C. is 34 years old, married, and has three children. They reside in Paraje Pacruz in the Chuixchimal sector of Totonicapán, District of Totonicapán. He graduated with a degree in instrumental conducting from a small music academy and now works as a teacher at an educational center. For 8 years, he has wanted to improve his income so he visited the offices of Asociación ASDIR.

Don Santos wants to expand his music program because student demand is increasing and he wants to provide lessons to as many as possible. He needs to buy more musical instruments so that he can provide better options. This way he can give his clients better service, which will improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase musical instruments

loans.name: Sil

texts.en: A great housewife, with good management skills, from the developing country of Cambodia, L. has a family with five children. One of her children is married and lives away while the other four are still living with her. Fortunately, two are employed. One is a garment worker and the other is securitor in a company. This helps the family live more comfortably. L., 43, is married to Hien, 49. Hien works in the commune office as public staff. The family has been able to save from the salaries. Recently, the family decided to upgrade their living standard by purchasing a motorbike. They want their younger children to finish university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Cette dame est une étudiante qui a finit ses études de gestion à l’université de Lomé. Ne trouvant pas un emploi à son goût, elle a décidé l’année dernière de se lancer dans la vente de téléphones portables dans la zone portuaire. Ses portables proviennent de la France et de l’Allemagne et elle connaît un vrai succès dans ce commerce. Pour lancer une nouvelle commande, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 40 téléphones portables. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This woman is a student who has finished her studies in management at the university of Lomé. Unable to find a job to her liking, last year she decided to begin selling mobile phones in the port area. Her mobile phones come from France and Germany, and she has had great success in this business. In order to place a new order she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 40 mobile phones. She is not married and has no children in her care.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile phones

loans.name: Dicasaran

texts.en: Dicasaran D. is from the village of Malaigang, Iligan City. He is 76 years old, is married, and has twenty-one adult children. Dicasaran owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling of goods in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Dicasaran joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lal Agha

texts.en: Lal Agha son of A. is single and he lives with his own family. He is a very honest, hard working and talented man. He works in Jalalabad city and has been working in the same area for more than 9 years. During this time, he has not been able to increase his business of potatoes, onions and fresh vegetable business. He trying money time but he couldn’t when he found the AFS (Ariana Financial Services and Joint Stock Company) he applied for an individual loan to buying more vegetables for his shop. He is happy with this loan process in Jalalabad Afghanistan and hopes that this can be a successful process in his country in the future.

loans.use: He want to completed his stocks

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State where she sell medicine and has been in the business for the past 16 years. With the profit she makes from the business, she takes care of her family. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a mother of 3 and she is 45 years old. Esther sells food items at retail prices within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profit during and after the season. Esther hopes for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more inventory to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Javier

texts.es:
el sr. NELSON JAVIER M. L. se dedica a la ganaderia y caficultura desde hace mas de 10 años, 
es padre de 2 hijos y con los ingresos que le genera este negocio cubre los gastos familiares.
esto le a permitido ir creciendo poco a poco, ahora se le presenta la oportunidad de comprar terneros a un buen precio y no quiere perder la oportunidad de comprarlos.
tambien el se dedica a la caficultura y dentro de unos 2 meses se aproxima la corta del cafe y desea  alcanzar excelentes precios al momento de la venta de su café para prepararse para el año que viene.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier Nelson M. L. has been focused on cattle ranching and coffee growing for over 10 years. He is the father of two children, and with the income that his business generates, it covers family expenses. This has allowed him to grow little by little, and now he has the opportunity to buy calves at a good price and does not want to lose that opportunity. Javier also grows coffee, and within two months, he can begin selling it and wants to achieve excellent prices when selling his coffee so that he can prepare for next year.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves for pasture

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en:
Adenike is 34 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Adenike sells clothes and drinks to her customers. With the combined businesses, she helps the husband to support the family's basic needs and other necessities.

With the loan of N50,000, Adenike plans to expand her clothes and drinks business, which is now booming. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to better provide for her children's education.

Adenike also owns a hairdressing business offering hairstyling services in a location that is very favorable for most of her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and drinks to sell

loans.name: Marta Edit

texts.es: Marta Edit C. L. D. G. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y su hijo D. 9 años D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. frijoles, arroz, azúcar y otros tipos D. productos comestibles. Su negocio es D. mucha ayuda ya que les permite solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que Marta solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos como granos básicos, aceite y más. Marta es una personal muy responsable la cual desea mejorar las ventas D. su negocio, ya que ella como la mayoría D. personas vela por el bienestar D. hogar.
texts.en:
Marta Edit C. L. D. G. is 42 years old and lives in the Department of Usulután with her husband and her 9 year old son. She sells beans, rice, sugar, and other types of food products. Her business helps a lot since it permits them to meet all the household expenses. It is for this reason that Marta requests a loan through which she will be able to buy more products such as basic grains, oil, and more. Marta is a very responsible person who wants to improve the sales of her business since she, like most people, looks out for the well being of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains

loans.name: Labeeb

texts.en:
Labeeb is a 62-year-old married man with two children. He is a carpenter, making furniture in Nablus, Palestine, which he has done since 1980. He uses his income to pay for his family's daily expenses and his children's college fees.

Labeeb will use the loan to purchase wood and carpentry tools. With the new profits from his expanded business he plans to reinvest for the expansion of his business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and carpentry tools

loans.name: Palmera Group

texts.es: El grupo Palmeras está integrado por tres féminas trabajadoras y con deseos de autosuperarse. Estas son Paulina F. E. quien vende prendas Romanel,   Rosa Esmelda M. quien vende chancos y Aracely Mercedes S. que comercializa ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Palmeras Group consists of three hardworking women who want to improve themselves. They are Paulina F. E. who sells Romanel clothing, Rosa Esmelda M. who sells pigs, and Aracely Mercedes S. who sells secondhand clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
El nacatamal es una de las comidas típicas de Nicaragua que son elaborados por personas con mucha experiencia en el ramo y aunque en varios países quieren elaborarlos, nunca han tenido el sabor como los nacatamales de Nicaragua.
La señora Arely C. se dedica a la elaboración de los nacatamales siendo este negocio el que le permite obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de la actividad y por ende de su familia. Ella solicitó el crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de dichos nacatamales y así venderlos a sus clientes todos los fines de semana en el departamento de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Nacatamales are a typical food in Nicaragua. They are made by experienced cooks and even though people in other countries have tried to make them, they do not taste as good as those from Nicaragua. Ms. Arely makes nacatamales, this being the business that provides her an income to support herself and her family. She requested this loan to buy ingredients for her nacatamales, in order to sell them to her customers in the Chinandega department on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
Zoila Rosa M. G. tiene 36 años y vive con su esposo y hijos.  Tiene 4 hijos, 3 varones y una mujer.  Sale uno de sus hijos en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura sembrando mora, papas, y maiz.  Tiene un chancho también para vender cuando se gorde.  Va a vender el chancho en la plaza en Guaranda.  Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la mora en la compra de liquidos y remedios.

Quiere que sus hijos hagan algo en la vida y sean una profesión, porque desea que ellos no sufran como ellos ya que trabajar en el campo es bien duro.  Le gustaría viajar a otros paises si es una posibilidad.
texts.en:
Zoila Rosa M. G. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and children. She has 4 children, 3 boys and 1 girl. One of her sons is shown in the picture. She belongs to the solidarity group “Mushuc Nan”, a Qechua name that means “Camino Nuevo” in Spanish (“New Road” in English). This is a group of 18 women that work in agriculture. They belong to the community of Guantug Cruz in the canton of Guaranda. They all have a strong desire to work with loans to get ahead in life. Zoila works in agriculture growing blackberries, potatoes and corn. She has a pig to sale when it fattens up. She will sell the pig in the main square market of Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to work on her blackberry crop and buy liquids and pesticides. She wants her children to do something in life and become professionals; she does not want them to suffer since farm work is very hard. She would like to travel to other countries if it becomes feasible.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy liquids and pesticides to work on blackberry crop

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Damas  Trabajadoras ” se conforma gracias al deseo de sus integrantes  de mejorar su calidad de vida  , la mayoría de sus integrantes  ya  realiza actividades productivas, actividades. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Josefa R. quien posee un Kiosco(venta de bebidas y alimentos de todo tipo en pequeñas cantidades), ella vende bebidas e general  y ademas alimentos como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso , y otros. Es una señora muy trabajadora y que sueña salir adelante ya que anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles un mejor horizonte que el que a ellas les toco vivir.
El crédito fue utilizado para la compra de mercaderías como bebidas en general y también para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de alimentos
texts.en:
The “Damas Trabajadoras” (Working Women) Committee was formed thanks to the desire of its members to improve their quality of life. The majority of its members are involved in productive activities.

One of the members is Josefa R., who manages a kiosk where she sells beverages and food of all kinds in small quantities. The food that she sells includes beef empanadas, chicken empanadas, ham and cheese empanadas, and other items. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of moving forward and achieving a better future for her children. For this reason, she works twice as hard to provide that brighter horizon in which they can live. Her loan will be used to buy merchandise such as beverages in general and also ingredients for food preparation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages & ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 34 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, cultiva principalmente alfalfa, que le sirve para alimentar a sus cuyes y vacas; y la ruda, que es una hierba aromática típica de su localidad. Tiene grandes extensiones de terreno en su  zona, heredados de sus padres, permitiéndole tener ingresos económicos. Desde entonces, cada 15 días sale a ver sus cultivos de ruda, para cortar las flores y llevarlas al mercado, en donde sus compradores son Hierberos que utilizan de estas flores para curaciones naturales. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable porque cada quincena percibe ganancias, además sus plantaciones le duran en promedio de 3 años, lo que no sucede con otros cultivos, como la papa o el maíz.  Para el futuro desea adquirir más terrenos y aumentar el número de reses y cuyes que tiene en su granja. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera de mucha importancia este crédito, ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas, para sembrar en otros  terrenos  más alfalfa y ruda, a fin de que su negocio perdure por mucho tiempo y que sus animales nunca le falte alimento.
texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Rocío is a single mother who lives with her two children in her own house. She has worked in agriculture and farming for 15 years. Her principal crops are alfalfa, which she feeds to her guinea pigs and cows, and rue, which is an aromatic herb native to her area. She inherited large tracts of land in her region from her parents; she generates income from this land. Every 15 days she visits her fields of rue to cut the flowers and take them to the market. Herbalists buy the flowers and use them as natural curatives. The sale of flowers is very profitable because she receives income every two weeks, and the plantings last 3 years on average, which is not the case with other crops such as potato or corn. In the future, she wants to acquire more land and increase the number of cattle and guinea pigs on her farm. This is her eighth loan from MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma, local lending institution). She is very responsible with her payments and considers this loan very important. It will be very useful in the growth of her business. This loan will be used to purchase bags of fertilizer and seeds and to sow more alfalfa and rue on other land, so that her business will last for a long time and her animals will never lack food.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer and seeds of alfalfa and rue

loans.name: Huralgan

texts.en: Huralgan A. is 29 years old and lives with his wife in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. Huralgan operates a transportation business in his town.  He transports sand, gravel and stones with a truck he owns. In addition to this business, he also provides a garbage removal service to local households. He earns 30,000 tugrugs (~  21 USD) for transporting sand and gravel, and 25,000 tugrug (~ 18 USD) for loading garbage. He usually loads garbage three times per day. Huralgan has been operating his business since 1991, and has become an experienced driver.  Generally the demand for his business is high. Huralgan has been planning to purchase a car to operate a taxi service during the evening to earn extra money for his family. With his business profit, he has been saving money for the car. Huralgan says, “Loading garbage is not  easy work to do. Especially during the winter when the working conditions are very bad. However, I like to help people and my customers really appreciate my work and that makes me happy. ” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~  1465 USD) loan to contribute money to purchase a Korean car to operate as a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a car to operate as a taxi

loans.name: Eugenio Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor M. es un cliente y pescador artesanal de la zona costera de Chinandega en la zona de de la península de Venecia a unos 80 km de la ciudad de Chinandega 
Por su lejanía con la ciudad el acceso a la energía eléctrica es muy difícil por lo que este cliente decidió solicitar el préstamo para la compra de un panel solar y así mejorar las condiciones de vida
texts.en:
El señor M. es un cliente y pescador artesanal de la zona costera de Chinandega en la zona de de la península de Venecia a unos 80 km de la ciudad de Chinandega Por su lejanía con la ciudad el acceso a la energía eléctrica es muy difícil por lo que este cliente decidió solicitar el préstamo para la compra de un panel solar y así mejorar las condiciones de vida

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de panel solar para generar energia

loans.name: Sam Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sam Oeun S. is a farmer while her husband is a duck breeder. She is a 49-year-old villager who lives in Roneam Tnaot village in Takeo province. With the businesses, they earn a small income to support their family. Mrs. Sam Oeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy 200 more ducks to enlarge her husband's business. This couple has three children: one is a car mechanic and the other two are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy 200 more ducks

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha C. is 45 years old and a villager who lives in Peam Reang village, Kandal province. She was selected as the group leader of a loan which consists of five people. With the loan, all the members hope to increase their income to improve their family's living. Mrs. Sokha C. sells groceries to earn a small income to support her family's living. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Chan Yin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for growing crops. This couple has four children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory while the fourth is also a grocery seller who supports her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jaime Yasir

texts.es: Jaime Yasir E. H. de 35 años de edad, vive junto a su grupo familiar, el cual esta conformado por su esposa, la cual se dedica a trabajar como profesora, así mismo junto a su hija de 12 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar en la escuela que trabaja su madre. Jaime posee una tienda en la cual comercializa  diferentes productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, jugos, productos para el hogar, entre otros más. El negocio es bastante completo, por lo que posee muchos clientes, los cuales son vecinos y personas de los alrededores de su casa, en donde se encuentra ubicada la tienda, la cual se encuentra en Ilobasco, departamento de Cabañas. Jaime ofrece muy buenos precios, los cuales son bastante accesibles y más bajos que los de su competencia, por lo que desea comprar mayor cantidad de productos y de esta forma ofrecerlos a precios aún más bajos. Jaime solicita un préstamo por medio del cual compre productos de primera necesidad por mayor, así mismo comprar productos que han sido lanzados al mercado recientemente y que son muy solicitados por los clientes y que aún no posee. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de mejorar su negocio y de esta forma percibir mayores ganancias las cuales sean de gran beneficio para su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
35-year-old Jaime Yasir E. H. lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife, who works as a teacher, and his 12-year-old daughter who studies at the school where her mother works. Jaime has a store in which he sells various basic necessities, such as dry beans and grains, juices, and home goods. He carries a wide array of goods, so he has a lot of customers among his neighbors and others near his home, where his store is located, in Ilobasco, department of Cabañas. Jaime offers good prices that are affordable and lower than those of his competition. Therefore, he wishes to buy greater quantities of his goods, so he can offer even lower prices. Jaime is seeking a loan in order to buy basic goods wholesale, as well as to buy goods recently launched on the market that are in much demand by his customers and that he still does not have. He does all this with the desire to improve his business in order to increase his profits, which will be very beneficial for his family and home.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic necessities

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
This group loan includes four people located in Trapeang Kralaong village, Takeo province. Mrs. Pov C. is the leader of the group loan. She was selected by the four members. Each member of this group loan will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Pov C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living and she is also a broom seller. She is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to support both businesses, Mrs. Pov C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to grow rice and to buy broom supplies to support her broom market. Mrs. Pov C. is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and broom supplies

loans.name: Charity Faith

texts.en:
Charity Faith T. is from Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 29 years old. Charity Faith is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Charity Faith owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Charity Faith has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charity Faith joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charity Faith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charity Faith is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Charity Faith from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Makhamali

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Makhamali L..  She is married and has three children aged 14, 12 and 5.  In 2010, she established her vegetable selling business.  Working five days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to increase the inventory in her store.  In the future, Makhamali plans to continue and increase her business.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh vegetables are purchased from the local farmers and sold.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:  BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for selling

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Carlos Mauricio G. le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como mensajero de una compañía.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Antonia Hernandez esposa del señor Carlos Mauricio ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Carlos needs a fence to go around his house. He is requesting a loan in order to buy the material as he is in charge of making the improvements. He plans to repay the loan with income from his work as a messenger for a company. The person pictured is Antonia, Carlos' wife, since he was at work the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a fence around his house

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
