Cecile C. is from Labuyo, Tangub City. She is 45 years old, widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Cecile owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products such as food for snacks, candies, shampoo, noodles, canned goods, etc. in the local community. Cecile has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Cecile joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan that Cecile has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine T. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  Fish Vending and Vegetable vending businesses. She lives in Prk. Maitom, Brgy. Bonawon, Siaton, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since October 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fish vending and vegetable vending businesses,  she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 8000 PHP. Josephine is now borrowing  17,000 PHP so that she  can  purchase fishing gear and equipment.   This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

 Josephine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora Clentina D. es socia del banco comunal San Vicente, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro que  pertenece a la parroquia de la Victoria del Portete, en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población ha salido a la ciudad a trabajar en varias actividades como también han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora. Clementina tiene 66 años, es viuda hace 3 años y tiene 7 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y  viven  independientemente con sus familias. Con el trabajo de ella y si esposo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, también cría cuyes, pollos y vacas  que vende en su propia comunidad y cuando tiene alguna reunión sacrifican algún animalito para compartir en familia. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y sus productos los vende en la ciudad o en su comunidad.
 
Es nuestra socia hace 3 años en los que ha compartido junto a la banca comunal y tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras, su nuevo crédito va a invertir en pollos y también va a comprar su alimento.
 
Su sueño es  conservar su salud.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clentina D. is a member of the San Vicente community bank.  She lives in the city of San Pedro, which is part of the Victoria del Portete parrish.  Most people in the city are involved with farming and agriculture and have come to this city in search of a better job.

Clentina is 66 years of age and has been a widow for 3 years.  She has 7 children who are older and live independently with their families. She and her deceased husband built their own home with earnings from her business.

Clentina works performing household chores and also raises guinea pigs, chickens and cows, which she sells in her town. She also grows her own vegetables and sells her produce in her city.  
 
Clentina has been a community bank member partner for 3 years, and has great friendships with all the other bank's partners.  This new loan will be used to purchase chickens and chicken feed.
 
Her dream is to stay healthy.

loans.use: Comprar pollos y alimento de animales.  (to purchase chickens and animal feed)

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Argentina M. S. ella es Trabajadora activa del Colegio  público CERMA desempeñándose como Directora del Colegio tiene  dieciocho años de trabajar para el ministerio de educación. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina M. S. works at CERMA, a public school.  She works as the director of the school.  She has worked for the education ministry for 18 years.

She has had five loans with CEPRODEL.  She has used each one to buy construction materials and improve her house.  The CEPRODEL loans have been extremely beneficial to her.  That is the way she improved her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials: zinc and crossbeams

loans.name: Gazpar Filemon

texts.es: El Sr.Gazpar  tiene trabajando mas de un año en una compañía Funeraria en el area de ventas y cabranza, el es divorciado con una niña la cual en ningun momento ha dejado desamparada, el siempre esta al pendiente de ella, quedo en buen termino con su pareja y se turna el cuidado de la menor, por lo mismo nunca ha dejado de darle a su casa las mejoras necesarias, para tener un hogar limpio y acojedor para el y su niña. ya que como buen padre todo lo hace pensando en el bienestar de la misma.Es por eso que el Señor Gazpar solicita este credito, para tener una mejor calidad de vida, al construir una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda, y darle mas seguridad a la misa.
texts.en: Gazpar has been working at a funeral home in the sales division for more than a year. He is divorced and has a little girl who he has never left without shelter. He is always looking out for her. He remains on good terms with his ex-wife and they take turns caring for their daughter, and for this reason he has never stopped making improvements to his home because he wants to have a clean and cozy home for himself and his little girl. As he is a good father, all his thoughts are for her wellbeing. It is for this reason that Gazpar is requesting this loan - to have a better quality of life. He will build a fence at the back of his property so that his daughter will be safer.

loans.use: To finish building a fence in the back part of the property.

loans.name: Dora Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dora; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, ella es soltera; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de autopartes, ella trabaja con su conyugue en su pequeña tienda y se dedican a ofrecer productos para autos, desde forros de asientos, luces, protectores de timones y otros, la socia se alterna con su pareja y viajan a la ciudad de Lima y/o a la ciudad de Juliaca,  ya que en estas ciudades se encuentran hasta fábricas de accesorios para autos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de accesorios.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the "Los Lideres" community bank, located in the Huanchac distrct of Cuzco province.

Dora (36) is single. She and her spouse have a small automobile parts store, where they sell everything from seat covers, through lights to wheel covers. She and her spouse take turns to travel to the cities of Lima or Juliaca to buy stock at the factories where the components are made. She wants the loan to invest in stock of vehicle accessories.

Dora is grateful for and values this loan and undertakes to repay on schedule.

loans.use: Purchase of automobile accessories for resale

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilu tiene 45 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora y muy amable, vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. El negocio al que se dedica Marilu, es la venta de productos de belleza  y prendas de vestir, siendo ofrecido estos productos a sus familiares, amigas y demás vecinos de su barrio, a quienes les deja a crédito. Por ello, los fines de semana recorre las calles casi todo el día,  para llegar a casa de todos sus clientes y cobrarles, en la que lleva como  6 años en esta labor. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo es la comunicación de sus clientes, además de las buenas ganancias que le genera este negocio, con ello puede cubrir los gastos del hogar. En adelante, tiene planeado poner un negocio más estable, asimismo construir su casa. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntal con el pago de sus cuotas. En su grupo comunal, es un socia muy responsable y preocupada por el bienestar de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Marilu, age 45, is a friendly hardworking mother. She lives at her parents’ house with her husband and their two daughters. Marilu has a business selling beauty products and clothing. She offers these products to relatives, friends, and residents of her neighborhood and extends credit to them. On the weekends, she spends almost the entire day traveling through the streets visiting the homes of her customers and collecting payments. Marilu has been in this line of work for six years. What she enjoys most about the job is communicating with her customers. In addition, her business generates a good income that enables her to cover the household expenses. In the future, she has plans to have a more stable business as well as build a house.

This is her fifteenth loan with MFP. She promises to complete her payments on time. In her Communal Bank, Marilu is a very responsible member who is concerned about the well-being of her group. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more beauty products so that she can fulfill her outstanding orders.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure is 28 years old.  He is married and has one child who is two years old. Bonaventure sells clothes, mainly women's clothing, and has had this business for a long time.  Currently he employs two people.

Bonaventure has requested a loan to expand his business by adding a variety of styles such as men and children's clothing. With this loan, Bonaventure has a vision of purchasing large bales of clothing to wholesale and retail at the same time to increase his revenue.  If successful, he hopes to continue building a secure future for his family.

loans.use: To buy men and children's clothing to resell

loans.name: Manuel Donaldo

texts.es: El señor Manuel vive en la zona del Plan 3000 en el barrio Toro Toro, se dedica ya hace 10 años a la chapería de autos, actualmente tiene su propio taller que funciona a cuatro cuadras de su casa, por lo general realiza el chapeado completo de movilidades como ser autos y camionetas. Su esposa trabaja como recepcionista medio tiempo con lo que le ayuda con sus gastos familiares, mientras que a sus hijos los cuida su suegra.  A la semana realiza el chapeado de una a dos movilidades dependiendo del trabajo, por este motivo solicito el crédito para poder  arreglar con urgencia una de sus maquinas que se encuentra en mal estado y comprar los materiales necesarios para terminar el trabajo de dos movilidades que tiene en el taller. El señor Manuel desea ampliar su taller y poder contratar operarios para realizar un trabajo más rápido y además poder comprar su propia casa debido a que actualmente esta viviendo en la casa de su suegra.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in Toro Toro neighborhood, in Plan 3000 district.  He has been a panel beater for 10 years.  He currently has his own workshop four blocks from his home.  He does work on vehicles such as cars and trucks.  His wife works part time as a receptionist which helps him with their family's expenses.  His mother-in-law looks after his children while they are both at work.

During the week, Manuel works on one or two vehicles, depending on the job.  He is requesting a loan so that he can urgently fix one of his machines that is in bad condition.  He would also like to buy the materials he needs to finish work on two vehicles that he currently has in his workshop.

Manuel would like to expand his workshop and be able to hire workers so that he can do his work more quickly.  He would also like to be able to buy his own home because he currently lives in his mother-in-law's house.

loans.use: To buy putty and paint.  To fix his welding machine

loans.name: Edith Grissel

texts.es:
La señora Edith A. tiene 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pequeños; su hija mayor se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita de su zona el otro es todabía es muy pequeño. Edith vive en  la zona de Maica central ubicada en la provincia Cercado de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Ella trabaja extrayendo la leche que producen sus vacas, luego vende esa leche y una parte la destina para la elaboración de quesillo de buena calidad para luego comercializar el producto.
Edith es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a la producción y comercialización de leche y quesillo de buena calidad. Ella quiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para sus vacas y pueda mejorar la producción de leche que obtiene diariamente; Ella agradece mucho a la gente que por medio de Kiva le puedo dar la oportunidad de superarse dotándole de los insumos necesarios para el alimento de su ganado lechero.
Edith entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para comprar más vacas y pueda mejorar sus ingresos y por ende lograr un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edith A. is 28 years old and has two small children.  Her eldest daughter studies at the little local school.  Her other child is still very young.  Edith lives in the central Maica area in the province of Cercado in the city of Cochabamba.  She raises dairy cattle and sells part of the milk she obtains and uses the rest to make high quality cheese which she also sells.

Edith is a very hard-working person.  She produces and sells high quality milk and cheese.  She plans to use the loan to buy feed for her cattle aimed at improving her dairy production.  She is grateful to all those people who, through Kiva, are giving her the opportunity to improve her situation by buying the necessary feed for her dairy cattle.

loans.use: To buy feed for her dairy livestock

loans.name: Danisa Elena

texts.es:
la señora Danisa Elena B. H. tiene 38 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos, Danisa se dedica a la venta de paletas, charamuscas y frescos.
Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, Danisa tiene casa propia.
su negocio, la venta de paletas surgio hace unos dos años cuando su esposo le dio la idea, ya que el da clases en un colegio en donde van bastantes alumnos y todos ellos son clientes en su mayoria, este tipo de producto es muy vendido, ya que la zona Sur de Honduras es muy caliente y con estas paletas y charamuscas se refrescan los alumnos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar los materiales para hacer sus deliciosas paletas.
 
danisa es una mujer honesta y de principios cristianos, su sueño es tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
Danisa Elena B. H. is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  Danisa sells popsicles, 'charamuscas' (a frozen treat) and soft drinks.  Her husband helps her to cover their household expenses and they own their own home.

Danisa started her business, selling popsicles, two years ago when her husband gave her idea. Her husband teaches in a school where there are a lot of students, a lot of whom are customers.  This type of product sells very well since it is very hot in the south of Honduras and the students refresh themselves by eating these popsicles and 'charamuscas'.

Danisa will use her loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her delicious popsicles.  She is a decent woman of Christian principles whose dream is to own a large business.

loans.use: To buy milk, fruit, sugar, flavorings, cups, sticks and bags

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 42 سنة متزوج وله 5 اولاد يعمل في محل لبيع الالبسة الرجالية وغيره له في عمله  نحو 13 سنة يحب عمله ويلقى منه اهتمام كبير حيث انه دائم التجدد في البضائع يريد له ولعائلته الدعم الاجتماعي والمادي يسعى دائما الى تأمين العيش الكريم للعائلة له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم في زيادة مدخول المحل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تقوية المصلحة وشراء بضائع موسمية جديدة
texts.en: Hussein is 42 years old and married with 5 children. He has been working for the past 13 years in a men’s clothing store. He is very much engaged in his work, perpetually seeking new apparel to showcase. Hussein is driven to provide a dignified life for his family. The last loan from Al Majmoua was very helpful in increasing the store’s revenues; Hussein now wanted to seek another loan to purchase merchandise for the new season.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jorge Orlando

texts.es: Jorge Orlando vivió durante su juventud  en las calles y se sostuvo trabajando en lo que fuera, sin embargo con el paso del tiempo Jorge logró establecerse y actualmente tiene una charcutería y quiere tener un mejor surtido en su negocio además de poder montar uno nuevo de comidas rápidas para darle empleo a 2 de sus hermanas que lleven mucho tiempo sin poder establecerse en un empleo estable.
texts.en: Jorge Orlando lived in the streets during his youth and supported himself any way he could. However with the passage of time Jorge managed to establish himself and now has a sausage shop.  He wants to stock it better and also start a new, fast food, business in order to provide employment for two of his sisters who haven’t been able to find stable work for quite some time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Estrella Del Consuelo

texts.es:
En una localidad llamada Tierras Amarillas del cantón Rocafuerte cada quince días  se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Mejorando El Futuro, este sector es conocido por su agricultura ya que gran parte de sus habitantes se dedican a los sembríos de ciclo corto.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Estrella, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, la menor de ellos vive en su casa. El marido es comerciante de frutas.
 
Tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días  desde las 07h00 hasta las  a las 19h00.  Nos cuenta que tiene su comedor por más de 25  años y que este le ayudo a sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia, ella preparar además de comida las deliciosas salchichas las cuales son muy apetecidas por sus  clientes ya que como dice nadie las prepara mejor.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el segundo ciclo del banco y le gusta porque siempre la han sacado de apuros. Su sueño es comprar un carro para que su esposo venda sus productos ya que anda en un triciclo.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the 'Mejorando el Futuro' (Improving the Future) community bank meet in the town of Tierras Amarillas, in Rocafuerte canton.  This area is known for its farming since a large number of its inhabitants work in short-cycle agriculture.

Here we meet Estrella who is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  They have four grown-up children.  The youngest still lives with them in their home.  Estrella's husband is a fruit salesman.

Estrella has a small restaurant in her home in which she makes delicious meals.  She works every day, from 7.00am to 7.00pm.  She tells us that she has owned her restaurant for more than 25 years and that it has helped her to get her children and family ahead in life.  She doesn't only make meals but also delicious sausages which are very popular with her customers since, as she says, nobody makes them better than she does.

Estrella will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients for making her meals.  She has been a member of her community bank since its second loan cycle and she likes being a member because it has always managed to get her out of tight spots.  Her dream is to buy a car which her husband can use to sell his products since right now he uses a three-wheeled vehicle.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients for making her meals

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap M. is a security guard. His wife, Chanrotha Run, is a silk weaver. They have been married since 2000, and have three sons. Two attend school and the third is still very young. 

In the past, Sopheap was a motor taxi driver, but he quit the business and he is now a security guard. He commutes to work in Phnom Penh by his motorbike everyday. Unfortunately, the motorbike is old and breaks down and he spends a lot of money to make frequent repairs. Facing this, he wants to sell the old motorbike and supplement money from the loan to purchase a new motorcycle. 

Photo: Mr. Sopheap M. and his wife

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle to drive to work

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna S., from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela, is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna has been raising pigs for fattening and sale for over 12 years, earning approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 18,000 PHP that was used to purchase breeding livestock, she is now requesting her fifth loan for 18000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Lorna plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Julieth Verónica

texts.es:
Contribuir con los gastos del hogar fue el propósito con el que Julieth Verónica G. inició su peluquería, pues aunque sus sueño es ingresar a la universidad la falta de recursos económico no se lo ha permitido, por ello, se dedicó al oficio que desde pequeña aprendió al lado de su madre. 

A sus 19 años de edad, Julieth se caracteriza por su responsabilidad, es por ello que de domingo a domingo esta joven emprendedora trabaja en su peluquería en la que además vende productos de belleza. 

En el futuro, Julieth espera crecer su negocio hasta que sea reconocido en la ciudad, por ahora, necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos de belleza y así mejorar su inventario e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Julieth started her salon with the goal of contribuiting to paying the household expenses. Although her dream is to go to university, the lack of economic resources has prevented her from doing this. So, she is working in the trade that she has learned at her mother's side since she was little. 
At 19 years old, Julieth is characterized by her responsibility. For this reason, from Sunday to Sunday, this young entrepreneur works in her salon in which she also sells beauty products. 
In the future, Julieth hopes to grow her business until it is well know in the city. For now, she needs a loan to buy beauty products and so to improve her inventory and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Dalia Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Dalia Sonia S. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de un hijo, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en un colegio de una comarca aledaña al municipio donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de veinte años para el aprendizaje de los niños.
Cuenta con su propia vivienda, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un juego de sillas y un ropero para regalo a su madre, por tal razón decidió solicitar su tercer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en: Dalia Sonia S. is from the city of El Sauce.  She has a son.  She has taught primary school at a school in the region bordering the city for more than twenty years.  She has her own house, and now she needs to obtain a set of chairs and a wardrobe to give to her mother.  For this reason, she decided to ask for her third loan with Ceprodel in order to meet her need.

loans.use: to purchase a wardrobe and a set of chairs

loans.name: Eulanie

texts.en:
Eulanie is 38 years old and is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 17 years of age. Her husband works as a farmer.

She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has been growing rice for seven years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, vegetable and fruit seeds. In the future, she hopes her children will finish studying and serve God.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, vegetable and fruit seeds

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo es conviviente con la señora Alberta más de 18 años, tienen 8 hijos dependientes que estudian de diferentes edades, familia muy humilde viven en Colomi calle 13 de noviembre entre Cochabamba zona sud hace 2 años atrás.                                                                                                    

El señor Leonardo es transportista y agricultor, nos dice que anteriormente en la producción agrícola le fue muy mal por esa razón el compro un vehículo sacando un préstamo de un Banco para trabajar con pasajeros de Colomi hacia Cochabamba y viceversa, pero sigue cultivando papa, haba, oca por lo cual ellos se apersonaron a solicitar un crédito porque necesitan dinero para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla de papa.

El Señor Leonardo y su esposa se sienten felices por haber tenido esta oportunidad, que ahora ellos quieren volver a sembrar en más superficies teniendo mejores ingresos económicos con las dos actividades que realiza transporte y producción agrícola y asi brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 8 hijos tanto en el estudio como para una vida mejor hacia el futuro.
texts.en: Leonardo has been married to his wife Alberta for 18 years, and they have 8 children.  They reside in Colomi, Cochabamba, Bolivia.                                Leonardo is a driver and farmer.  In years past, harvests were meager so he obtained a loan to buy a vehicle to transport passengers between Colomi and Cochabamba.  Aside from driving, he continues to grow potatoes and beans and seeks this credit in order to obtain fertilizer and crop seed.  With this assistance, Leonardo plans to expand the amount of land under cultivation and better provide for his 8 children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow potatoes

loans.name: Henry Francisco

texts.es:
Henry Francisco tiene 21 años, es soltero vive con los padres y no tiene hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Henry se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Su sueño es superarse, llegar a tener casa propia y comprar un vehiculo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Henry Francisco is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who all work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Henry is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Henry is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  His dreams are to improve himself, to own his own home and to buy a vehicle.

Henry enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Mauro Nicolas

texts.es:
Mauro Nicolas tiene 27 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Mauro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial S. y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

En los timepos libre le gusta hacer deporte y viistar a los padres no viven cerca.
texts.en:
Mauro Nicolas is 27 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Mauro is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial S. and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Mauro is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. He faces challenges such as pests attacking his crops.  His dream is to own his own home.

In his spare time, Mauro enjoys taking part in sports and visiting his parents who do not live nearby.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: La señora Fortunata se dedica al comercio de verduras, las  compras los realiza en Quillacollo y esta posteriormente lo comercia en la localidad del Chapare, realiza una venta semanal los días sábados y domingos, actualmente vive en domicilio en alquiler,  se dedica a la actividad del comercio de verduras desde hace tres años actividad donde le va muy bien, solicito este crédito para la compra de verduras por mayor,   sus dos hijos viven con ella y su esposo trabaja en el campo, se trasladaron a la ciudad ya que con la producción agrícola que tenían, no podían sustentar la mantención de sus familia por este motivo buscaron mejores oportunidades, ella es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Fortunata is a vegetable merchant. She buys her products in Quillacollo and sells them in the town of Chapare every Saturday and Sunday. Fortunata currently lives in a rental property. She has been selling vegetables for three years and has done very well.

Fortunata is requesting this loan so that she can buy vegetables in bulk. Her two children live with her and her husband works in the fields. She and her husband moved to the city with the crops that they produced because they were not able to support their family. For this reason, they decided to search for better opportunities. Fortunata is a hardworking individual and appreciates the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Ana tiene 34 años vive en la ciudad de Otavalo en San Luis vía a Punyaro con sus hijos, es soltera, sus hijos tienen 14 y 10 años.

Ana es una persona feliz, trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Trabaja en la confección de pijamas para niños con sus hermanas, trabajaba con su hermana desde hace 3 años, le hacian trabajar demaciado y tenía un salario bajo, en la actualidad le va bien en el trabajo tiene muchos pedidos.

Trabaja por primera vez con FODEMI, el prestamo que solicita es para la compra de tela polar para la confección de las pijamas y con este pretamo podría aumentar su producción y el beneficio para su familia.

Su sueño es poder construir una casa para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida jnto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and lives in the city of Otavalo in San Luis, by way of Punyaro. She is single and has children ages 14 and 10.

Ana is a happy and hardworking individual who has plenty of desire to move forward. She manufactures children’s pajamas along with her sisters. Ana began working with them three years ago. She previously earned a low salary but is now doing well since she receives many orders.

This is the first time Ana has worked with FODEMI. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fleece for making pajamas. With these funds, she will be able to increase production and provide for her family. Her dream is to build a house so that she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fleece for making children's pajamas.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 56 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Feliciana has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for eight years and also earns income from tailoring.

Feliciana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  All of his children are currently in school. Godfrey has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar, which he has had for 5 years.         

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar, soap for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Godfrey hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Godfrey hopes to expand his business. Godfrey is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar, soap for resale.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 32-year-old married man with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a commercial farmer for seven years and this has enabled him to provide the basics for his family. 

His family dream at the moment is to build a good house for his family and educate his children. The hardship  encountered is high costs of operation and his dream is to venture into mechanised farming. Richard needs the  loan to  buy  banana suckers as well as paying labour for land clearing.

loans.use: To buy more banana suckers as well as paying labour for land clearing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old. She is an enterprising business lady. She is married to Isaac, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged 14 and 10 years respectively.  

She has been in a green grocer business for the past 10 years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family. Virginia is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD., after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Virginia will use the loan to buy vegetables, potatoes and fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming and open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, potatoes and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business. Flordeliza has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from farming sugar cane.
Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Nhem's Group

texts.en:
Nhem, 53, lives together with her two single children in Kompong Chhnang province.  She is a farmer and recently owns a small store selling mixed products to the people in and around her village and the travelers who come across her store. She can earn about $1.75 per day through her business. Her oldest child also helps support the family by working as a construction worker in mobile places. 

Nhem has applied for a loan from Kiva's lenders for the purchase of construction materials to support her son's business. She hopes that this loan will increase the income for her family.  

Nhem is the leader of this group loan with four members: Mr. Va, 44; Mrs. Pech, 34; Mrs. Chea, 23. These three people are in the same business of cultivating rice crops. Because of the coming rainy season, these three people have the same purpose in using Kiva’s funds. They will use this loan to buy mineral fertilizers to spread on their farmlands in order to make their plants grow well.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is 23 years old and a farmer from the village Gantiadi, South Georgia. He married recently and lives with his wife Eka. The main source of income for the young family is agricultural business, which is led by Nodar. Eka is a teacher in local school. 

Nodar and Eka have 4 milk cows. They sell milk locally to a milk processing company. Also they have 2 hectare of land, 0.2 hectares of which is used for potato growing. Nodar sells harvested potatoes in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). The rest of the land is used for mowing. Nodar uses hay for feeding cows in the family dairy farm. 

Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris (approximately 480 USD). Nodar has requested credit for purchasing calves. He will grow the calves in winter and sell grown calves in spring for higher price. The family will get additional income. They plan to reinvest half of it for further development of the family farm, and use the other half for purchasing household goods, in order to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Federesi

texts.en: Federesi lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 7 children and only three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells sweet bananas at the market on rent basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 500000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. Federesi genreates additional income through working as a sweeper in Kampala City council. Her major business challenges are ever increasing prices of sweet bananas and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a  rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to  piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of sweet bananas

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 54 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has five children.

To earn a living, Esterlita has a business selling snacks. She earns about 3000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Esterlita has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Esterlita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is 38 years old and married to Lucy. They have been blessed with four children. He keeps poultry for the last seven years. His monthly income is KES 35,000, and he is servicing a first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. 

He intends to expand his business by acquisition of more chicks. He plans to use anticipated profits to help stabilize his business and therefore make it sustainable.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a loving mother to her family. She has been married to Jacinto for almost 10 years. They have four children. Her commitment to her family drives her to work hard in her food-selling business. She sells fruits and vegetables to the people in her neighborhood. She has a food stall just in front of her house. She usually earns 16,000 Philippines pesos (P) monthly in this kind of business, and the income pays for the allowances and other school fees of her children.

As of now, she has insufficient funds so she is asking for a loan of P25,000 to further develop her business. She will buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggs, fish and meat to sell.

In the future, Josefina would like to keep growing as an entrepreneur and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, eggs, fish and meat to sell.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José Elías tiene 49 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos  cuyas edades comprenden entre 29, 27, 20 años y los tres solo han cursado hasta el quinto año de secundaria ya que Jose no ha tenido muchos ingresos económicos y nos les ha podido dar los estudios que ellos hubieran querido, asimismo Jose solo ha estudiado hasta el quinto año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar “Mecánica Automotriz”, el plato favorito de Jose son lo “Tallarines con Papa a la Huancaína”, es un platillo a base de fideos cocidos a los cuales se les añade una salsa a base de tomate y se acompaña con papa sancochada las cuales llevan una salsa a base de queso fresco, ají amarillo, pan.

Jose se dedica en la actualidad a su negocio de mototaxi, en la cual realiza transporte de pasajeros por las calles de su ciudad, Jose se le dedica a su trabajo mucho esfuerzo, labora alrededor de 12 horas diarias y atiende alrededor de 80 clientes, puede ganar en un día hasta S/. 68 pero en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/. 100, Jose nos dice que para él cada día es muy bueno porque puede regresar a su casa con dinero para los gastos del hogar, lo cual le brinda un poco de tranquilidad al terminar el día. El cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene mucha Fe en Dios y que Dios es el que guía sus pasos por eso siempre tiene algo que llevar a su hogar  y porque es honesto, honrado y respeta a sus clientes.

Actualmente está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias a la ayuda brindada el podrá mejorar su vehículo de trabajo que es la mototaxi comprando puertas colocándole una radio y sobre todo porque va poder pagar los trámites para obtener su licencia de conducir y evitar tener multas por este inconveniente, con esta mejora podrá brindarle más comodidad a sus clientes y sobre todo que evitara que lo sancionen por manejar sin licencia y los clientes tendrán más confianza en utilizar su vehículo, así obtendrá más ingresos y podrá ahorrar para poder cumplir su sueño: “Comprarse un auto”
texts.en:
Jose Elias, 49, has 3 children who are 29-, 27, and 20-years old, respectively.  Jose wanted his children to finish high school, but none of them have because he didn’t have enough money for them to continue.   Jose, too, left school before graduating and says that he enjoyed studying Auto Mechanics there.  Jose’s favorite food is “tallarines con papa a la Huancaina”.  It’s a pasta dish in tomato sauce with potatoes in sauce made with cheese and garlic.   

Jose operates a taxi business in the city.  He has a mototaxi and works around 12 hours a day.  He picks up roughly 80 fares and makes an average of S/.68 [new soles] a day.  On a good day, he can make S/.100 [new soles], but he tells us that every day that he returns home with enough money to pay his bills is a good day.  If he can feel, at the end of the day, that he can pay his bills, he goes to bed happy.  He believes that his business is successful because his faith in God is strong.  God guides his footsteps, he says, and he’s always honest and respectful of his fares which, in turn, ensures his success.

Jose is grateful to you because your Kiva loan will help him to improve his mototaxi.  He plans to install doors and a radio but, more importantly, to pay for the licenses he needs to operate his business and avoid the fines that can be imposed for operating a business without relevant licensing.  The investment will allow him to provide a better service to his customers and, in turn, generate more income.  He wants to save up to meet his next goal: “I want to buy a car”.

loans.use: to improve his mototaxi and to pay for relevant licensing.

loans.name: Vasati

texts.en:
Vasati is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vasati owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. She operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing shirt making services to local community members. Vasati has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 800 Samoa talas (WST) (approximately $400 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Vasati joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to gain the ability to engage in business activities.      Vasati requested her first loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Vasati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Greysy Mayela

texts.es:
La joven Greysy de 24 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo que va al kinder, vive en casa de sus padres en una aldea de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, dedicándose desde hace 4 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas.
Greysy solicita un préstamo de 5,000.00 lempiras para la compra de  maíz y leña que es la materia prima que ella necesita para hacer sus tortillas, pues con las utilidades generadas por su negocio pretende sacar adelante a su hijo.
Greysy su sueño es que su hijo estudie y sea un hombre de bien y desea comenzar a construir su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Maiz y leña para su negocio

loans.name: Abrahan

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ABRAHAN,  TIENE 48  AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD DE TABACAL DE LA  PROVINCIA  MIZQUE DEL DEPARTAMENTO DE COCHABAMBA,   TIENE CUATRO  HIJOS DEPENDIENTES, SU ESPOSA ES LA SEÑORA BENIGNA CON EDAD DE 47 AÑOS QUIEN COLABORA EN LA PRODUCCIÓN AGRÍCOLA LIDERANDO EL MANEJO DEL GANADO VACUNO Y  LA FAMILIA. POR LAS HELADAS FUERTES  REGISTRADAS EN FECHAS DEL 15 AL 25 DE JULIO DEL PRESENTE AÑO EN LA ZONA, DON ABRAHAN A PERDIDO EL 50% DE SU PRODUCCIÓN DE ARVEJA Y PAPA EL CUAL A OCASIONADO UNA DISMINUCIÓN DE INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS POR VENTA DE ESTOS PRODUCTOS, POR ESTOS MOTIVOS MENCIONADOS LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA HA SUFRIDO UN DESEQUILIBRIO AFECTANDO DIRECTAMENTE EN LA ADQUISICIÓN DE LOS MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION, REQUERIDOS PARA LA CONSTRUCCIÓN DE VIVIENDA Y  ABONO ORGANICO, PARA LA ALIMENTACIÓN DE LA FAMILIA. PARA ENMENDAR LO MENCIONADO ANTERIORMENTE HA RECURRIDO AL CRÉDITO CON EL OBJETIVO DE MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA Y ESTABILIZAR LAS NECESIDADES ECONÓMICAS DE LA FAMILIA Y RETOMAR EL CAMINO DE PROSPERIDAD
texts.en: Abrahan, 48 years old, lives in the community of Tabacal in the Province of Mizque in the Department of Cochabamba. He has 4 dependent children. His wife, Benigna, is 47 years old and is in agricultural production management for a living leading the cattle and the family. Due to the strong frost between the 15th and 25 of July of this year in the area, Abrahan lost 50% of his pea and potato crops which caused a decrease in income for the sales of these products. For the reasons mentioned his economic stability has been disrupted, directly affecting the acquisition of materials and supplies required for the construction of housing materials and organic fertilizer for the family food. In order to make up for all that has been previously mentioned, he has requested a loan with the objective of improving his quality of life and stabilizing the economic needs of the family and resume the path to prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dongkuangton Group

texts.en: Xom’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Xom and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Xom and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Xom’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 37 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 3 and 13 years, 3 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 6 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: La Nopalera Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad tradicional del Estado de México se unió un grupo con el nombre de La Nopalera debido a que los integrantes son considerados de los mejores agricultores de la región. El nopales, por lo tanto, es el producto más cosechado por los lugareños y al recorrer sus caminos es fácil percatarse de los invernaderos donde se cultiva este peculiar producto. 
     Doña María Guadalupe es una mujer ejemplar ya que trabajadora arduamente y siempre mantiene una actitud positiva que transmite a sus compañeros. Vive casada con Don Filemon desde hace 35 años y juntos han formado una familia con seis hijos de los cuales una niña continúa con sus estudios. Para cumplir sus objetivos, se dedica a la compra y venta de plásticos y artículos de mercería desde hace más de 15 años.
   El gusto por las ventas lo adquirió gracias a su esposo quien ha sido comerciante desde que era pequeño realizando dicha actividad en tianguis, mercados, calles, etc. Actualmente con la ayuda de sus ganancias y los apoyos de VFMéxico la pareja pudo construir un par de locales junto a su hogar donde exhiben los artículos sin la preocupación y el cansancio de salir a las calles. 
   Para continuar con su desarrollo piensa utilizar el préstamo para comprar artículos plásticos, hilos, servilletas, tela, hilos, estambres etc. Asimismo, se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida pues en las próximas fechas tendrá ventas muy buenas debido a las compras de navidad. Por ahora, su única meta es ampliar el negocio para obtener mejores ganancias.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Elias, Ponciano y Teresa quienes invertirán en el cultivo de nopales comprando protecciones plásticas para sus invernaderos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del centro municipal, Doña María Guadalupe es quien viste la falda.

loans.use: Comprara plasticos y articulos de merceria.

loans.name: Georgi

texts.en: Georgi P. keeps a restaurant in the city coast garden in Bourgas. He is 46 years old. In 1987 he graduated “Tourism” in university and right after that he leaves the country to work abroad. When he comes back he opens his first café. This café is still working now. Two years later Georgi opens the restaurant which is vary attractive because if it’s situation. During the summer months he also keeps a pizza restaurant that is on the beach itself. Georgi P. applies for a $ 2 000 loan which he will use to make a new awning in his restaurant.

loans.use: To make a new awning in his restaurant

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia has an auto body shop on her house. She began her business with her husband’s help who gave her $150. She began selling small automobile parts and repairing tires. Now she is still selling auto parts and oil, and other auto products. Clemencia wants the Kiva loan to buy new products at wholesale prices and improve her profit. She has faith that with new products her business will grow. Clemencia has 2 children and is 3 years old. Clemencia has hope that with the Kiva loan her family’s quality of life will improve as she will be able to have more stability and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Invest in tools and materials

loans.name: Nurminah

texts.en: Nurminah is 40 years old and is married with two children. The older child is married while the younger is an unskilled temporary worker in a small factory near her village, earning $80 per month.  Her husband, Naisan, sells firewood, earning $20 per month.  To supplement her husband’s income, Nurminah sells household goods like sugar, coffee, soap, washing powder, toothpaste and other toiletries in a small store in front of her house. In a day Nurminah can earn $8. She needs a loan of $50. With this loan, she can buy more goods to sell in her store and thus more or less double her income.

loans.use: to buy more goods

loans.name: Gloria Nelly

texts.es:
Since ten years ago, Gloria Nelly has dedicated herself to the sale of tamales and tacos. She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 17. After the company Gloria was working for closed, she began her own business to be able to settle the costs of her home and of the education of her children. She started in a rented booth and thanks to the good quality of the products that she makes it grew rapidly. Now in order to cover the demand of her customers, she relies on the aid of her children and one employee.

Recently she has acquired a station wagon that will permit her to have more agile transfers and optimize time. Gloria desires to continue growing and requests a loan of $650 that she will use in the purchase of a larger capacity stove to increase her production. She commits herself to repay this amount in six months. For your important part in the development of this business, Gloria and her family give many thanks for your confidence and aid.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 10 años Gloria Nelly se dedica a la venta de tamales y tacos, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad. Después de que cerró la empresa para la que trabajaba Gloria inició su propio negocio para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, empezó en un puesto que le prestaron y gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora fue creciendo rápidamente, ahora para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y de un empleado.

Recientemente ha adquirido una camioneta que le permitirá agilizar los traslados y optimizar el tiempo, Gloria desea continuar creciendo y solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de una estufa de mayor capacidad para incrementar su producción, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Gloria y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of a larger stove - 
Compra de equipo de trabajo

loans.name: Henry Alfredo

texts.es:
My name is Henry S. and I'm dedicated to creating paintings. I have had my business for three years. My clientel is very good because I am located in the tourist zone of our community. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to make more paintings. With the increased income that I will obtain, I will be able to feed my family and pay for my children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Henry S., me dedico a la fabricacion de cuadros de pintura, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado en una zona turistica de nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para hacer mas cuadros y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y pagar los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: Purchase canvas, paint, fine and coarse brushes.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti M. is 23 years old and married with one child, aged 3. She runs a small shop selling snacks and a few household items, earning her about $5 a day. Her husband Agus has an unfixed source of income.

Siti needs a loan to buy more goods and complete her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods and complete her shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane Mtubesya is a 31 year-old single mother of two, Jackline, 11 and Jessica, 8. In 2002, she established a business selling raw rice and now requires a loan of $525 in order to purchase additional stock and expand her business. Jane has already successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and plans to do so again.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Zargalam

texts.en: Zargalam M. lives in Shafag village of Beylagan, a small town in Azerbaijan. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is engaged in animal-breeding. She makes butter, cheese, buttermilk, etc. from the milk of her cows and sheep and sells these products at the Beylagan market. Now she needs a loan in the amount of $600 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business selling homemade cheese, buttermilk, etc.

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo Aghiaruwa is 52 years old, married with 6 children. She sells household items, like mortar and pestles, for pounding. She is from Edo, Nigeria. She has been in business since 2002. She needs a loan of $275 to buy mortar and pestles and grinding stones to sell.

loans.use: To buy household items to sell.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
The business that Ceferina does for a living is buying crops of ‘jicaro’ [a gourd-like fruit from which the seeds are toasted and then ground with other ingredients such as rice, cinnamon, and allspice to make the drink ‘horchata’]. She then runs the jicaro through a process which consists of burning the fruit and then removing, grinding, washing and drying the seed, and finally, packaging the product for sale. She has done this for a living for 20 long years with the support of her husband and her 5 young sons, sons for whom she needs to provide a good education.

She runs her business in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. In order for her business to succeed, she needs to count on funds to buy the jicaro crops. It is for this reason that she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain the financing to improve her business through buying of the fruit for subsequent processing and selling of the product.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Ceferina es a la compra de los sitios de jicaro para luego pasarlos por un proceso el cual consiste en quebrarlos, extraer la semilla, molerla, lavarla, secarla y por ultimo empacarla para comercializarla. A este negocio se dedica desde hace 20 largos años con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus 5 pequeños hijos que por cierto tiene el deber de brindarles la educación que ellos necesitan.

Su actividad la lleva a cabo en el municipio Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Para lograr realizar este proceso debe de contar con ingresos que le permitan la compra de los sitios de jicaro y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan el mejoramiento de su negocio por medio de la adquisición de estos productos para luego procesarlos y comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of ‘jicaro’ fruit for processing

loans.name: Fatma's Tuzinduke Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 49 years old and is married with 2 children, 25 and 23 years old. Fatma owns a small charcoal store and has been a tailor since 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns $400 each month from her sales.

Now, she hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who deal in small businesses

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E. is a fishmonger. She is a single parent of six dependents. Business is going very well and she wishes to increase sales but she is running out of stock. She is asking for an additional capital to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Moana

texts.en: Moana  F. , 39, is married with 3 children.  She has had many years of experience in the taro/bananas business. She sells to the village community/District 2 days per week. She has had 4 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be  $125 USD.  SPBD loans are Moana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Moana's husband helps out in maintaining the plantation.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase all equipment for her plantation; bush knives,shovels ,axes. wheelbarrows, spades, pesticides and chemicals.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 48 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2001. Similarly to many other people in the area, her chief activity is working on the rice field and breeding animals. Before joining the TYM Fund, she did not enough money and therefore, she just had a small farm. After becoming a member of the Fund, she expanded her animal-breeding farm, fixing the pigsties and other equipments. Her breeding activity has been going very well and every year, she releases 600 kg of pigs. She has been using the income to raise her 4 children, three of whom are working and the last one is going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 1075 USD to invest in breeding pigs and chickens. Her average income is 350 USD.month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhường 48 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001. Cũng giống bao chị em khác trong địa phương nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi, trước khi trưa tham gia vào Quỹ do không có vốn nên viêc đầu tư chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ở mô hình nhỏ, khi tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã mạnh giạn vay vốn đầu tư nhiều hơn vào chăn nuôi, chuồng trại sửa sang thoáng mát nên việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất thuận lợi cho thu nhập cao bình quân mỗi năm chị xuât 6 tạ lợn. Từ những thu nhập đó chị đã có điều kiện kinh tế để nuôi day 4 con, các con chị đều rất ngoan, hiện nay 3 con chị đã đi làm và có thu nhập giúp gia đình, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 18.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và gà thịt. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising Pigs and chickens

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia is a member of Banco Comunal Nobleza

Sonia lives with her partner. She is 31 years old and has 3 children. Sonia lives at her parent’s home and hope to finish building her home so she can move.

Sonia sells meat at a stand in the F. Vivanco market, she buys livestock at different fairs in the region where her husband travels to 3 times a week, and when there is a lack of livestock, especially pigs, they make their purchases in the city of Lima, the animals are slaughtered in the municipal slaughterhouse and they sold at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Sonia es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Sonia vive en la casa de sus padres y espera poder terminar de construir su casa para mudarse.

Sonia vende carne en un puesto del mercado F. Vivanco, los animales los compra en las diferentes ferias de la región a donde viaja su esposo 3 veces por semana, y en algunas oportunidades cuando hay escasez los animales en especial el ganado porcino lo compran de la ciudad de Lima, los animales los beneficia en el camal municipal y luego lo vende en su puesto.

Sonia necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que fue invertido en la compra de ganado porcino. Los sueños de Sonia son comprar un carro para que su esposo trabaje, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Sonia needs a 1400 soles (Peruvian currency) loan which will be invested in the purchase of porcine livestock.

loans.name: Chirly

texts.es:
Chirly tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive en casa de su madre.
Es una muchacha muy joven, que se dedica a tejer prendas de vestir en la máquina que heredó de su madre, realiza esta actividad aproximadamente desde hace 3 años, ya que a ella siempre le ha gustado tejer.Con lana y creatividad Chirly elabora diversas prendas; como medias, guantes, chompas, etc., lo único difícil, es el tiempo que no le alcanza para producir las cantidades que la clientela le demanda, pero le va bien en el negocio y espera seguir trabajando para concretar todos sus sueños.
Chirly espera convertir su pequeño taller en una gran empresa, para asegurar su futuro económico.
Con el dinero facilitado comprará material para la elaboración de sus prendas, las cuales espera ver distribuidas en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Chirly is 19 years old, single, and lives in her mother’s home. She is a young woman dedicated to knitting clothing by machine, which she inherited from her mother. She has been doing this activity for approximately 3 years, as she has always liked to knit. With wool and creativity Chirly makes a variety of clothing like socks, gloves, sweaters, etc.. The only challenge is that she doesn’t have enough time to produce the quantities her customers demand, but her business is going well and she hopes to continue working in order to make all her dreams reality. Chirly hopes to convert her small workshop into a large business to ensure her economic future. With the money from the loan she will buy material to make her items, which will be distributed to different city markets.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make knitted clothing

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Komi T. is 62 years old. She is married with 6 children. She has two years of experience selling ice cake and popcorn to the general public. She sells 7 days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250USD).

Komi has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Komi's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. As a 62-year-old mother running a popcorn business, Komi is very happy to earn her own money.

loans.use: Purchase cordial, sugar, pots, foam cups, corn seeds, salt, cooking oil, and popcorn maker.

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru: Юсупов Шукрулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 44 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже 15 лет занимается торговлей. Торгует стройматериалами  на рынке «Гулистон». Увеличить товарооборот хочет путем получения кредита , поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shukrullo U. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 44 years old, married and has four children. For the last 15 years Shukrullo has been selling building materials at the "Guliston" market. To expand his store's inventory he wants to take out this loan. Shukurullo is planning to pay back the loan in the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La señora Trinidad pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en Prolongación Libertad Nº 1202, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad y 2 que aun dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo de una motokar. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la confección de prendas de vestir. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio, confecciona diferentes prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 metros de tela licra algodón, 4 metros de lino, cierre, elásticos, hilos, etc. 

Gracias al banco comunal su negocio han crecido y sus clientes han aumentado en estos últimos días.
texts.en:
Trinidad participates in the Communal Bank “Bellavista”, located in Prolongación Libertad Nº 1202, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, in Ucayali. Trinidad, 53, is married and has 3 children; two of them still live at home. Her husband works driving a moto-car. The first loan that she received from Kiva field partner "Manuela Ramos" was invested in her sewing business. Trinidad has been working with the communal bank for 5 years. Currently, Trinidad still runs a sewing business, making clothes for men, women and children. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles to be paid back in 5 months. The loan will be used to purchase 3 meters of cotton material, 4 meters of linen, zippers, elastics, threads, etc. Thanks to the communal bank, Trinidad's business has grown and the number of customers has increased lately.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sewing materials (cotton fabric, linen, zippers, elastic, thread, etc.)

loans.name: Thap's Group

texts.en:
This loan composed of four borrowers. All of borrowers live in Toul Ta Ek Commune in Battambang Province. 

Mrs. Thap Y. is 41 years old. She owns and runs a small workshop in her home in which her employees provide  service, making chairs, tables, and cupboards for sale. She has run the business since 1979 and currently earns a profit of approximately $6 a day. She is married to Ty Lihak, age 63, a construction supervisor who earns about $3 per day. The couple have five children: three are married, one is single, and one daughter also helps in her mother's business. Y. is applying a loan to purchase carpentry materials for her business activities. 

Y. is the leader of three members;
Kruy G., 55, sells used-clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.
Keo K. E. is 51 years old and sells groceries. She needs a loan to purchase groceries for sale. Hach P., 56, makes a living selling Khmer Noodles and roasting bananas. P. requested a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Polina

texts.en:
Polina T. is 46 years old. She is married with ten children. At the moment, four of them are in senior and junior high school all together. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil.  Palm oil produced is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to capital inadequacy to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to palm oil business, she also burns wood with the outcome being charcoal. Polina has a portion of land where she burns the wood to get the charcoal. And this is what she has being doing for the last three years. But her problem has been with funds to buy more gallons of fuel and wood to burn the charcoal and palm nuts fruits to produce oil.

 Polina again believes when you assist her she would be more resourced. And she can expand her business to raise more income to support her husband to provide food and finance her children’s education. Polina belongs to a village bank called Rejoice. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and fuel to burn charcoal.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora S. has a "sari-sari" store business. "Sari-sari" is a Filipino word meaning variety, and Dioscora sells a variety of goods in their town to provide for their needs. She is 32 years old and has three children. She previously worked as a market trader. Dioscora traded clothes in the flea market and was not happy about it because some of her goods were stolen, others were destroyed.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from CEVI. Dioscora will use the loan to add to her merchandise, and she believes that this loan will bring her good profits. With the loan, she could attract more buyers because of the diversity of products that she displays.

CEVI helps Dioscora further grow her business. She has access to CEVI's credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage from joining the program.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Angelita F. hails from the beautiful province of Antique. She is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children. 

She is requesting for a loan of P 5,000 as initial capital to purchase two sacks of rice, weighing scale, and plastic bags to start a rice trading business. She knows that rice is the best product that needs by the people. Her customers are the people in the village.  She will also sell mongo beans vendor when in the season. 

She plans that after a year she will have more stock of rice to meet the needs of her cutomers. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and hope that they will not experience the hardships she went through. She also dreams to have a comfortable and concrete house in the future.

Through ASHI, she learned to accept her mistakes and apologize to the person involved. She likes to thank Kiva Lenders who will sponsor her loan.

loans.use: Initial capital for buying and selling of rice

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Клиент Махсунов Хамрокул в возрасте 53года.Проживает в городе Турсунзаде, женат имеет 6-ых детей, имеет среднее образования.Клиент занимается животноводством он покупает молодых телят откармливает и продаёт,этим видом деятельности, занимается более двух лет. На полученные деньги клиент хочет купить пару молодых телят.
texts.en:
Hamrokul Machsunov is 53 years old. He lives in the town called Tursun-zade. He is married and has 6 children. He has secondary education. Hamrokul is in the animal farming business - he purchases calves, feeds them, and later sells them at a higher price. He has been working in this business for the past 2 years. He plans to use the loan to purchase two calves to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Neba Eveline

texts.en:
