Eveline is married with two children; she lives in Ntamulung, Bamenda, in Cameroon. She plans to invest this loan in her poultry farm, and cheese business. Concretely, she plans to purchase 3 weeks old chickens, five bags of feed, medications, plantains, and oil.

This is Eveline’s second loan from GHAPE. She has been selling for quite some time and has been able to get to know her customer base and their demands. She is also happy with her business site as there are few competitors nearby.

With the profits from her ventures, she plans to reinvest in her businesses to help them grow. She hopes that one day her income will grow enough so that she will be able to help the poor increase their incomes as GHAPE and Kiva have helped her.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: chicks, feed, medication, plantains and oil

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 51 years old. She and her husband are separated. Their three children are already married. Her children are Minerva – 34 yrs. old, Mary Joy – 32 yrs. old and Jomar - 29 yrs. old.  

Mary Rose manages a vending business in her village to support her daily needs and to support the needs of her grandchildren.  She lives in the rural village of Del Pilar in Cabatuan, Isabela.  She sells different commodities like snacks and she also sells rice.  Since it is summer, she has decided to sell halo-halo which is in demand during this time of the year. She wants to take a loan of PHP 8, 000 (USD 175) for further development of her business and to save some of her income to provide for the educational needs of her grandchildren for the next school year.  Vending has been her sole source of income and she is patiently improving it.

loans.use: Business development & school fees.

loans.name: Nurmamat

texts.en: N. Nurmamat, 46, is a farmer who lives in Shahristan, Tajikistan. He is very experienced in this business as he has been farming since 1988. He is married with four children. His elder son and wife help him with the business. Unfortunately, Nurmamat's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of $3,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants to use on his potato crop. Nurmamat hopes the loan will allow him to increase his yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs. Be an important part of the well-being of this humble family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Nyètaa Group

texts.fr:
Avec en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants, les membres du groupe Nyètaa (une veuve et 3 femmes mariées) vivent dans des familles monogamiques dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers de liens de voisinage, de mariage et professionnels.
Ce groupe fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les plastiques, les pagnes, les habits pour enfants, les draps de lit etc. 
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur  5ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les prêts précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 64 pièces de pagne wax et 6 douzaines de seaux en plastiques. Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes wax au grand marché de Bamako (capitale du Mali), Ségou et Lomé (république de Togo), quant aux seaux en plastiques à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou auprès des grossistes. Leurs marchandises sont revendues  au comptant, en détail et à crédit en ambulant dans les différents marchés et de porte en porte à Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 48.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt et pour contribuer aux évènements sociaux. 
Elles ont pour ambition de devenir grossistes pour ravitailler les détaillants de la place.
texts.en:
With an average age of 38 and six children each, the members of the Nyètaa group (one widow and three married women) live in monogamous families in the Darsalam district of Ségou (Mali’s fourth administrative region) and know each other through neighborhood ties, marriage and business. The group sells miscellaneous items such as plastic buckets, traditional African cloth (pagnes), children’s clothing and bed sheets. In order to meet the needs of their customers, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s loan program. They are on their fifth solidarity loan, having successfully repaid all previous loans. The latest loan will be used to buy 64 pieces of wax cloth and six dozen plastic buckets. They get their supplies of wax cloth at the main market in Bamako (the capital of Mali) and in Ségou and Lomé (Republic of Togo). They buy the plastic buckets from wholesalers at the weekly fair in Ségou. Their clientele is made up of men and women, and they sell their merchandise at retail prices for cash or credit by walking around the various markets and by going door to door in Ségou. They hope to make an average monthly profit of CFA 48,000 which will be used to repay the loan and to help pay for social events. Their ambition is to become wholesalers to supply local retailers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax cloth and plastic buckets

loans.name: Damian

texts.en:
Farming has supported Damian C., 43 years old, and his family for the last twenty years. He is happily married to a housekeeper and is the father of three.

Although his business is earning enough, he finds the need to expand it due to the growing needs of his family. His children are schooling and, as parents, he and his wife really want to send them to college and have them obtain a degree. So he is saving more for the greater demand of their education.

Damian is currently applying for a Php 10,000 loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He finds it advantageous to loan at CEVI because, aside from meeting his need for additional capital, he also learns other business techniques because CEVI holds training and seminars about business management for its active members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is twenty-two years old and married with a daughter who is currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in their community. Ama trades in jewelry, buying from the big cities and then engaging the strategy of "hawking" (door-to-door) to sell to her loyal customers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Ama has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy assorted jewelry in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her child a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 48 years old and she is married to Dominador D. C. Sr. The couple is blessed with four children: Dennis, 25 years old, college graduate; Precious Joy - 20 years old and still studying in college; Carlo, 18 years old, first year college, and Dominador D. C. Jr., 12 years old, studies in elementary school. Elvira’s family is happily living in the simple village of Gamis Saguday, Quirino. 

Elvira makes preserved flowers out of dried leaves. She sells her product within their village and sometimes goes to sell in other villages so that they can generate an increased income. She is thankful that, through the income generated from the business, she is able to send her three children to school. According to Elvira, she needs increased capital to improve the unique preserved flower product business that she makes. In this regard, she is requesting to borrow a loan amounting to PHP5,000 as additional working capital. This will help to sustain her flower making activity and to make it known and popular to other municipalities and even nationwide. She hopes that her membership to Kiva will be a good start towards the progress of her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Francis Gitau

texts.en:
Francis K. is a 24-year-old businessman who has been in the beauty products business for the past five years. His business is located within Eldoret Town along Oloo street. His major customers are Eldoret residents who include working ladies and college-going students.

Francis was introduced to KADET by a colleague who was already a member. With the loan he is taking from KADET, Francis intends to add more stock to his beauty shop which includes chemicals, earrings and necklaces.

In future he intends to expand to other towns and also to open up a salon in the town. He believes that life is beautiful and thus all else should be beautiful.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products including earrings and necklaces

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat d'apareils électroménagers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie manages a vegetable vending business in their village. Every day she roams around their village to sell her products. Her husband is busy planting root crops and some vegetables that they also sell for additional income. She is glad that she can earn a weekly gross income of PHP 1,500 and she patiently budgets this to meet the needs of their family and for the maintenance of her business.

She is a good mother and willing to sacrifice everything for the welfare of her family. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from KIVA lenders. She believes that by having this increase in capital, her business will become productive. Rosemarie is striving hard and has a strong faith in God that she can be successful in the future.

Rosemarie is only 23 years old and married to Arnel. They are living in Barangay General Balao, Solana Cagayan. They have two children: Carl – 2 years old and Caryl - 6 months old. She thanks God for all the blessings that they are receiving.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has owned and managed a general store business in her village for twenty-eight years. Her business has been her partner in providing for the educational needs of her five children. She is 44 years old and still very active in making her business a success. Her two children are still studying and are already in the college level.

With her desire to send her children to college and finish their studies, she is doing her best to send them to school. She wants to borrow PHP 22,000 that will serve as additional business capital for her store. Some of the things that she will purchase are canned goods and other basic commodities needed at home. She believes that, with the support of Kiva lenders, nothing is impossible.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria E., 53 years old. She lives and does business in Tala, Caloocan City. Gloria recounts that she met with an accident when she was in college which rendered her disabled.

Her disability has never been a hindrance for her in facing life’s challenges. Now, she’s earning at least P13,000 a month from selling vegetables, spices, and newspapers. She’s been in business for ten years now.

Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, she has found and kept more friends in the community. She has found new meaning to her life. Now on her 13th loan, Gloria expects a new loan in the amount of P22,000 to add to her business capital.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells foodstuffs like tomato paste in her stall in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with four children. She has been in this business for two years. She hopes to become a major foodstuff distributor in Lagos State.

Maria is hoping for a loan of 50,000 naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en la ciudad de León, el señor Francisco R. es propietario de su propia pulpería la que ha logrado surtir con los productos con el fin de llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. 

Entre los productos que ofrece se encuentran los productos comestibles y los personales y hoy en día requiere de la compra de dichos productos para ofrecerlos en su negocio y es por esto que solicita un crédito para dar lugar a dichas compras y así contribuir al desarrollo de su propio negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Francisco R. owns his small general store in the town of El Sauce in the city of León which he has managed to stock with items with the goal of producing support for his home. Among the products offered are food products and personal use items and he needs to buy these products to restock his store. This is the reason for his loan request: to have the products to sell thus contributing to the development of his own business in his location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is 48 years old and is married with five children. His wife is a teacher and she owns her own school.

Sunday sells textbooks to make a living. He sells for long hours to enable him put food on his table to feed his family members. He hopes to own a big bookshop in future.

Sunday is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more textbooks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Ly Vet Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of ten people and they all live in Prek Reang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Seng Ly V. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Suth Soeun, is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. He is also a fisherman. Now he needs a boat for his fishing. Thus, Mrs. Seng Ly V. decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s purpose. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan. She is 30 years old and the mother of a child who is just 2 years old. Mrs. Seng Ly V.'s husband is presented in the picture.

loans.use: Needs a boat for his fishing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and is a widow with seven children. She lives in Benin City and is a focused, hard worker.

Victoria has machines that she uses to grind beans, tomatoes, pepper and maize for her customers. The demand for her services are high in her community. She has been in this business for a long time even before her husband passed away. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase a grinding machine. She says thank you to all lenders.

Victoria is a committed LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo V. tiene 52 años, su estado civil es casado, y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar con su esposa Devora y cuatro hijos.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Pablo se dedica a la agricultura desde muy temprana edad y además tiene una pequeña tienda.  Dentro de la agricultura los productos que más siembra son maíz, habas, papas, trigo, y legumbres en pequeñas cantidades.  Solicita el préstamo para  la agricultura y para invertir en el pequeño negocio de la tienda.  Ha sacado un préstamo antes también para la inversión en la agricultura.
Su sueño es crecer su tienda y mejorar la producción en sus cosechas.  En la comunidad a los moradores les gusta jugar peloto en los ratos libres.  En cuanto a sus hijos, estudian en el colegio en el cantón San Miguel.

Sale en la foto con su esposa Devora, quien también es socia de su ventanilla rural. Ella también está solicitando un crédito Kiva.
texts.en:
Pablo V. is 52 and married. He lives in the San Miguel region in the Bolívar province with his wife, Devora, and their four children. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in all. Most of them work in agriculture and raise small animals. Pablo has worked in agriculture from a very young age. He also has a small store. The agricultural products that he plants the most are corn, beans, potatoes, wheat, and a small amount of vegetables. He is asking for the loan for farming and to invest in his small business, the store. He has taken a loan before, which he used for agriculture. His dream is to have his store grow and to improve production of his crops. The inhabitants of the community like to play ball in their free time. His children go to the school in the San Miguel region. Pablo is pictured with his wife Devora, who is also a member of his communal bank. Devora is also requesting a Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For farming and to invest in his small store

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savet O. and her husband, Mr. Tharn ChhO., are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate plants. They are also grocers and own a food stand for selling food in their village. Mrs. Savet O. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo province. The couple has one child who is 10 years old and is currently in school. 

Mrs. Savet O. is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 riels from AMK to buy more ingredients to enlarge her business. With the help of loans from AMK, she has been able to increase her family's income and improve their standard of living with her business activities.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to enlarge her business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia tiene como actividad la venta de cosmeticos, perfumes y joyas por catalogo en distintos lugares de nuestra ciudad, esta atividad que realiza es un apoyo al ingreso de su familia, la misma  que esta compuesta por su esposo y sus dos hijos, ayudando de esta manera al sustento de su familia, el destino del credito es para comprar mercaderia de temporada (perfumes y cosmeticos), ya que los mismos estan de oferta para luego venderlos al precio original y tener buenas ganancias, unos de sus deseos es de tener una casa propia  y de ver a sus hijos profesionales.

la Sra. Pattricia esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Patricia sells Cosmetics, perfumes and jewelry from a catalog in various places around our city. This helps provide an income and support for her family, which includes her husband and two children. She will use the money from this loan to buy seasonal merchandise (perfume and cosmetics), now that they are available at a discount, and sell them at the regular price. This will provide a good profit. She hopes to have her own home one day and to see her children become professionals. Patricia is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have given in providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa de 46 años de edad vive en la zona # 6 de Nueva Guinea, labora para el MINED Nueva Guinea como docente desde hace 10 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos mayores de edad los cuales tienen su propia familia y viven en sus propias casas , esta solicitando su primer crèdito para comprar materiales  para lograr construir un baño de concreto el cual le vendria a mejorar sus condiciones,  actualmente esta estudiando su cuarto año en la Universidad Uraccan, doña Teresa se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesta y con mucho deseos de superaciòn personal y profesional,  su sueño es tener trabajo digno y salud.
texts.en:
Teresa is 46 years old. She lives in Zone # 6 of Nueva Guinea. She has worked for the MINED Nueva Guinea as a teacher for 10 years. She is a single mother of three grown children who have their own families and live in their own homes. She is asking for her first loan to buy material to build a concrete bathroom which will improve her living conditions. Right now she is in her fourth year at the Universidad Uraccan. Teresa is very responsible and honest and really wants to get ahead personally and professionally. Her dream is to have a good job and good health.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bathroom construction

loans.name: Lauréat

texts.fr: A. Lauréat est née le 18 Juillet 1980 et est mariée à GBETOFIA Rigobert. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé. La famille vit à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis cinq ans. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Lauréat a appris la coiffure et l'exerce depuis trois ans. Parallèlement à cette activité, Lauréat vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier situé à Agla. Lauréat s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Lauréat a bénéficié antérieurement de deux crédits qu'elle avait bien remboursés. La clientèle de Lauréat s'accroît de plus en plus et Lauréat voudrait élever davantage le niveau de son activité, afin de mieux répondre aux différents besoins de ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Lauréat sollicite un troisième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lauréat A. was born on July 18, 1980 and is married to Rigobert Gbetofia. The couple has one child that is not yet in school. The family has lived in Agla, Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin for five years. Together, the couple takes care of the different family expenses. Lauréat learned hairdressing and has done it for three years. Parallel to this, she sells hair extensions and cosmetics in her studio in Agla. Lauréat stocks up in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Lauréat has received two loans that she has repaid. Her customers have increased more and more and Lauréat would like to raise the level of her work, in order to better respond to the different needs of her customers. This is why she requests a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and different cosmetics

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly Y., 56, sells breakfast foods and lives with her husband and seven children. She became a food seller in 2005, a skill she learned from a nearby neighbor. Two of her daughters are working at a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Meu Ny, is pictured here. He is a fisherman, and also has a pond where he raises fish to sell when they come to maturity. Meu Ny has sold all the grown fish from his pond and he is lacking capital to restock it. Therefore, Ly Y. has decided to seek a loan of $800 on her husband’s behalf from Kiva’s partner, HKL, to buy small fish for breeding.

loans.use: To buy small fish for breeding

loans.name: Perla Sughei

texts.es:
La Señora Perla Sughei S. E., es comerciante desde hace 10 años tiene un pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación que queda de almacen quiñones ½ al oeste  vende de todo un poco y ropa usada.
La Señora S.  E. es casa tiene dos hijas vive con su mamá su esposo le ayuda y ella se dedica a su negocio y a sus hijas, una de sus niñas estudia  la otra no, es muy pequeña todavía, sus financiamientos lo a invertido en su negocio y para comprar pacas de niña a la vez le ha venido realizando mejoras a su vivienda y ha salido adelante.
texts.en:
La Señora Perla Sughei S. E., es comerciante desde hace 10 años tiene un pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación que queda de almacen quiñones ½ al oeste vende de todo un poco y ropa usada. La Señora S. E. es casa tiene dos hijas vive con su mamá su esposo le ayuda y ella se dedica a su negocio y a sus hijas, una de sus niñas estudia la otra no, es muy pequeña todavía, sus financiamientos lo a invertido en su negocio y para comprar pacas de niña a la vez le ha venido realizando mejoras a su vivienda y ha salido adelante.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar gaseosa y productos lácteos

loans.name: 18.03.040 Group

texts.en:
Tình P. Thị (87) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa.  Tình is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 040-Quảng Hưng (18.03.040).


Tình is married and has two adult aged children.  To make a living, Tình owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Tình has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Tình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tình has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Tinh from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tình plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  H. Thị Chiêu (84) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. Thị Minh (86) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tình P. Thị (87) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa.  Tình là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 040-Quảng Hưng (18.03.040).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Tình thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tình kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.  Vào 2007, Tình đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tình đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  H. Thị Chiêu (84) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Minh (86) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: May Grace

texts.en:
May Grace S. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. May Grace is married and has 1 infant. To make a living, May Grace owns & operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling gasoline (by the liter) in the local community. May Grace has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, May Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. May Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. May Grace is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by May Grace from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hor

texts.en: Mrs. Hor S., 53, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards. She sells rattan that her husband weaves or that she orders from other weavers who live in the village. She and her husband use their horse cart as transportation and it takes a week to sell all their rattan. This couple has five children: two are now married and the other three are single. Two children are employed. Recently, Hor S. got orders from her clients, but she doesn't have enough product to fill the demand. Therefore, Hor S. has requested a loan as capital to purchase more rattan cupboards to better meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: To purchase more rattan cupboards to better meet her customers' needs

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Mrs. Duch T. has spent her life cultivating crops. She is an old woman whose husband appears in the photo at their field. 

Duch T. has a lot of experience in this sector; it's a skill she learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has three children, two of whom are now employed and the other is a student. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. 

The coming rainy season is a good time for Duch T. to plant her crop but she doesn’t have money to buy farming supplies to use on her field. That is why she has decided to request a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies to use on her field.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente K. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Vicente owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Vicente joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Vicente is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his 2nd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Nicolasa Carolina

texts.es:
Doña Nicolasa  tiene la edad de 43 años,  pequeña comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortilla, desde hace varios años, tiene 43 años, vive junto con su familia.
Inicio con poco dinero que dio su esposo, el cual para ella fue su inicio, que luego logro aumentar su producción de venta. Con Afodenic ha trabajado por diez ciclos lo que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, inversión en su tortillería que es su medio para lograr ingresos y lograr pagar sus gastos básicos como necesidades personales.

Con este crédito hará un muro el cual podrá tener mejor  seguridad de su casa como la higiene, con el crédito anterior ese era su destino pero no lo logro por que tuvo que cambiar el techo de su casa que le fue más de necesidad.
Ahora comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzara hacer el muro, logrando así comenzar la obra y gozar de los beneficios a través de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 43 years old and a small business owner. She has sold tortillas for several years. She lives with her family. She started with a little money that her husband gave her and that was the beginning for her and later she was able to increase her sales. She has worked with Afodenic for ten cycles and has been able to improve her home and invest in her tortilla business which is her source of income and how she pays for her personal expenses. With this loan she will build a wall which will give her house more security and sanitation. This was what the last loan was intended for, but she was unable to use it for that because she had to change the roof on her house as that was more urgent. No she will buy: stones, sand cement, and iron and she will start to build the wall. In this way, she will be able to start the project and enjoy the benefits through the financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy construction materials such as: stones, sand, cement, and iron to make the wall and have more security in her property.

loans.name: Jesus Es Prosperidad Group

texts.en:
Johanna is the coordinator of her group Jesus es Prosperidad 1 (Jesus is Prosperity). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to raise her child.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking and spending time with her family.

Johanna is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 3 years, starting with her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear, cosmetics and shoes. She will use the profits to buy her children school's supplies and buy some couches for her home. She is dreaming to have her own house and to improve her business.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because after having other loans she found the Esperanza program in her community and prefers our rates. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally; her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic,. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy underwear, cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica V. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. She is 30 years old. Veronica is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling pork barbecue. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Veronica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food for sale. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Veronica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Prum's Group

texts.en: This group loan has six members who live in Sdau Aem village in Takeo province. Mrs. Prum K., 57, is the group leader selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan to improve their family's living standards. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support her family. She has some problems because her rice field has infertile soil. So, to improve production, Mrs. Prum K. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer. With any remainder of the loan she will buy some piglets to raise to start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Ny Korng, is a basket maker. Based on the income from those activities, they support five children, all five of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. is a 62-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya - Bali. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Ni Ketut S. raises pigs for sale. She has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. She enjoys her work, especially feeding her pigs and watching them devour the food, as well as watching the birthing process. In 2010, Ni Ketut S. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut S. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase more livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from MUK. Ni Ketut S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. She hopes also that she will be able to help her grandchildren with their education and hopes they attain a high level so they can have a bright future. Ni Ketut S. is the leader of a 14 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Satya Laksana (PK-10306)". About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Ni Ketut S. 0 (0) merupakan 62 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut S. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 14 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Satya Laksana (PK-10306). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut S. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut S. menghasilkan sekitar 0,300 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut S. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut S. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.500.000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
Liliana is 24 years old.  She lives with her partner and young son in her own home in the neighborhood of La Victoria, just outside of the city of Chiclayo.  Her home has access to city water, but no sewer or septic system. This is common in her neighborhood as it is one of the poorer sections of the city of Chiclayo.

In the back yard of her home, Liliana raises animals such as ducks and chickens. She also manages a small vegetable stand in the market in Reque (a town about 20 minutes from Chiclayo). She sells vegetables, which she purchases from wholesalers or local farmers. She also sells her animals to local buyers there in the market when they reach the appropriate size.

This will be Liliana’s second credit with Edpyme Alternativa. She has proven to be a punctual and responsible borrower. She plans to use the current loan to purchase feed for her animals and expand her offerings of vegetables. She is thankful for the opportunity to access credit at a lower cost through Kiva funding.

loans.use: Expand her merchandise and purchase additional feed for her animals

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: La señora Ana Luisa N. P. se dedica a la actividad de venta de ceviche en la plaza de armas de su Localidad Subtanjalla de manera informal, Vive con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos. Su esposo trabaja como albañil  por lo que cuentan con un ingreso adicional. La solicitante requiere del crédito para su negocio va a comprar mezas y sillas para que sus clientes tengan comodidad. Se sugiere otorgarle el crédito ya que presenta buenas referencias personales y también cuenta con experiencia acrediticia.
texts.en: Ana Luisa N. P. has a business selling ceviche (raw fish marinated in citrus juices and spiced with chili peppers), on an informal basis, in the Plaza de Armas in her district of Subtanjalla.  She lives with her husband and two young children.  Her husband works as a bricklayer so they have an additional income.  She is requesting this loan for her business to buy tables and chairs so that her customers can be more comfortable.  She has been approved to receive a loan because she has good personal references and good credit experience.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Diamante Verde Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Diamante Verde se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Tlalnepantla , en el estado de Morelos, México, este grupo se compone de 4 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Mirella Espinoza Ramírez va a comprar con su préstamo insecticida para fumigar su parcela de nopal, la señora Caritina Rayón F. va a comprar ropa para bebe, conjuntos, camisetas, trusitas, toallas y papelería para surtir su tienda, la señora Alicia H. A. va a comprar insecticidas para fumigar el nopal, la señora Carolina A. Rayón va a comprar insecticidas para fumigar su parcela de nopal y va a comprar una bomba para fumigar. La señora Alicia H. A. es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 26 años de edad, estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria tiene su certificado, ella tiene 3 hijos Fredy tiene 7 años estudia el 2º. Año de primaria, María Fernanda tiene 5 años de edad y Paola tiene 4 años de edad  ellas dos están en preescolar. Ella tiene su siembra de nopal y solicito su préstamo para comprar abono y fumigantes para la siembra de nopal, ella inicio con el negocio desde pequeña sus papas los llevaban al campo a sus 7 hermanos y ella a trabajar en la siembra de nopal  a quitarle la hierba con un azadón. Este negocio es herencia de sus papas, se encuentra localizado a media hora de su casa en los campos de Tlalnepantla y llega a su parcela en carro o caminando, su negocio es importante porque de ahí se ocupa para todos los gastos, cuando vienen tiempos buenos y tiene buen precio el nopal es cuando puede ahorrar, su parte favorita de este negocio es atenderlo del diario, ella hace la comida para llevar al campo para su esposo y los trabajadores que están trabajando en el nopal y se siente orgullosa cuando su siembra tiene mucho nopal porque se cosecha mucho y tiene más dinero. Las personas servidas por su negocio son compradores que vienen de fuera de Milpa Alta, de la Cd.de México, de Guadalajara. Los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son las plagas que echan a perder su producción, también enfrenta la competencia como todos siembran nopal hay veces que todas des pencan al mismo tiempo y hay mucho nopal, las ganancias del negocio las reinvierte, se abona otra vez cada año. Tlalnepantla es un pueblo muy tranquilo donde pueden salir de noche sin peligro, hay muchos cerros y se ve el volcán, es de clima frio. Este negocio le ha ayudado a su familia económicamente para cubrir todos sus gastos la alimentación y para los estudios de sus hijos, las mejorías que desea realizar a su vivienda es remodelar porque son desde que sus abuelitos la construyeron y quieren hacer los cuartos para sus niños, sus sueños y esperanza son que crezca mas el negocio tener más productos. La señora Alicia está muy contenta con el préstamo que le proporcionan porque le va a ayudar mucho para crecer su negocio. Las mejoras que desea lograr par el futuro de sus hijos son darles estudio, que sigan estudiando y darles todo lo que necesiten. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por los préstamos que nos dieron y ojala y nos sigan ayudando.”
texts.en:
This committed group called Diamante Verde is located in the community of Tlalnepantla, in Morelos state, Mexico. It is composed of four women who are neighbours. Señora Mirella Espinoza Ramírez is planning to use her loan to buy insecticide to put on her nopal (prickly pear cactus) field. Señora Caritina Rayón F. will use her loan to buy baby clothing, outfits, shirts, pants, towels, and stationery for her store. Señora Alicia H. A. will buy insecticide to put on her nopal field. Señora Carolina A. Rayón will also buy insecticide spray for her nopal field.

Alicia is the group’s representative. She is 26 years old and has completed the third year of high school. She has three children, Fredy aged 7, who is in second year of primary school; María Fernanda aged 5 and Paola aged 4 who are both in pre-school. Alicia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her nopal crop. As a young girl, her parents used to take her and her seven siblings to the countryside where she weeded the nopal plants with a special hoe.

She inherited the farm from her parents. It is located about a half hour from her house, in the countryside around Tlalnepantla, and she gets there either by car or by walking. Her business is important because it has to pay for all her expenses. When times are good and the price for her nopal crop is good, she manages to save some money. Her favourite part of the job is working there daily. She makes food to take there for her husband and the labourers who are working in the nopal fields, and she feels proud when her plants produce lots of nopal fruit because then the harvest is good and she has more money. The people who buy the fruit come from as far away as Milpa Alta, Mexico City, and Guadalajara.

Alicia’s biggest challenges are the insects which can attack the nopal fruit, and competition from other nopal growers. Sometimes there’s a lot of nopal for sale at the same time. She plans to reinvest any profit in the business by spreading fertilizer a second time in the year. 

Tlalnepantla is a quiet town where you can go out at night without worrying. There are many hills and you can see the volcano. It has a cold climate.

The farm provides financial support for the family and covers the cost of food and education for the children. Alicia wishes to renovate the house as it is still as her grandparents built it, and she wants to build on bedrooms for the children. Her hopes and dreams consist of expanding the farm and growing more produce. She is very happy with the loan as it will help her greatly to expand the business. She also wants her children to be well-educated and to be able to provide them with whatever they need. 

The group members wish to say thank you to Kiva and Fundación Realidad for the loan. They hope there will similar opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for the nopal crop

loans.name: Blanca Dayssi

texts.es:
Doña Blanca tiene 42 años de edad, es empleada y comerciante de medicina, vive con sus hijas en su propia casa ubicada en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, su empleo lo tiene desde hace 13 años en una empresa llamada Electrocentro y vende medicina desde hace 5 años, actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar medicina, con esta inversión ella pretende crecer, teniendo mucha medicina para distintas enfermedades y que al momento de ofrecer a los clientes pueda vender lo que ellos más necesiten.
Su propósito es crece en este negocio, aumentando sus ingresos para tener una vida más cómoda con sus hijas, al mismo tiempo quiere ir cancelando las cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old.  She is an employee in a company and also works independently selling medicines.  She lives with her daughters in her own home in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  Blanca has had her job for 13 years, working for a company called Electrocentro.  She has been selling medicines for 5 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy medicines.  She would like to use this investment to grow her business, having a lot of medicines which she can offer for different illnesses.  She hopes to be able to offer her customers what they most need.

Blanca's aim is to grow her business, increasing her income so that she can lead a more comfortable life with her daughters.  At the same time, she wants to make her loan repayments punctually.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Daniel se dedica a la compra y ventas de artículos de despensa como azúcar , aceite , huevo, etc.
  Esta casado con la Sra. María tienen un hijo en edad escolar , ella se dedica a la compra y ventas de ropas , calzado deportivos.
 Con un poco de su ahorro pudo montar su negocio.
Su forma de trabajo es la de recorrer barrios de la ciudad para vender sus mercaderias y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad de las fiesta para aumentar la ventas y al mismo tiempo las ganancias.
 El  necesita de este crédito para la compra de mas mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos , ya que llega las fiesta de fin de año.
En el futuro  desea abrir un local propio , y seguir distribuyendo.
texts.en:
Daniel earns his living buying and selling pantry items like sugar, oil, eggs, etc.  He is married to María and thy have one school-aged child.  María buys and sells sports clothing and shoes.  

Daniel was able to launch his business with a bit of his savings. He goes around to neighborhoods in the city selling his merchandise, and he would like to take advantage of the holidays to grow his sales and thus his earnings.

Daniel needs this loan to buy more merchandise because he has some orders for the coming new year's parties.  In the future he would like to open his own shop and continue distributing merchandise.

loans.use: To buy cider, sweet bread, and other consumer goods for the holidays.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana María; ella tiene 56 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia es ama de casa se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su casa, la socia solicito el préstamo para su uso personal, para la compra de algunos productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos de primera necesidad.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: The member belongs to the Los Heraldos community bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Ana Maria. She is 56, married and has 4 children. She is a housewife and raises her children and cares for her home. She is requesting a loan for personal use, for the purchase of various basic staples such as rice, sugar and milk. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of various basic staples. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making prepared foods

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. He owns a small shop where he has been selling medical supplies for 15 years. Despite his older age, he has to work hard in cooperation with his family members to reach a good financial levE.. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business and purchase additional equipment and supplies so he can increase his business sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to improve his business and purchase additional equipment and supplies

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.es: Epifanio, de 41 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Elida de 35 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Epifanio, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden aquejar sus plantas, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa, arveja y habas, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para poder ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Epifanio, age 41, is a kind and hardworking gentleman. He lives in his own home with his wife Elida, age 35, and their four beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Epifanio invests a great deal of effort planting in his fields, which are the main source of sustenance for his family. His products are in great demand at the wholesale market in Tarma and he has earned a reputation for producing crops of good quality, thus enabling him to sell at very good prices. What he enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and protecting them from insects that can have a negative impact. Epifanio has been farming for 26 years and considers the most difficult part to be tranporting sacks of potatoes, peas, and beans because they are extremely heavy and the work is tiring. Going forward, he hopes to buy additional farmland so that he can increase his production.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Epifanio knows that the loan will be beneficial to the development of his business. In his Communal Bank, Epifanio is a cheerful member who always tries to keep the meetings organized. The loan of 2500 PEN that he requested will be used to buy compost and insecticides to help keep his farmland productive.

loans.use: Purchase compost & insecticides

loans.name: Jovanne

texts.en: Jovanne R. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. He is 21 years old and is married with one infant. To make a living Jovanne owns and operates a store selling dried fish, such as tamban and pinikas, to the local community. Jovanne has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011 Jovanne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Jovanne is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This loan will be the first taken out by Jovanne from HSPFI. He plans to use the revenue generated from this additional investment to improve and expand the business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Buyankhishig

texts.en:
Mrs. Buyankhishig is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Buyankhishig’s family used to live in Bayankhongor province which is 700 kms away from the capital city and in 1995 they moved to Ulaanbaatar in search of a better life. 

Since 1995 Buyankhishig has been running a meat supply business using her old contacts. She travels to the countryside and buys meat from herders and transports it to the city and sells if to butchers. She has gained a lot of experience in the meat business and she has permanent suppliers and buyers. 

Buyankhishig has managed to buy a plot of land and a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent to live in. Last year she bought a small truck to deliver her products. This time Buyankhishig is applying for a loan to buy more meat products from her suppliers to sell to butchers.

loans.use: To buy more meat in the country to sell to butchers in the city.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a resident of Khanewal which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in Shanti Nagar which is a small residential area where she has been living with her family in a 3-room brick house for the past 25 years. She is a housewife, staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She is a very caring person and tries to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband's name is S. M. and he operates a vegetable-selling business. His shop is located in the market and he offers fresh seasonal vegetables to his customers at reasonable rates. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years. 

Nasreen has given birth to one son who is 15 years old and works in a private company and financially contributes to the family. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business to use in buying fresh seasonal vegetables for his shop. Nasreen is confident that an investment will help him making more money from his business. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Solidario Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
Solidario Dios Es Amor: este grupo esta formado por dos señoras y un señor D. los Cuales las dos señoras se  dedican a la venta frutas y verduras y  nececitan el credito para la compra D. frutas y verduras. 
Don Clementino Por su parte se dedica a la barberia el nos cuenta que a tenido un asenso en su negocio porque tiene mucha demanda D. sus clientes.el es presidente del grupo y se siente muy contento porque tiene la oportunidad D. un credito ya que cree que nececita D. mas capital para trabajar el nececita el credito para la compra D. cosmeticos para barberia su sueño es tener otro local y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Solidario Dios Es Amor: this group is comprised of two women and one man, of which the two women sell fruits and vegetables and need the loan to buy fruits and vegetables. 
Don Clementino, for his part, is a barber, and tells us that he has been promoted at work because he is in demand by his clients. He is the president of the group and he feels very happy because he has the opportunity to get a loan. He believes he needs more capital in order to work. He needs the loan to buy cosmetics for the barber's shop. His dream is to have another premises and so to have greater income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for a barber's shop and to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rosio

texts.es: La señora Rosio  tiene 28 años y esta casada hace 5 años con el señor Willy  tienen dos hijos Yendy de 9 y Rodrigo  de 3 años viven en su casa propia ubicada en el barrio Noel kenf mercado en la esto esta en la zona naciente del plan 3000 del departamento de Cochabamba. Esta pareja tienen una pequeña vidriera y ambos trabajan en la misma desde hace dos años haciendo trabajos de carpintería de aluminio y otros ella trabaja con su hijo en el lugar ya que no cuenta con niñera y los ingresos no le alcanzan para cancelar una y no se anima a dejarlo solo por su corta edad la situación de la subida de los precios no les a alcanzado para comprar material y su producción está empezando a estancarse por este motivo necesita el préstamo para poder comprar material y así poder sustentando a sus hijos y darles un mejor futuro
texts.en:
Rosio is 28 and has been married for 5 years to Willy. They have 2 children: Yendy, 9, and Rodrigo, 3. They live in their own home located in the neighborhood of Noel Kempff Mercado which is in the burdgeoning Plan 3000 zone of the department of Cochabamba. 

The couple has a small glass store and both have worked there for two years completing carpentry jobs with aluminum and other things. Rosio works with her son there since they don't have a nanny and they don't make enough money to pay one, but she doesn't want to leave him alone because he's so young. The situation caused by increasing prices has not allowed them enough money to buy materials and their production is beginning to stall. For this reason they need a loan to buy material and be able to take care of their children and give them a better future.

loans.use: to purchase glass panes

loans.name: Marion

texts.en:
Marion is a 25-year-old single lady. She owns a retail shop, which she has been running for about three years. She makes an income of about 15,000 KES per month. This is her first loan with Kiva partner, KADET, after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. She wants to use the loan to buy mineral water, soda and stationery.
Marion's future dream is to have a wholesale shop and buy a plot of land to develop.

loans.use: to buy mineral water, soda and stationery.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos  tiene 56 años, es casado vive con la esposa y un hijo de 8 años que se llama Carlos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Carlos  se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz, por mas de 25 años. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es seguir adelante a poayar a la familia.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Carlos is 56 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and 8 year-old son named Carlos.  He lives in the canton of Ventanas in Los Rios province.  

His communal bank is called "Narciso de Jesus" and is located in the rural San Temistocles settlement in the canton of Ventanas.  The members of this communal bank work in short cycle agriculture cultivating corn and rice.

Carlos has been farming corn and rice for more than 25 years.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month, and sells his crops in the market in the same locality.

He requests a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him financially to be able to buy the supplies he needs.  As a farmer, he encounters challenges such as pests, diseases and weather conditions that affect his crops.  His dream is to continue to get ahead so that he can support his family.

He enjoys working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina mujeres maravillas, fue creado a iniciativa de la Sra. Adelaida, ya que esta tiene un gran visión, así que decidió motivar a sus vecinas del barrio para que formen un comité que les permitan sentirse útiles, no solo a ellas sino también a sus familias, aportando para el pan de cada día. Actualmente son un grupo de 17 señoras que participan activa y solidariamente.
La Sra. Adelaida es la directora de finanzas del comité, ella se define como una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable, por lo que lleva con orgullo el puesto que posee. Ademas de ser la directora de finanzas, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, desde hace ya un bien tiempo, por lo que ya posee un numero de clientas bien definido, por lo mismo, sueña con poder comprar mas cosméticos para tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientas.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mas cosméticos que la ayudara para poder aumentar la diversidad de mercaderías, pues sabe que teniendo mas variedad podrá atraer mas gente.
texts.en: This committee, who call themselves "Mujeres Maravillas" ("Wonder Women"), was created on the initiative of Señora Adelaida. With great vision, she decided to motivate the other women in the neighbourhood to form a committee that would help them feel they were making a difference: something that was not just for themselves but also for their families, and that would put bread on the table. They are now a group of 17 women who participate actively and in solidarity. Señora Adelaida is the committee's finance director. She defines herself as an enterprising and very responsible woman, who holds her position with pride. As well as being the finance director, she dedicates herself to selling cosmetics. She has been doing this for a good while now and so she has a solid customer base. She would love to be able to buy more cosmetics, and so have a greater variety to offer these same customers. She is seeking the loan for the purchase of more cosmetics. This will help her increase her range of products, as she knows that with greater variety she should be abe to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gregorio Antonio

texts.es:
Gregorio Antonio tiene 32 años, Es soltero vive con los padres, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Gregorio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafioes como la falta de dinero para invertir. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para salir adelante. 

Le gusta hacer depote.
texts.en:
32-year old Gregorio Antonio is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

The V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA Community Bank is located in La Primavera Recinto, in Ventanas canton. Its members work in agriculture and grow corn and rice.

Gregorio too is a farmer and grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his supplies in the Peña store and sells them in the wholesale market in Ventanas. He is seeking a loan to buy corn and rice seeds as well as supplies and fertilizer for his fields. The money will help him to buy daily necessities. Gregorio faces challenges such as the lack of working capital. His dream is to continue working so that he can get ahead.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Oswaldo desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para seguir engordando a sus animales para seguir ofertándolos a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Oswaldo es una persona trabajadora, responsable y con muchas ganas de que su familia se supere cada día más.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a father, 39 years old, and lives with his wife and children in their own home. They have electricity and are located in the rural area of the Tambogrande district which belongs to the Piura department. This area is characterized for its agricultural, livestock, and artisan activities.

Oswaldo has been raising and selling sheep for 4 years and sometimes chickens. The chickens are kept in his backyard which is suitable and ample, are fed with a balanced feed, and surrounded by grass and natural grains so that they can grow healthy enough and be offered to different markets in his area to make profits to pay for family expenditures.

Oswaldo has requested Edpyme Alternativa a 500 Peruvian Soles loan to buy balanced feed to continue fattening his animals and continue selling them to his clients. With the profits he makes he will be able to pay back the loan and improve his familly's quality if life. Oswaldo is a hardworking responsible person with a drive to help his family advance daily.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his livestock

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
El señor Néstor forma parte de el grupo las sirenitas    tiene treinta y nueve  años de edad ,  tiene cuatro hijos todos son varones  ,  es ganadero y carnicero  su esposa Martha  le ayuda a  vender la carne  tienen un local en el mercado .
Tienen tres años atrás dedicándose a  vender  la carne  y alimentar sus vacas,a parte de ser  ganadero también se dedica a ser trabajos de albañilería es un señor muy trabajador de lo que sea  trabaja para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Desde muy chico  trabaja de ganadero ya que su papá Claudio es ganadero  el pidió el préstamo para comparar  alimento para  sus animales   a parte de vender carne de vaca vende todos los miércoles carne de marrano.
Esta muy contento por que  su sueño esta realizado quería  tener su propia tienda  para tener   una mejor calidad de vida.
Le da las gracias a fundación por  el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus  sueños.
texts.en:
Nestor is a member of the group "Las Sirenitas", meaning "The Mermaids". He is thirty-nine years old and he has 4 children, all of whom are boys. He is a cattle farmer and a butcher. His wife, Martha, helps him sell the meat from a stand in the market. 

He has been selling meat and feeding his cows for the past three years. Apart from being a cattle farmer he also takes on construction projects. He is a very hardworking man who works anywhere to achieve a better quality of life.

He has been a cattle farmer since he was very young. His father, Claudio, was a farmer. He requests a loan to purchase feed for his livestock. In addition to selling beef meat, every Wednesday he also sells pork meat.

He is very happy because he is achieving his dream of having his own store, to have a better quality of life.

He is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the support given to him to move forward and to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children.  

Alma has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconut for copras. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy bananas & coconut.

Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy bananas & coconut

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire, age 20, lives in the village of Capirpiriwan Cordon with her family. She spends her income on her only child who is still an infant. Claire is a hard-working woman who does not tire from struggling every day for her family’s well-being.

Claire raises and sells pigs within her village. She has been doing it for two years. According to her, hog raising is one of the main sources of income of the family.
