She always sees the need in her backyard piggery to make her pigs comfortable in their pens. In this matter, she is requesting a loan amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed for raising piglets. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for raising piglets.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, a 23-year-old single lady, lives in Capucao, Ozamis City, Philippines with her beloved family. Marites has been growing cassava plants and vegetables to earn a living for over 10 years, having learned about farming from her parents. With a monthly income of about PHP 7,000, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers for her crops.

Marites is a GDMPC member, having joined this year to gain access to financial services to increase her crop production. In the future, she hopes to own a house and lot for the family to live on.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr: Commerçante, elle habite dans une ville du Sénégal et s'active dans la vente de chaussures local qui sont fabriquées par des artisans. Cette commerçante fait dans la vente des chaussures depuis 2003 ou elle a commancé avec un petit montant. Avec ce prêt, elle veut relancer son activité qu'elle avait arrété a cause de son accouchement. Elle veut acheter de nouveaux marchandises pour augmenter son stock de marchandises qui avait diminuer suite a l'arret de ses activités. Ce prêt lui permettra de se relancer de nouveau et de reprendre son activité ou elle avait du profit.
texts.en: A retailer, this lady lives in a town in Sénégal and sells shoes made by local artisans. She has been selling shoes since 2003 and she began with a small sum as working capital. With this loan, she wants to get her business up and running again, as she was obliged to stop it when she gave birth. She wants to buy new merchandise to add to her stock which had diminished during the period where she had to stop working. This loan will allow her to take her profitable business back up where she left off.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe cuenta con 25 años de edad es casada tiene 2 hijas una se llama Maireth se encuentra estudiando 2º grado de primaria mientras que la mas chica solo cuanta con 2 años de edad su esposo se llama Héctor el cual se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio a la venta de pescado y verduras como son: chile, jitomate, y ejote y frijoles ella sale a vende a los pueblos vecinos lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verdura y pescado.

A la Sra. Guadalupe  le gustaría que su negocio incrementara más ya que pues le da ganancias y lo cual le ayuda en los gastos en la casa.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 25, is married and has two daughters.  One of them is called Maireth and is in second grade and the youngest is only two years old.  Her husband’s name is Héctor and he works in the fields.

She is a merchant.  She sells fish and vegetables like chilies, tomatoes, green beans and beans.  She goes out to neighboring towns to sell and used her loan to buy vegetables and fish.

Guadalupe would like her business to grow more because it produces profits that help her cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fish, chilies, tomatoes, green beans and beans.

loans.name: Chuon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Choun is a 54-years old farmer, married with three children in Kompong Chhnang province, where he has been living and cultivating rice crops for ages. From his business, he can earn an average of $1.25 USD per day. This low profit cannot provide the family a comfortable living. 

Mr. Choun was chosen to be the leader of this loan group of two members. The other group member is Mrs. Sdeung. She is a widow woman who is in a basket making business.

In an attempt to yield increased profits, Mr. Choun and Mrs. Sdeung have joined together to ask for some funds from Kiva. They want to use this loan to buy some cattle for breeding. This loan will help them increase their income and provide their families with a good standard of living. They are very grateful to all Kiva’s lenders who kindly provide their funds to help their families.

loans.use: to buy some cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Laberiano

texts.es: Laberiano tiene 48 años de edad, hace 15 años se casó con María de 46 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, de quienes solo cuida a 3. Todos moran en la calidez de un hogar propio en el anexo de Cochayoc, en el distrito de Acobamba. Laberiano y María, desde que se conocieron empezaron a la labrar las tierras. Cada uno por su lado aprendió el oficio con sus familias, una vez juntos ya iniciaron sus propias cosechas para su beneficio y el de sus hijos. En terrenos de su propiedad, Laberiano siembra arvejas, papas, espinacas, nabos, ollucos, zanahorias, entre otros. Siendo el producto que más ingresos le genera, las arvejas por su rapidez al florecer y engendrar sus vainas, así también por su demanda en la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelamente, se dedica a la crianza de ganados. En sus establos habitan 5 vacas, 2 toros, y 5 ovejas, las que engorda para venderlas en la ciudad, “compramos toretes, los pastamos, los engordamos en 6 meses, 1 año, depende del tamaño y los vendemos”, agrega. Éste padre luchador, menciona que, sus tiempos difíciles se debieron a al falta de capital, la mala distribución de los abonos en sus tierras y a la falta de insecticidas, razones que le han enseñado a lidiar con estos factores para las sucesivas siembras y cosechas. “Espero comprarme un carrito usado más adelante así me ahorraría pagar los fletes”, comparte, como metas dentro de unos años. Éste sería su préstamo número 9 de MFP, por eso Laberiano necesita de su ayuda, por su parte él se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.  “Cochayoc Centro” es el nombre de su banco comunal, ahí se siente a gusto trabajando con sus compañeros por compartir los mismo intereses. Laberiano podrá iniciar otras siembras para el mes de diciembre, enero y febrero, para ello comprará 10 bolsas de abonos para enriquecer dos de sus terrenos agrícolass.
texts.en: Laberiano is 48 years old and has been married to 46-year-old María for 15 years. The couple have five children but only care for three of them. They all live in the warmth of their own home which is located in the small village of Cochayoc, in Acobamba district. Laberiano and María started working their land when they first got together. Each of them learned the business from their family. Once they got together, they started growing their own crops for their own benefit and that of their children. On land which he owns, Laberiano grows peas, potatoes, spinach, turnips, ollucos (a native tuber), carrots and other crops. The crop which makes him the most income is the peas because they flower and grow in their pods quickly. They are also in high demand in the city of Tarma. In parallel with this work, Laberiano also raises cattle. In his stables he has 5 cows, 2 bulls and 5 sheep which he fattens and then sells in the city. "We buy young bulls, graze them and fatten them over a period of 6 months to 1 year, depending on the size, and then we sell them", he says. This tenacious father tells us that the difficult times he has experienced were as a result of a lack of capital, the bad distribution of fertilizers on his land and a lack of insecticides. For this reason, he has learned to cope with these factors in his planting and harvesting. "I hope to buy a used car in the future so that I can save money on paying to transport my produce", he says. This is one of his goals for the next couple of years. This will be Laberiano's 9th loan from MFP and he needs your help. For his part, he pledges to make his repayments on time. 'Cochayoc Centro' is the name of his community bank and he feels comfortable there working alongside his fellow members as they share the same interests. Laberiano will be able to start his December, January and February sowing. He will buy 10 sacks of fertilizers to enrich two of his plots of farmland.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a hardworking businessman aged 58.  He is married and blessed with four children.

Nelson has been running a butcher shop for the last four years to support his family. He also practices dairy farming to increase his income. Nelson employs two people at his butcher shop.

Nelson plans to use this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan from Kiva field partner Faulu Kenya to buy a cow to slaughter.  In the next five years, he plans to open another outlet of his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to slaughter

loans.name: Khakosi A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khakosi A Group in Western Kenya! Mariciana is the facilitator of the Khakosi A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mariciana takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mariciana had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Mariciana was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mariciana and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Mariciana will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khakosi A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is a 42-year-old man from the Kapkures area in Vihiga, a town situated in Western Kenya. He is married to Rael, and they have four children.

Gregory is a livestock trader in Vihiga, selling mainly cattle due to its high demand in the area, and he has done this business for the last 16 years. He is taking out his eighth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy livestock for sale. 

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family’s basic needs, like food, clothing, and shelter. He hopes to continue accessing loans from KADET so as to expand his livestock business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for sale

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
La Sra. Olivia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo”, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 34 años, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos de 18 y 16 años que están estudiando en el nivel  superior y el nivel secundario.
Se inició vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogo(Esika y Avon), desde el año 2007 forma parte de este Banquito comunal, con su primer préstamo S/. 300.00, compró una vitrina para exhibir sus productos, pero vive en un lugar alejado es por ello que en el 2009 su mamá le cedió un espacio en su casa, para vender otros productos como galletas, yogurt, snacks, caramelos, que poco a poco fue implementándolo, actualmente también vende abarrotes, gaseosas, sus clientes son vecinos, escolares y personas que transitan por su local, de esta manera piensa seguir creciendo económicamente, para contribuir con los gastos que implica los estudios de sus hijos. Ella está muy orgullosa de todo lo que está logrando con la ayuda del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, y agradece por los diferentes cursos y talleres que viene recibiendo, para motivarlas a seguir creciendo como mujeres de éxito.  
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  comprará  abarrotes (1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, litros de aceites 3 cajas de leche ) y productos de belleza, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Olivia, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es implementar un Mini Market donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes  variedad de productos y de esta forma convertirlo en un negocio familiar
texts.en:
Olivia belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II” (Women of the Hill II) communal bank in La Banda de Shilcayo District, San Martín Province and Department.  She’s 34 years old, has a spouse and two children who are 18 and 16 years old and attending to college and secondary school.

She started out selling beauty products via catalogue (Esika and Avon) and has been in the communal bank since 2007.  She used her first, 300 sol, loan to buy a display case to exhibit her products but she lives in a faraway place so in 2009 her mother gave her a space in her house to sell other products like cookies, yoghurt, snacks and candy.  Her customers are neighbors, school children and people who pass by her store.  She hopes to continue growing economically this way to be able to contribute to expenses related to her children’s schooling.  She is very proud of everything she’s accomplishing with help from the Manuela Ramos Movement and she is grateful for the various courses and workshops she’s been receiving to be motivated and continue growing as successful women.

She will use this 2000 sol loan to buy groceries (1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, liters of oil and 3 boxes of milk) and beauty products to meet her customers’ needs.

Olivia is a hardworking, enterprising woman.  Her dream is to open a minimarket where she can offer her customers a variety of products and turn it into a family business.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice, sugar, oil).

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 24 years old, single and an orphan.  She has been running a music stall for the past year and earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES, which she uses to meet her basic needs.

She is applying for her first loan through KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Cecilia will use this loan to buy more compact disks to stock her music stall.  With the anticipated profit generated by the loan, she will provide for her newborn baby.  She hopes and dreams of opening a retail shop, which will enable her to meet all her baby’s needs.

loans.use: to buy compact disks to sell in her music stall.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además es alegre y amable, es conviviente con Dennis quien es pescador. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad, de su padre y madre. Las actividades que realiza Carmen es la venta de ropa de segundo uso la cual compra en los centros comerciales de la ciudad, y los lleva a vender por los caseríos ubicados en los márgenes del los ríos, realizando ésta actividad desde hace 2 años. Del mismo modo se dedica a la pesca para lo cual cuenta con un bote pesquero, internadose en el río junto a lado de su pareja y 02 ayudantes a los que paga hasta 200 nuevos soles por su trabajo, dicha actividad lo realiza desdea hace 04 años.
Le gusta ambas actividades ya que la mantiene ocupada y se decidió por ellas por la necesidad de tener un oficio para contar un ingreso económico para solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Por lo contario, le incomoda cuando en una jornada no logran pescar lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos de la pesca, muchas veces debido a la crecientes, por lo que provoca la escacez de peces, pero eso no la desanima y continua, teniendo planes de seguir en su negocio. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal ya que considera a su grupo ser unido y colaborador. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles tiene planes de invertir en la compra de ropa de segundo uso a precio por mayor, así como comprar materiales para pesca como trampas y redes.
texts.en:
Carmen is 55 years old. She is a woman with a lot of business experience. She is also cheerful and friendly. She lives with Dennis, who is a fisherman. Together they live in their own home with their children, aged 18 and 15. Carmen's activities are selling used clothing which she buys in the city's shopping centers and sells them in the communities located on the riverbanks. She has done this for 2 years. She also fishes and has a fishing boat. She goes into the river with her spouse and 2 helpers whom they pay up to 200 nuevos for their work. She has done that activity for 4 years. 

She likes both activities since they keep her busy. She decided on both them because she needed a trade to have some income to pay for the household expenses and her children's education. On the other hand, she doesn't like it when a day's work doesn't bring in enough fish to cover the fishing expenses. Oftentimes, the waxing moon makes the fish scarce, but she doesn't get discouraged and she continues planning to stay in the business. This will be her first loan with the MFP institution and she hopes to have your contribution to meet her goals. She also remarks that she is pleased with her communal bank, since she considers her group to be close and cooperative. With the amount she has asked for, 1000 nuevos soles, she plans on investing in buying used clothing wholesale, as well as in buying fishing materials such as traps and nets.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and fishing materials such as nets and traps.

loans.name: Asoitupu

texts.en:
Asoitupu is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Uta. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Asoitupu grows crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Asoitupu has been engaged in this business for more than one year and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Asoitupu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Asoitupu requested her first loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Asoitupu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in southwestern Kenya and borders on Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Mary is married and has five children. She is an assistant chief and her husband runs a motorbike transport business. Both she and her husband practice farming. They have been farming for 10 years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, mangoes, citrus fruits, avocados and trees. Mary is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and it will provide her with honey for food.

This is Mary’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children and to provide for her family’s basic needs. Mary’s hope for the future is to have her children educated.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es: Mauricio de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el tiene un taller de costura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 40 años y es gracias a su trabajo como ha podido salir adelante con las gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Don Mauricio esta solicitando nuevamente otro crédito para la compra de mas hilos, botones, telas, elásticos, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.

loans.use: para la compra de mas hilos, botones, telas, elásticos, etc.

loans.name: Essi

texts.en:
Mrs. Essi A. was born in 1950 to a very large, poor family and did not have the chance to go to school. Very early on, she started small business activities to meet her own needs. As she had very limited means, she chose an activity that requires very few resources: preparing and selling maize porridge, donuts and cake. Later she got married to alleviate her hardship. But she realized later that she had chosen the wrong husband. The man abandoned her with nine (9) children. Staggering under the burden, she can no longer cope and is seeking help. Despite the profitability of her business, revenue is very scanty compared to her household\\\'s needs. To increase the revenue, she got a credit of $150 that she managed very well and paid back successfully. The second credit of $300 gave her a breath of fresh air and allowed her to sell essential products in addition to porridge. The credit of $550 she is requesting will allow her to buy wheat flour, sugar, rice, oil cans and other consumer products. This will allow significant growth of her revenue and improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, a Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1950 d’une famille nombreuse et pauvre, Madame A. Essi n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école. Elle se lança très vite dans le petit commerce pour subvenir à ses propres besoins. Limitée par les moyens, elle choisit une activité qui ne demande pas beaucoup d’argent : la préparation et la vente de bouillie de maïs, de beignets et de gâteaux. Entre temps, elle se maria pour atténuer ses peines. Elle se rendra compte plus tard qu’elle a choisit le mauvais homme. Aujourd’hui, mère de neuf (09) enfants, elle est abandonnée par son mari. Ecrasée par toutes ces charges, elle n’en peut plus et crie au secours. Malgré la rentabilité de son activité, le revenu est très insignifiant par rapport à l’importance des besoins de son ménage. Et pour augmenter ses revenus, elle bénéficia d’un crédit de $ 150 qu’elle avait géré et parfaitement remboursé. Le second crédit de $300 lui a donné un buffet d’oxygène et lui a permis de vendre en plus de la bouillie, des produits de première nécessité. Le crédit de $550 sollicité lui permettra d’acheter la farine de blé, de sucre, du riz, bidon d’huile et des produits de première nécessité. Ce qui d’augmentera considérablement ses revenus et lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, rice, oil cans and other consumer products

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: I am a single man, head of a household of five people. I am a Petty Trader and the main bread winner. I deal in the selling of second-hand books. I dropped out of school to take care of my siblings after the death of our parents due to HIV/AIDS in 1997.

loans.use: I will use the loan to expand my business.

loans.name: Everardo

texts.en:
Mr. Everardo Gómez needs to install a fence around his house. ”There have been a series of robberies in the neighborhood where I live; I have now the need to install a fence around my house, since my family is not safe during the night because I work the night shift in a Maquiladora (Assembly plant).

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Everardo Gómez necesita poner bardas en su casa “Se han presentado una serie de robos en la colonia en donde vivo, me veo en la necesidad de poner unas bardas alrededor de mi casa ya que mi familia esta insegura por las noches debido a que mi trabajo es en el turno nocturno en una maquiladora”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para poner bardas en mi casa.

loans.use: Install a fence

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
For the past 5 years, the little restaurant of Mrs Vân is a familiar address for the local villagers of Lưu Sơn (Đô Lương district). Despite the fact that the restaurant is quite busy from morning until night, the patrons always receive good service from Mrs Vân. They appreciate the fact that she treats all her customers the same way, no matter what their social status is. Mrs Vân’s husband and her 2 daughters help her out after their classes, waiting on patrons. Her dream is to make her little restaurant a popular spot, a meeting place for the local villagers and also to attract customers from out of town. She’s requesting a loan of 250 USD to stock more food and drink for her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Từ 5 năm nay, cửa hàng ăn của chị Vân là địa chỉ quen thuộc người dân xã Lưu Sơn, huyện Đô Lương. Bận rộn từ sáng đến tối nhưng những khách hàng đến cửa hàng không bao giờ phải than phiền về việc phục vụ kém chất lượng hay thái độ của chủ hàng. Bà chủ quán ăn 47 tuổi này luôn chu đáo với mọi tầng lớp khách hàng. Chồng chị và hai con gái ngoài giờ học cũng tích cực phụ giúp chị trong việc phục vụ khách. Ước muốn của chị Vân là cửa hàng của chị sẽ ngày càng quen thuộc hơn với không chỉ người dân trong xã mà còn với những khách ở xa. Chị Vân đang đề nghị Quỹ cho vay mức vốn 250 USD để mua thêm đồ uống và thức ăn cho quán ăn.

loans.use: buy drink and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es:
My Name is Argentina D., I have a business of sweets sales at home, and I also sell them at different offices. I have been doing this activity for several years that generates an income to cover my family’s expenses and my children education expenses. I need to invest more in order to satisfy my clients' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Argentina D., cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas en mi casa habitacion, y tambien lo distribuyo en las diferentes oficinas, tengo varios años de realizar esta actividad la que me genera ingresos para los gastos familiares y gastos de educacion de mis hijos, necesito invertir mas para satisfacer la demanda de clientes.

loans.use: Buy chicken, bananas, beans, oil, salt, spices, and wood.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a charming 42-year-old mother of four. Between taking care of her 4 children and supporting her son through the local computer institute, she finds time to manage her street-side shop, where she sells bed sheets, towels, children’s clothes, and underwear.

She started the business 12 years ago, and her client base has steadily grown ever since, though she has faced some challenges over the years. Her challenges are the typical issues associated with having a street-side shop. The weather is harsh in Kumasi. The sun can be damaging to her products over time. Furthermore, when it rains, Mercy has to quickly pack up her store until the clouds clear again. To alleviate some of these problems, Mercy hopes to eventually move into an indoor shop in the middle of the central market.

For now, she is saving money by increasing her product selection. In particular, she wants to add boxer shorts to her stock for the Christmas season. Boxer shorts are very popular but are relatively more expensive to purchase than her other products. When she gets her loan, she will be able to purchase 140 pairs before Christmas.

loans.use: To purchase boxer shorts for the Christmas season

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Mrs. Khiev T., age 47, works with her husband on her plantation growing crops, making around $4 each day. They have five children, three who are employed at a garment factory, and two who are students. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a cow to help her plow her field. This will lead to a greater output of crops and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her farm.

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.en:
Nilsa is a thirty-year-old woman who is contributing to the education of the children of Palavé, a community near San Cristobal. Five years ago, Nilsa founded a primary school since children in the community had to walk about an hour to the closest school to attend class. “It grieved me to see the kids in that situation, and I said that I might do something for them," says the entrepreneur who studied Learning Therapy and School Psychology.

Currently, the school provides a good education for fifty children. Nilsa has hired three teachers to teach the pupils. Nilsa says she will keep working hard to nurture in those kids the sense of responsibility and civic-mindedness.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will get some benches and blackboards repaired. Given this loan, Nilsa will be able to continue this very admirable work to help those children who are the future of our country.

loans.use: repair of benches and blackboard for a primary school.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. is married with 4 children. She is 38 years old and is from Edo state, Nigeria. . She sells clothes and baby wears. She has been in business since 1998. She needs the loan $425 to buy more products for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby products for re-sale

loans.name: William José

texts.es:
William Caceres is originally from the city of Chinandega. He has run his business from his own location for four years, selling shoes for men, women and children. William is a single father, with the great responsibility of taking care of and educating his young son and providing for all his needs. Thanks to the loans from Ceprodel, he has been able to purchase more shoes for his business, generating more income which helps pay for his son's studies and other requirements.

William's greatest need is another loan to purchase more stock for his business, and continue to generate the necessary income.

William C. es un caballero originario de la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente del municipio Somotillo teniendo su negocio en su propio local desde hace 4 años habiéndolo surtido con calzados para caballeros, damas y niños.

Es padre soltero y con la gran responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar el cual hasta este momento le ha suplido todas sus necesidades. Esto lo ha realizado gracias a los créditos que ha recibido de Ceprodel el cual los utiliza para la compra de zapatos y de esta manera, con la ganancia de las ventas beneficia a su hijo en los estudios y otras necesidades.

Hoy en día la mayor necesidad que tiene el caballero William C. es la urgencia de adquirir el préstamo para comprar los zapatos y así continuar brindándole a su hijo lo que el tanto necesita.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE SHOES TO STOCK HIS BUSINESS.   THE INCOME HE GENERATES HELPS THIS SINGLE FATHER TAKE CARE OF HIS YOUNG SON.

loans.name: Florentina Alberto

texts.en:
Florentina is 42 years old, originally from Xai-Xai in the Gaza Province. She married when she was 22 years old, but divorced in 1995. She had 2 children, the boy died when he was little and the girl is now 20 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Xai-Xai.

Florentina never worked before she got divorced. In 1995, she was hired as a cook for a construction company, and sent to Ponta D’Ouro to cook for the employees working in government construction. Ponta D’Ouro is a beach village bordering South Africa, famous for its tourism in the Maputo Province. After the construction was completed, Florentina was let go, but decided to stay on in Ponta. For the past 8 years she has been working in a house as a cleaning lady and guard. Her bosses live in Maputo and come to Ponta during weekends and long holidays. She earns MTn 1,500 per month.

Florentina heard about Hluvuku through a friend and decided to apply for a loan to build her house. Florentina lives at her bosses’ house, and as she has never received a raise in her salary for the past 8 years, the loan will be the only way to start buying construction material. This is Florentina’s third loan and it will still be used to buy more construction material. She already has the land and intends to start construction with this loan.

In the future, Florentina would like to finish building her house and buy furniture, always counting on Hluvuku’s loan. The picture shows Florentina with her cement blocks at her bosses’ house.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda lives with her daughter and son-in-law on Eduardo Avaroa Avenue in the Chamoco Chico zone of the city of La Paz.

She makes bed sheets for a living, which she sells to her neighbors in the nearby markets.

She will use this loan to purchase fabric for her business. We are proud to state that this is her seventh loan with Impro. Because of her good credit history, this client qualifies for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Arminda vive junto a su hija y yerno en la Avenida Eduardo Avaroa D. la zona D. Chamoco Chico ubicada en la ciudad D. La Paz.

Su actividad comercial es la confección D. sabanas, las cuales son vendidas a sus vecinos en mercados cercanos.

El crédito será destinado para la adquisición D. telas para su negocio. Orgullosamente comunicamos que este es su séptimo crédito con Impro, debido a sus antecedentes la clienta esta calificada para obtener el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Nguyen, though only 26 years old, is praised by the local people for her very keen business sense. She joined the Fund in 2002. She and her husband boldly borrowed from the Fund to raise pigs; after many rounds of funding and the livestock business going well they have been able to save a decent amount of money. With this money and supplemental loans from family they have been able to buy an automobile with the goal of offering freight service to people in need. Because of these bold business ventures the family’s finances are relatively good compared to local standards. Both of their children are school-aged and they are very obedient and are doing well in school. In this round of funding, the couple is asking for 9,000,000 VND to continue investing in raising livestock. Their average revenue is 4,000,000-5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị N., 26 tuổi mặc dù tuổi đời còn rất trẻ nhưng chị được mọi người điạ phương rất ca ngợi là người có đầu óc làm kinh tế, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2002, vợ chồng anh chị mạnh giạn vay vốn của Quỹ để chăn nuôi lợn, sau nhiều vòng vốn vay của Quỹ cùng với việc chăn nuôi thuận lợi, anh chị đã dành dụm được 1 số tiền khá khá, kết hợp với việc vay thêm của anh em họ hàng, gia đình anh chị đã mua được 1 chiếc ô tô với mục đích chở vật liệu thuê cho những nguời có nhu cầu. Từ những việc mạnh giạn làm đó đến nay kinh tế gia đình anh chị thuộc diện khá tại địa phương, 2 con anh chị đang trọng độ tuổi ăn học, các con anh chị rất ngoan và học giỏi. Vòng vốn này anh chị xịn vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ ->5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina sells different products such as sodas, juices, crackers, and sweets in her stand which is located in the Almirante Grau street in the area of San Pedro (La Paz). She is a single mother of two, and both her children are going to college (that is why they cannot economically help her at the moment, although Marina also does not want them to do it). Her home is located in the area of Miraflores (very far away from San Pedro).

This is the first credit that she is requesting with us and it requires your support. She will use the amount in order to buy products such as sodas, crackers, etc., which will allow her to reduce her costs, increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Marina se dedica a la venta de refrescos, jugos, galletas y dulces en un kiosco ubicado en la calle Almirante Grau de la zona de San Pedro (La Paz), es madre soltera de dos hijos que asisten a la universidad (por el momento ellos no pueden ayudarla económicamente, Marina tampoco quiere que así sea). Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Miraflores (esta zona queda muy lejos de San Pedro) . Este es su primer crédito con nosotros y requiere su apoyo. El monto será destinado para la compra de insumos (refrescos, galletas, etc.), lo que le permitirá reducir sus costos, aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy products for her business and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Juana Azucena

texts.en:
Juana started a business selling shoes in the neighborhood where she lives fifteen years ago. Over time, sales increased and generated good income. Therefore, she decided to start selling used clothing as well. She now has an established shop and wants to stock it more to increase her income. Juana is 44 years old, from Chiquimulilla, Santa Rosa, and has two sons who help her in her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Juana inició un negocio el cual consistía en la venta de zapatos en la colonia donde reside hace quince años. Con el paso del tiempo, fueron creciendo las ventas y le generó buenas ganancias y por consiguiente decidió empezar a vender ropa usada también. Ahora tiene un local establecido y desea surtirlo más para que tenga mejores ingresos. Juana tiene 44 años de edad, originaria de Chiquimulilla, Santa Rosa, y tiene dos hijos los cuales le ayudan ha vender.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Artemia

texts.es:
Artemia vive con su esposo y sus  4 hijo jóvenes.  Hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza D. animales,  lo que le ayuda en la economía D. su hogar, para educar a sus hijos, por ello toma todo el día en esta actividad, gracias a que pueD. criar sus animales dentro D. su casa, no tiene dificultades en atender su hogar y su negocio al mismo tiempo.Lo que le agrada es ofertar sus chanchitos en los mercados, ver que le dan buenas ganancias e ingresos por ellos, con los que pueda solventar los gastos D. su familia, lo difícil es trasportar  estos animales a las ciudades, ya que los carros llegan a su zona solo cada mes o por quincenas.
Artemia tiene en sus cuatro hijos, las cuatro razones D. por qué seguir trabajando con sus animales. 
Desea invertir mayor cantidad D. dinero en la compra D. ganado, los cuales aumenten su venta D. carne en los mercados y así ser una prospera comerciante.
texts.en:
Artemia lives with her husband and four young children. She has been raising animals for four years, which helps the household financially, and allows her to educate her children. She spends all day working, and thanks to the fact that she can raise the animals insiD. her home, she does not have any difficulty taking care of her home and business at the same time. She likes to sell her piglets in the markets and see that she gets good earnings and income from them. With this money she can pay for household expenses. It is difficult to transport the animals to other cities, as cars come to her area only every month or two weeks. Artemia has four children at home, and they are her reason to keep working with the animals. She would like to invest more money in the purchase of livestock, which will increase her meat sales at the markets and allow her to be as prosperous vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more livestock

loans.name: Mrs. Cheb Nan's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Tropeang Srongae Village in Kampong Chhnang Province make up the village bank loan. They plan to use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Cheb N. is the village bank president and a breeder who raises two cows and a pig. Aside from these businesses, she also makes a big pot which is made from cement. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more cement to make more big pots to fulfill her customers' demands. Mrs. Cheb N. is 32 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Fourteen members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more cement to invent more big pots to fulfill her customers' demands.

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en: Gairat is the loving father of four children. His wife works as a teacher in high school. But the salary is very small for teachers. So for almost 13 years Gairat has had his own business raising livestock. He buys cattle, fattens them and then sells them. He started his business with a small amount of money. He was also able to use money he made to expanded his business. He wants to borrow money to buy more hay for the winter season. This way he won't have to sell his cattle for less during winter season. Unfortunately Gairat was gone to the market to buy food when we came to take a picture. So we took a picture of his father and his wife who help him in his business.

loans.use: Gairat would like to purchase more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Antonia Socorro

texts.es: Antonia Socorro C. García es originaria del cantón Chuixchimal casada con cuatro hijos originaria  del Municipio de Totonicapán ella desde varios años viene ejerciendo dicha actividad  en la venta de articulo de consumo diario en  mercado municipal del departamento de Totonicapán  ella solicita un crédito en las oficina de ASDIR. Para surtir su mercadería y principalmente en estas épocas de navidad en adquirir productos de la época, uvas, galletas, duraznos luces, adornos con el fin de obtener algunas ganancias que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia Socorro C. G. is originally from Chuixchimal. She is married and has four children. Originally from the municipality of Totonicapan, she has been for many years running a business, selling consumer items of daily use in the municipal market in Totonicapan. She is requesting a loan from the offices of ASDIR (Kiva field partner), to restock her merchandise and especially for this Christmas season to purchase seasonal products, including grapes, cookies, sweet peaches, and decorations. Her goal is to obtain some earnings that will grant a better quality of life for her family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supplement her capital.

loans.name: Ahrullo

texts.en:
Ahrullo B. is 31 years old, married with two children. Ahrullo shoots videotape for wedding parties and other family occasions. He has been in this business for about 15 years now. Ahrullo tries to be creative in his job and, when shooting events and preparing the tape, he works as if making a movie for the  cinema. In the neighborhood, he is known as a very hard-working and diligent operator. He has many clients that makes the business successful and brings a stable income to his large family. 

Today Ahrullo is requesting 300 US Dollars for the term of eight months. He is planning to purchase a computer for his business. This is the first loan for Ahrullo and he would like to assure everyone supporting him that he will repay the loan in time and expresses his gratitude to everyone. 

---
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing a computer

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela tiene 45  años, vive en su propia casa con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Ella tiene un gran talento para elaborar lindas manualidades, las diseña y luego las elabora para venderlas por docenas o según le soliciten sus clientes, de esta manera  realiza estos trabajos. Estos manualidades son generalmente pequeños adornos, juguetes o objetos utilizados en las ambientaciones de las aulas en el colegio, y otros diversos, que su creatividad le permite, utiliza diferentes materiales; como lana, telas, cartón, entre otros. En un muestrario, que elaboró ella misma, ofrece sus manualidades, para la época navideña elaboró una serie de adornos acordes a la ocasión que fueron su mejor entrada económica en esta fecha, es por ello que  Graciela quiere tener un puesto de exposición, donde pueda dar a conocer con mayor  notoriedad sus trabajos y también ofrecer el servicio de enseñanza de confección de manualidades. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y sigue muy convencida de seguir el trabajo que realiza en su banco comunal. El dinero solicitado se invertirá, una parte, en la compra de adornos para vender, y la otra parte, la usará en adquirir telas, hilos y demás materiales necesarios para la elaboración de sus manualidades.
texts.en:
Graciela is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She is very talented at creating beautiful handicrafts: she designs them and later makes them to sell by the dozen or by special-order for her clients. These crafts are usually decorations, toys or articles used in the classroom or for any other use which she can dream up. She uses a variety of materials such as wool, fabric and cardboard among others. She created a sample showing her handicrafts with a Christmas theme, this series of decorations was her best-selling to date. Because of this, Graciela wants to have a place to showcase her crafts, so that her work can become better known and where she can offer lessons on creating such handicrafts. This is her second loan with MFP and she is committed to continued membership in the community bank. She will invest the loan monies in part to buy decorations for resale and in part to buy fabrics, yarn, and other materials she will need to create her handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make crafts and other decorations for resale.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: K., 43, lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She earns a living selling different kinds of clothes, including lady clothes and man clothes, and has invested since 2005. She is widowed and currently takes care of two children: her second child is working in an organization with a suitable salary and the second child is attending school. K. works hard everyday and is a very responsible mother to her family. K. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more clothing to sell. The loan will help her increase extra income to sustain the family's expenses and to make sure her second child receives higher education.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Viviana Liliana

texts.es:
Esta socia se llama VIVIANA, ella tiene 23 años de edad y tiene 01 hijo, de 1 año.

Esta socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella cria aves de corral como son, gallinas, pollos, patos y cuyes, ella tiene entre sus labores del hogar a esta actividad, ella es madre soltera y vive con su menor hijo y es padre y madre; ella necesita el préstamo para así poder hacer un capital mayor y comprar mayor numero de animales y crecer su producción.

Ella esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan por este medio y se compromete a pagar en su totalidad el préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
This group member is called Viviana and she is 23 years old. She has a one year old son. Her business is raising small animals, such as fowl, hens, chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs. She has both household tasks and business tasks. She is a single mother and lives with her child and her parents. She needs the loan so that she can increase her capital and buy more animals to make her production grow. She is very thankful for this opportunity and is committed to paying the loan in full within the determined term.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals

loans.name: Bilquis Imtiaz Ali Group

texts.en:
My name is Bilquis and I’m a married lady. I have lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past 12 years. My husband's name is I. A.. He sell construction supplies in a shop in the community, and people used to come to him to buy the supplies. Mr. I. earns a good income through this business. But we are all aware of the economic crisis, and it's difficult for a single person to manage the expenses of a whole family. So I operate a business sewing clothes. This business allows me to pay off the school fees of my two kids. I am applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies for my husband’s business.

I am the group leader of five other women from my locale. Lubna nasreen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Rukhsana shamim baji wants a loan to buy shawls for her business selling shawls. Maqsood begum baji wants a loan to buy biscuits and chips for her canteen. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food business. Shakila baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth, shoes, bags, and clothing

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
el Sr. Jorge O. tiene 36 años de edad y tiene un negocio de venta de comida en el mercado los dolores de Tegucigalpa, el tiene 4 locales donde junto con sus trabajadores cocian y asan la carne para venderla y atender a la clientela que tienen en la zona, el tiene mas de 6 años de trabajar en el negocio, tiene 2 hijos los cuales no reciden en tegucigalpa, ellos estudian en la zona sur del pais, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza el Sr. Jorge en su negocio logra darles todos los gastos como ser educacion, alimentacion, distracciones, salud,.
el necesita el credito para poder comprar mas carnes y refrescos ya que la demanda de sus clientes es mucha y a veces se le termina rapido la comida.
texts.en:
Jorge O. is 36 years old and has a business selling food in the Los Dolores market in Tegucigalpa. He has 4 places where he and his workers cook and grill the meat that they sell and serve to their customers in the area. He has worked in his business for more than 6 years. Jorge has 2 children who don’t live in Tegucigalpa—they go to school in the southern part of the country. Thanks to the effort Jorge puts into his business he is able to pay for all of their needs such as education, food, entertainment, health, etc. Jorge is requesting this loan so he can purchase more meat and soft drinks, since his customers’ demand is great and he sometimes runs out of food quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beef, pork, chicken, beans, tortillas, vegetables, soft drinks, plates, glasses, plastic forks, rice, cheese, and butter.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a food vendor who sells rice porridge, cassava, yam and palm fruits. She believes selling multiple products enables her to meet her household demands. She is 30 years old, married and has two kids who are pursuing education in primary school. Grace is hardworking and resourceful for her family. She has been in business for 22 years.

Grace wants to use this loan to procure goods in bulk to cut down on transportation costs. She is a member of the trust bank group Eye Adom (translated it means Grace) whose members guarantee for one another to access loans and support one another in handling repayments.

loans.use: To procure rice, cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. VICTORIA, ella es proveniente de Paucartambo, ahora radica en Pilcopata, perteneciente a la selva de Cusco, están a 8 horas en bus público desde la misma ciudad del Cusco.

 La socia vino a Pilcopata hace mas de 4 años y se quedó enamorada de su clima y de su gente, ella actualmente alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención a tiempo casi completo de su tienda abarrotes, ella tiene 47 años de edad y tiene 6 hijos los 2 últimos de (18, 14) años; ella no está casada pero vive junto a su pareja que es el padre de sus hijos hasta hoy, el se dedica a la agricultura y juntos siguen adelante ayudando a sus hijos con los estudios superiores y demás obligaciones, la socia requiere el préstamo en razón de implementar su tienda abarrotes con productos que trae de la sierra de Cusco para ser vendidos en este valle cálido y así abastecer a los pobladores.

La socia está muy agradecida con el préstamo y se ratifica en cumplir con el pago total de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Victoria is from Paucartambo but now lives in Pilcopata, which is part of the Cusco jungle and is 8 hours by bus from the city of Cusco. She came to Pilcopata more than 4 years ago and fell in love with the weather and the people. Currently she is both a homemaker and takes care of her grocery almost full time. She is 47 years old and has 6 children, the youngest two are 18 and 14 years old. She is not married but lives with her common-law husband who is the father of her children. He is a farmer and together they work to help out the children with their education and other needs. She needs a loan to stock her store with goods which are brought from the mountains of Cusco to be sold in the valley. She is grateful for the loan and confirms that she will repay it within the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Sgeam

texts.en: Sgeam S., 30, has been involved in a business of producing traditional tools to make an offering to spirits (this tool is commonly used by Cambodian people for asking the spirit to bring peace and happiness for their family). Together S. and her husband have four children attending a local school. Her husband has been involved in a business similar to S.'s, too, so S. plans to take a loan of US$ 700 to buy raw materials to produce the tools.

loans.use: Buying raw materials to produce her "tools"

loans.name: Maria Bertilda

texts.es: La señora María Bertilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Próceres”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella, estudiantes y es por ellos que María, trabaja muy duro día a día.Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de Abarrotes que poco a poco fue aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad, haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  En la actualidad tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con alegría y entusiasmo. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. María Bertila, anhela ampliar e implementar mas su bodeguita y manifiesta que lo va a hacer realidad,  porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo cumple.
texts.en:
Sra. María Bertilda belongs to the communal bank group “Los Próceres” (The Great Ones), which meets in the Tarapoto District of San Martín Province, Department of San Martin. She is 38 years old and married. She has 2 dependent children who are students, and for this reason she works hard every day. Her entrepreneurial spirit and love for her family motivated her to start her own business selling groceries. As she gradually obtains more business and becomes more experienced, she is becoming widely known and beloved by her clients. She currently has regular customers who visit her store on a daily basis and can find anything a housewife would need. María Bertilda personally attends to each one with much joy and enthusiasm.

With her loan of 1000 soles, she will buy rice, bags of sugar, packaged noodles, canned fish, cartons of milk, eggs and personal hygiene products. This will help her continue to provide excellent service to her customers. María Bertilda is eager to expand her grocery store and hopes that it will become a reality one day. She is a determined woman who carries out what she intends to do.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to increase her assortment of products

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en:
Tuvshinbayar M. is 23 years old and lives with her parents in Arhangai Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She has a small retail business selling clothing. With her business profit, she looks after her parents. Her parents have been in the retail clothing business since 1995. Since the beginning, she helped in her parents' business. 

In 2002, she has started her own retail business by selling various men and women clothing and small household items at the Hasu Shopping Center, one of the largest shopping centers in the town. She currently rents three stalls at the shopping center. She sells products that she brings from Ereen, China, a border town where many cheap Chinese products are exported to Mongolia. She says that becaue her business is the sole family income, she works hard to make her living and look after her parents.
 
She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing and small items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her business

loans.name: Set Net Point Group

texts.es:
La  señora Linda Rachell H.W.es la responsable de 11 personas de la comunidad de Set net Point las cuales están siendo beneficiadas con materiales eléctricos para poder tener luz eléctrica en sus viviendas, ya que en esta comunidad, no existe este servicio. La comunidad de Set Net Point esta ubicada al norte de la ciudad de Bluefields a unas tres horas en panga con motor fuera de borda vía marítima e históricamente no han tenido acceso a este servicio, Por tal razón ADEPHCA-KIVA y Blue Energy están buscando financiamiento a través de los créditos de Kiva materiales eléctricos que consisten en lo siguiente: 
Una cuchilla con 2 fusibles que cuesta US 12 cada una, un controlador de carga focos cuesta US 35 cada una, una lámpara de 11 Wats cuesta US 10 cada una , un cepo de bujía cuesta US1 cada uno, un interruptor cuesta US1 cada uno y alambre eléctrico numero 14 que cuesta US 51 dólar por los 11 beneficiarios. 
Se espera con este financiamiento que les permita a los beneficiarios poder aprovechar la luz eléctrica para mejorar su nivel de vida y aprovechar parte de la noche en sus quehaceres diarios, En la foto no aparece el señor Kardell T. López ya que se encontraba realizando faenas de pesca.
Cabe mencionar que se acaba de financiar por parte de Kiva a otro grupo de la comunidad de Monkey Point, los cuales ya están en repago sus créditos y ya cuentan con luz eléctrica.
texts.en:
Sra. Linda Rachell H.W.is responsible for 11 people in the community of Set Net Point who have joined together to receive electricity for their homes because this service is not provided in the area. The community of Set Net Point is located north of the city of Bluefields and is 3 hours away by motorboat. This area historically has not had access to electricity service. ADEPHCA has partnered with Blue Energy to seek funding through Kiva to purchase the following electrical materials:

• blades with 2 fuses that costs $12 USD each • charge controllers that costs $35 USD each • 11 Watt lamps that costs $10 USD each • light bulb clamps that cost $1 USD each • light switches that cost $1 USD each • #14 electrical wiring that costs $51 USD for 11 beneficiaries

It is hoped that this funding will allow these families to take advantage of electricity service so that they can improve their standard of living and perform their household chores at night. Sr. Kardell T. López does not appear in the photo because he was away at his job as a fisherman.

It is worth mentioning that Kiva funding was used to finance another group in the community of Monkey Point. They are already repaying their loans and now have electricity.

Click HERE to view the group loan for the Monkey Point community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment & supplies needed to receive electricity

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is forty years old, widowed and a mother of three children ages 13, 17 and 20. She is a member of the Muhimba borrowers’ group in Ilala, located in Tanzania’s Iringa administrative region. Ten years ago Jane set up shop selling commodities like rice, cooking oil, soda, Colgate personal products and cake. She works fourteen hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jane’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more stock for her shop. With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan, Jane hopes to save more money and expand her business.

About BRAC Tanzania:

BRAC Tanzania is guided by the vision to aspire and work towards a just, enlightened, healthy and democratic society free from hunger, poverty, environmental degradation and all forms of exploitation based on age, sex, religion and ethnicity. The vision is explicitly reflected in the mission statement, which is to strive to bring about positive changes in the quality of life of the poor wherever it works.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly V. is a young rice farmer from Agusan Del Sur. She is 19 years old and a single mom to a 1-year-old child. Her rice field still needs additional farm supplies. Beverly is a new member of CEVI, and she knows for a fact that its program is helpful for farmers. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to be used for additional farm supplies. Her income from her farm will be a big help to her family’s daily needs and hopefully will enable her to save up for her child’s education.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Chhauy

texts.en: Actually, fish is the main source of food for everybody in Cambodia, and almost all of the Cambodian people depend on catching fish to earn a living. One of these people is Mr. S., who is 40 years old. He wakes up when the sky is still dark in order to prepare his equipment to fish in and around the creek in his community. After he has finished fishing, he provides the fish for his wife to sell at the local fish market. S. is taking out his loan to buy more essential fishing tools in order to accumulate a greater quantity of fish. Note: Mr. S.'s wife is shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more essential fishing tools in order to accumulate a quantity of fish

loans.name: Haron Kipkemei

texts.en:
Haron is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children. His retail business is located at the Kiluka Market in Eldoret.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan he is requesting from KADET, he will add more inventory, which includes 
sugar, rice, baking flour and cellular airtime cards. His dream is to expand his business.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more inventory to his store

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 37-year-old married father of five. He owns a timber yard in the Kyumbi area of Machakos where he sells timber. He also earns extra income by running a hardware shop next to the timber yard. Stephen is requesting a third loan of Kes 80,000 to add a stock of timber to his business. He describes the business environment in which he operates as very busy and employs three employees. About Faulu Kenya: Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To add to his stock of timber

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy S. est une femme de 53, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de bayouf depuis 2 ans et y a eu des performances remarquables. Elle fait de la restauration, ses bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de leur famille.
texts.en:
Amy S. is a woman aged 53, married with eight children. She has been a member of the Village Loan Group of Bayouf for 2 years and has had a remarkable track record. She is involved in food preparation, and her profits allow her to support her husband in taking care of their family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To run a food preparation business

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is an 18-year-old single woman. Four years ago she learned hairstyling and, in 2007, she decided to open her own beauty salon and began a new career.

Today, Walaa is requesting $1,200 to buy products needed for her salon.

loans.use: To buy products needed for her salon

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl L. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 36 years old. Cheryl is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cheryl raises and sells pigs. Cheryl has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Cheryl joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cheryl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to build a shelter for her pigs. This will be Cheryl's 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and pay for her children's education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her pigs

loans.name: Tagbaneh Group

texts.en: These are members of the Tagbaneh group in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking loans of SLL 1,200,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. In the middle of the photo is Fatu K. who is the leader of this group. Fatu was born in Makeni about fifty-eight years ago; she is a widow with eight children. Six of Fatu’s children are already grown-ups and two are attending secondary school. Fatu has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells market-food – rice, palm oil, onions, salt, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy  the above-mentioned items in larger quantity.

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, palm oil, onions, salt

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  ALICIA, pertenecen al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, la socia vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 28 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, Nuestra socia vende artesanía en la plaza principal de Pisac en la feria artesanal, ella tiene un stand de artesanía y vende todo tipo de arte expresivo. Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir como capital de trabajo y comprar materia prima para la elaboración de artesanía.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, ALICIA, belongs to the "PRO DESARROLLO" community bank. She lives in Pisac, 40 minutes from the Peruvian city of Cusco. Pisac is a small town, a heritage site of lovely Inca-era buildings that is an obligatory stop for tourists on the way to Cusco.

Alicia is 28 years old, partnered and has 2 children, 8 and 5 years old. She is responsible for taking care of both her family and her business. She operates a crafts business in the artisans market in Pisac's main square. She sells all kinds of crafts. She is applying for the loan so that she can buy the basic supplies she needs to make the crafts she sells.

Alicia is grateful for the opportunity that micro-lending offers her and she is committed to repaying the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for crafts business.

loans.name: Olga's Group

texts.en:
Olga D. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 37 years old. Olga is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Olga D..

Olga is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Olga owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Olga has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Olga joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Olga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Olga is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Olga from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kyazaire Hiv/aids Tweyambe Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
B. Jouvline (shown inset and also in the main photograph) is the leader of her lending group in Bushenyi. She is 27 years old, married, and has one child who is not yet in school. She also takes care of two dependants.
Jouvline is a friendly and determined lady with a business selling beans for home consumption from Kasheshero trading center. Although she mostly sells fresh stock, her profits are not yet large enough to sustain her well. This is why she wants to expand her business further as well as stay together as a happy family. She is requesting a loan to increase her stock by buying more beans in bulk for resale.

loans.use: To buy more beans for resale

loans.name: Aris

texts.es: Aris de 26 años de edad, es casado  labora como docente de la Escuela Francisco Aaron Joce de Nueva Guinea desde hace 5 años, su esposa tambien labora como docente de primaria, ambos comparten los gastos familiares, a pesar que no tienen hijos ellos ayudan a su familares cuando lo necesitan , esta solicitando su 3er crèdito  para comprar materiales de construcciòn  ya que le hacen falta  para poder iniciar a construir su propia casa para brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia y vivir en su propio hogar, el se  caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesto y con mucho deseos de superaciòn personal y profesional,  el sueño  es tener trabajo y  seguir profesionalizandose para que sea un hombre de bien y que sea util a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Aris, 26, is married and has been employed as a teacher in Nueva Guinea's Francisco Aaron Joce school for 5 years; his wife is also an elementary school teacher. Together they share family expenses. Even though they have no children, they help their relatives when they need help. He is asking for his 3rd loan to buy building materials because he needs them to start building his own house so that he can provide better comfort for his family and live in a house of his own. He is noted for being very responsible, honest and with a strong desire to improve both personally and professionally. His dream is to have steady employment and to continue to train in his profession so that he can be an upstanding citizen who is useful to society.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Maribel

texts.es:
Las reuniones del Banco Comunal San Andrés las vienen realizando en la parroquia Picoaza a unos 10 minutos de la capital manabita, la señora Gloria pertenece a este Banco desde hace 8 ciclos.

La señora Gloria de 39 años es madre soltera de dos hijos se dedica hacer una excelente ama  de casa, pero por motivos que tiene que dedicarse a los hijos y no puede trabajar sola, ella decidió entrar a trabajar en sociedad con su hermano, el dinero que recibe de la fundación lo invierte en la venta informal de productos como carteras, delantal, mandil, con este crédito invertirá todo en el negocio, el  hermano de la señora Gloria sale a vender recorriendo de ciudad en ciudad en la misma provincia donde viven ya tiene sus clientes fijos en ciudades como Chone, Calceta, y  Junín.

Para abastecerse tienen que viajar hasta  Quito donde hacen las compras en los grandes distribuidores, el hermano de la señora Gloria compra según lo que mas vende, una vez que haya vendido y saca el capital le devuelve a la señora gloria, el sueño de nuestra socia es poder tener un negocio mas completo como un almacén y ella misma atenderlo sin tener que salir.
texts.en:
The meetings of the communal bank San Andrés are conducted in Picoaza parish, about 10 minutes from the capital, Manabita. Señora Gloria has belonged to this bank for 8 cycles. Señora Gloria is 39 years old, is a single mother of two children and spends her time taking excellent care of her household. But because she has to take care of her children and can't work alone, she decided to enter into a business partnership with her brother. She will invest the money that she receives from the corporation in the informal sale of products like wallets, kitchen aprons and leather aprons. The entire loan will be invested in the business. Señora Gloria's brother makes their sales by going from city to city in the province where they live. He already has steady customers in cities like Chone, Calceta and Junín. To stock up, they have to travel all the way to Quito, where they make their purchases from the large distributors. Señora Gloria's brother makes their purchases according to what sells well, and once everything has sold, he figures the capital and returns it to Señora Gloria. Our member's dream is to have a more complete business, like a shop that she can work in herself and not have to go out.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase clothing, kitchen aprons, wallets and leather aprons.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon S., 46, is a widow and the mother of two unmarried children. She earns a living as a fish catcher in and around Tunle Sap Lake — a good place to find fish. She usually makes $3 a day to support her family. Suon S. became a Kiva borrower some time ago. She is taking out her second loan to purchase more tools for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for fishing.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Descripción:	El Sr. Roberto tiene 37 años, y esta en pareja con la Sra. Clara con quien tienen 3 hijos todos en edad escolar.                                Sr. R. se dedica a la compra y venta de Carbón Vegetal desde hace 5 años en forma independiente antes trabajaba como cobrador de una casa comercial que luego salio para independizarse y formar su propio negocio.
Actualmente esta actividad lo realiza en forma personal pero su objetivo mas adelante es el de trabajar como mayorista y tener  vendedores y así poder agrandar su zona de trabajo y llegar a tener mayor ingreso.
El crédito será  destinado a la compra de carbón al por Mayor.
texts.en:
