Roberto is 37 years old. Clara is his life partner, and they have three school age children. Mr. R. has been working independently selling charcoal for five years. He previously worked as collector for a commercial house. He then left in order to become independent and form his own business. He currently personally makes sales, but his objective later on is to work as a wholesaler and to have salespeople. That way he will be able to expand his work area and come to have greater income. The loan is to buy charcoal wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Mrs. Navy R. is 39 years old, and she is a villager in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kimleng Chea, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops. For this farm, Mrs. Navy R. decided to ask for a loan to pay for a laborer to plow her farm and to buy the hose to support her water (irrigation) machine. This couple has four children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a chef while the youngest one is attending in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to pay for a laborer to plow her farm and to buy hose for irrigation

loans.name: Mr. Khin Kheav Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is made up of twelve people who live in Sampan Leu village in Kandal province. Mr. K. K. is the village bank president, selected by the other members, who will each use a piece of the loan for a different purpose. He is a fish seller at his local market. His business is going well so he wants to expand. To improve his business, Mr. K. K. is asking for a loan to buy more fish to resell. His wife, Mrs. Pheng Sok, is a laborer. He is the father of two children, both of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn R. is from the village of Baybay Balatacan Bonifacio. She is 30 years old. Charlyn is single. To make a living, Charlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as snack foods, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Charlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Charlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Charlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
 
About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
From the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, Flora B. is 53 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling mangoes in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan for 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mrs. Nov Tob Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has fourteen people who has been selected Mrs. Nov T. is a village bank president who is 35-year-old located in Bak Ronoas village in Takeo province. All the members will use portion of their loan for varied ways in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Nov T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. TO. Mean, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they can earn less income. So to improve their family living, Mrs. Nov T. is seeking for a loan to buy some piglets, pig food, and rest of the loan she builds pigsty for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other two are attending in local public school, and the other is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To buy some piglets, pig food

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, reside en el municipio de concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, es casado vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya están acompañados y solo tiene un hijo en la casa que depende del, el tiene un negocio de venta de refrescos y boquitas.
El negocio surgió por iniciativa propia su horario de trabajo es de 8 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde actualmente una de sus dificultades es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder surtir su negocio, por lo cual está solicitando el crédito para compra de jugo, bebidas carbonatadas, productos para hacer refrescos naturales y boquitas.
El crédito le ayudara a crecer mas en el negocio y podrá contar con la mercadería necesaria para satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, uno de los riegos es que las deudas disminuyen o que los costos se eleven.
Las aspiraciones de José es contar con un negocio grande que le permita generarle a su familia una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
José lives in the town of Concepción Batres, department of Usulután. He is married and lives with his wife and four children. Three of them have already found mates and he only has one child at home who depends on him. He has a business selling beverages and snacks. The business began by his own initiative. His work schedule is from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. Right now one of his difficulties is that he does not have enough money to diversify his business. That is why he is asking for the loan to buy juice, carbonated beverages, products to make natural beverages, and snacks. The loan will help him to grow his business more and be able to have the merchandise necessary to satisfy the customers' demands. One of the dangers is that the credit will go down, or costs will go up. Jose's aspires to having a business big enough to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy juice, carbonated beverages and snacks

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “KUSIKOYLLOR ”,   El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Balbina;   ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y nos comenta que todos sus hijos ya son independientes;  La socia se dedica al servicio de transporte tipo colectivo en zona urbana, La socia tiene una couster , la socia está pagando las letras finales de su carro.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el pago de su penúltima letra del carro.            
      .
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to “KUSIKOYLLOR ” community bank, located in Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Balbina; she is 50 years old and married. Her children are independent and able to support themselves. Balbina works in public transportation and is paying the final installments on her vehicle. She requests this loan to make her second to last car payment. Balbina is grateful for and values this loan opportunity and is committed to completing her repayment in the specified time.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make penultimate car payment.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen is a resident of Lahore, which is the second largest city in Pakistan and a popular city known for its history and culture. She lives in the area of Yadgar with her husband and three children. All three of her children are working. Her eldest son has a business making furniture. Her middle son and the youngest son work as salesmen in a department store. None of her children could complete their education due to financial reasons and had to leave their education to help support the family financially. 

Perveen supports her family financially with her sewing work. She sews clothes for neighborhood clients specifically. She is good at it and gets regular orders. She charges between 100-150 PKRs for each dress which doesn’t feel high to her customers and they give her good orders.  

She has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her eldest son with his furniture-making business. With the loan amount he will buy wood, nails and a furniture polisher of good quantity which will enable him to make more furniture for his business and improve his sales. 

Perveen is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 4th loan. In every loan year she has been found very responsible in paying back her installments and in attending meetings.

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails and a polisher for furniture-making business

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo N., 47, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. N. sells groceries for an income of USD 3.5 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend  70 USD on food,  5 USD on electricity supply, 20  USD on children education, and10  USD  on transportation every month.  

Sreymom is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel R. G. 57 años de edad, se dedica al cuidado de la imagen de las personas, tanto de hombres como de mujeres y niños, ella vive en San Juan Opico, un pequeño pueblo ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual reside junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como ordenanza y junto a una nieta de 16 años de edad. María posee una sala de belleza, la cual esta ubicada en  su casa de habitación, una zona muy apta para todo tipo de negocio, ya que es un lugar muy concurrido. Ella es una persona la cual realiza un excelente trabajo, elaborando diferentes servicios como: cortes de cabello, tintes, faciales, pedicure, entre otros más, María es muy recomendada en el lugar ya que desde hace 13 años que ella se dedica a este trabajo, el cual con el paso de los años ha ido perfeccionando, por lo que sus clientes están muy satisfechos, lo que es de mucho beneficio para ella ya que la recomiendan con más personas. María no solo es una persona muy trabajadora, sino también es una mujer muy dedicada a su hogar, ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  invertir en su negocio, y así mejorarlo,  para contar con más cliente y de esta forma salir adelante.
texts.en: María Isabel R. G. is 57 years old. Her job is to groom her clients, from men to women and children. She lives in San Juan Opico, a small town in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband, who works as a porter, and a 16 year old niece. María owns a beauty salon, which is located in her home, in an area suitable for all types of business because it is always very busy. She does an excellent job and provides different services such as haircuts, hair colouring, facials and pedicures, among others. María has been working in the area for 13 years and she gets lots of recommendations. She has refined her technique and her clients are very happy, which is very beneficial for her because she is recommended to more and more people. María is not only very hard working, but also devoted to her family. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business in order to improve it, so she can serve more customers and get ahead.

loans.use: Buy products for beauty salon.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: But

texts.en: Mrs. But N. currently makes rattan furniture. She is 28 years of age and is a resident of Kompong Tom province which is located about 200km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She lives with a young child who goes to school. N. has a life partner in her husband, who is shown in the photo here, and who also assists her in the rattan trade. N. and her husband also cultivate crops on their own farmland from which they often receive extra income. This season is good for planting so N. is requesting a loan to use towards growing new crops.

loans.use: To use towards growing new crops.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 65 años, él vive solo, la única compañía que tiene son sus inquilinos que viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Huaricolca. Hace ya algunos años que se jubiló, pero a pesar de ello afirma “que el sentido de su vida es el campo y poder producirlo”. Ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a la agricultura, tiempo suficiente, para trabajarla y comercializarla a un buen precio. Sus cultivos de papa y avena, son muy productivos y en campañas agrícolas suele viajar a la ciudad de Tarma, donde gracias a su buen juicio en las ventas, puede terminar en menor tiempo todos sus sacos de papa. Pero él siente, que ya no tienen la fuerza de antes; por ello esta ahorrando un monto considerable de dinero, con el que comprará una casa en la ciudad y de esa manera pueda cuidar su salud. Paralelamente está pensando incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de tubérculos, donde será comerciante mayorista. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, y como fiscal de su banco comunal, está muy contento de poder ayudar a sus integrantes a salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono orgánico, para su próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en:
65-year old Marcelo lives alone apart from the tenants who share his house which is located in the rural area of Huaricolca. In spite of retiring a few years ago, Marcelo believes he was meant to be work the land and make it productive. He’s already spent eight years farming, enough time to plant some crops and sell the produce at good prices. His fields of potatoes and oats are very productive, and at harvest time he usually travels to the town of Tarma where, because of his sound business sense, he is able to sell his bags of potatoes in a short time.

However, Marcelo feels that he doesn’t have the strength he used to have. So he is saving a considerable amount of money to buy a house in the town and thus take care of his health. He is also thinking of starting a wholesale business buying and selling potatoes and other tubers.

This is his tenth loan with Kiva partner MFP. As the advisor to his community bank, Marcelo is very happy to be able to help his fellow members make progress. With the loan he plans to buy organic fertilizer for his next potato crop.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie N. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old and married. She has one child who is 9 years old and goes to school. 

To make a living, Elsie plants rice and harvests it  for sale. Elsie works hard to provide for her family and sustain her child's education.

Elsie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a loan of 17000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería, ella vende diferentes tipos de panes, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para construir su casa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy, 55, is a member of the “MARIA ELENA MOYANO” communal bank which is located in Cusco district that is part of Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a bakery.  She sells all kinds of bread from 5am until 7pm.  She wants to expand and improve the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy building materials and supplies to build her house.

She thanks all those who will be part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Vania

texts.es:
La señora Vania D. R.,  tiene 23  años de edad, viven en la comunidad de Tin Tin  de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba,   tiene tres  hijos, el padre de su primer hijo les dejo a causa de un accidente y a su segundo esposo se dedica a beber en demacia descuidando a su esposa y a sus hijos.
Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequía que afecto su pequeña parcela de zanahoria no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que ella esperaba.
 
Vania es una persona  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijos  y su trabajo, que a veces hasta tiene que trabajar en jornal en la agricultura para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a sus dos hijos, la actividad de la panadería le ayuda en estas época.

Vania está solicitando el crédito para  atender su negocio de tienda de panadería en el lugar donde vive  para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y  darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y puedan asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a sus hijos y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en: Mrs. Vania D. R.,  age 23, lives in the Tin Tin community in the Mizque province in the department of Cochabamba. She has three children. The father of her first child left them due to an accident, and her second husband drinks too much and neglects his wife and children. At the moment, her small carrot crop is not growing well due to the natural disaster-drought- that is affecting it. This disaster has caused her expected income to fail. Vania is a very well-liked and respected person in her neighbourhood, as she is dedicated to her children and to her work. At times she works as a day labourer in agriculture in order to earn a few pesos and thus maintain her two children. Her bakery is helping her in this time. Vania is requesting this loan for her bakery, which is located in her neighbourhood, to improve her income and provide a better quality of life for her children so that they can attend school in better conditions. This loan will help her children, and help her greatly in the hard work that she does.

loans.use: Working capital for bakery

loans.name: Nelva

texts.es: Nelva, de 45 años, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo  y sus 2 hijas y su nieta,  a quien adora. Con mucho esfuerzo, Nelva lleva adelante sus negocios, que es la venta de quesos y de productos de belleza. Los lunes  se dedica a la venta quesos, inmediatamente después de recoger de la agencia; que le envían sus familiares de provincias. En seguida, las distribuye  a sus vecinos y todos sus clientes de su barrio. Pero el resto de los días, después de sus labores domésticas, apoya a su esposo en su taller de carpintería, y por las tardes recorre las calles de su distrito, ofreciendo sus productos de belleza  a sus familiares, amigas y vecinas de su barrio, quienes la prefieren por su buen trato y las facilidades que le brinda. Se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza, ya que gracias a sus utilidades ayuda  en su hogar. En adelante, piensa instalar un negocio de papelería, en el ambiente de su casa, para ello viene realizando acondicionando un lugar. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte le será útil, por ello se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas  puntualmente. Con el crédito que recibirá, comprará más productos de belleza, para abastecer los diversos pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en: Nelva, age 45, is a charismatic and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, 2 daughters and granddaughter, whom she adores. With great work, Nelva has gotten her business ahead. She sells cheeses and beauty products. On Mondays, she sells cheeses, immediately after getting it from the office; her family members in the provinces send it to her. She distributes it to her neighbours and all her customers in her neighbourhood. But the rest of the days, after doing her housework, she helps her husband in his carpentry workshop. In the afternoons she walks through the streets of her district, selling her beauty products to her family, friends and neighbours, who prefer her for the good service she provides. She is happy with her work, since she is able to help with the household. In the future, she wants to open a stationery store in her home. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that it will be useful, so she promises to pay all of the quotas punctually. With this loan, she will buy more beauty products to fill the various pending orders that she has.

loans.use: to stock up on beauty products.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvín reside en Concepción Batres departamento de Usulután, se dedica a atender un  comedor y pupuseria, vive con su familia su esposa, su madre, su hijo de 2 años de edad.
Él inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposa que le ayuda a atender el negocio, el horario de atención es de 6:00am a 5:00pm, actualmente no cuenta con capital para invertir, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar mobiliario y materiales para fortalecer el negocio. Esta inversión le ayudara a crecer en el negocio y eso le permitirá contar con todo lo necesario para trabajar y ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Sueña con poseer un negocio amplio y surtido, también aumentar los ingresos y ganancias para solventar las necesidades del hogar y estabilizar la condición de vida para todos.
texts.en:
Marvín lives in Concepción Batres in the Usulután department.  He devotes himself to a dining room and “pupusuría” (a business that specializes in selling “pupusas”, which are stuffed corn tortillas).  He lives with his family; his wife, his mother, and his two year old son.

He started this business thanks to his wife’s support.  She helps him take care of the business.  His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  He does not currently have capital to invest.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy furnishings and materials to strengthen the business.

This investment will help him grow in his business.  It will allow him to have everything that is necessary in order to work and offer better service to his customers.

He dreams of having a spacious and well-stocked business.  He also dreams of increasing his income and earnings in order to pay for the household necessities and establish a stable living condition for all.

loans.use: To buy furnishings and materials to prepare for his food sales

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Mirian, de 28 años, vive en la casa de su madre al lado de ella y de su tía; juntas buscan salir adelante para alcanzar el progreso. Desde hace un año esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedido y para lograrlo compra su mercadería en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad, luego les deja a sus las prendas que le pidieron al crédito  a sus amigos y conocidos. Además paralelamente a este negocio se dedica también a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su casa, donde instalo una pequeña tienda de donde obtiene regulares ganancias pues el tiempo le ha permitido captar  gran cantidad de compradores, y atiende de lunes a domingo desde muy temprano.  Esta muy satisfecha con sus negocios y tiene muchos planes para el futuro pues quiere surtir bien su tienda para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar creciendo en su negocio. Mirian tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa y comestibles para abastecer su negocio, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en: Mirian, 28, lives with her mother and her aunt in her mother's house.  Together, they seek to make progress and get ahead.  For a year now, this enterprising woman has been selling clothing through orders.  To do this, she buys her merchandise in a large commercial center in the city.  Later she takes the garments to her friends and acquaintances who have ordered them on credit.  In addition to this business, she also sells basic consumer products from her house, where she has set up a small store that generates regular earnings.  Over time she has been able to attract a large number of customers, and she tends to the store each day from the very early morning hours.  She is very satisfied with her businesses, and has a lot of plans for the future, so she wants to stock her store well to improve her earnings.  This is the first loan that she has taken from MFP.  She promises to make her payments on time, because she does not want to disappoint the people who have made this support possible that will allow her to continue to grow her business.  Mirian plans to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise in the form of clothing and foodstuffs to stock her businesses.  In this way she hopes to continue to make progress with her businesses.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing as well as other products for her store

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio tiene un negocio donde presta el servicio de Internet, juegos en red y llamadas telefónicas. El préstamo lo destinara para la ampliación de su negocio, pues desea comprar un par de computadoras más. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. 
Vive en casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Marco Antonio es soltero.

Este es el Tercer crédito con Impro y el primero canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio has an internet cafe business where he also sells access to internet games and telephone calls.  He will use this loan to expand his business, since he wants to buy two more computers.  This business is his main source of income and support.  He lives with his parents, whose home is located in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  Marco Antonio is single.

This is his 3rd loan with IMPRO, and the first that has been funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two computers to expand his internet cafe business

loans.name: Zoila Ramona

texts.es:
En el barrio San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Chicas Fresas, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad y las socias son muy amables y trabajadoras.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Zoila, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos mayores de adad y tres de 15, 13 y 7  años los mismos que estudian uno de los mayores en universidad las dos chichas en colegio y el menor en escuela.
 
Ella tiene una tienda de viveras de consumo, vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. allí mismo tiene un bazar y un bar que lo abre solo en temporada de clases ya que está cerca de un colegio. En sus diversas actividades  trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 23h00, sus hijos  le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, artículos de bazar entre otros. Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos  y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “Chicas Fresas” (Uptown Posh Girls) communal bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s San Pablo neighborhood, a crowded, marginal urban zone in the city.  The members are very kind and hard working.

We found Zoila, 40, here.  She is in a common law relationship and has five children, two adults and three who are 15, 13 and 7 years of age and in school. One is in university, the two girls are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school.

She has a grocery store where she sells foodstuffs, rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc.  She also has a kitchen supplies store and snack bar that she only opens during the school year since it’s near a school.  She works every day from 6am until 11pm at her various activities.  Her children help her.  She buys her products in downtown Portoviejo although most of her stock is delivered to her store.

She will use this loan to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents and kitchen supplies, among others.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and likes it because she’s made many friends in the group.  Her goals are to continue forward with the loan and that the store grows more every day.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Nos

texts.en: Nos R. is 40 years old and a married woman. She was married years ago and has three single children, two of whom work as garment workers in a factory. She and her husband earn a profit by running a business similar to that of a recycled goods seller. They always buy used goods to sell to their wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other provinces or countries. The used goods the wholesaler deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Nos R. would like to ask for a loan to use as capital to buy more used goods to stock up, to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more used goods to stock up for selling

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Mrs. Sareth C. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. That Chan, live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children – one son and four daughters. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment factory workers and another one is a construction worker.
Sareth stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband's and children’s salaries. She is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina M. is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Dina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Dina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Dina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Dina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dina is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional snack foods & detergents. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Dina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods & detergents.

loans.name: Norys Sonia

texts.es:
Norys es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Intocables” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos.  La señora estudió educación secundaria y en la actualidad esta estudiando cosmetología. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.  Su primer  préstamo  solicitado que fue por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de lanas de alpaca y manualidades como esqueletos y cholitas (artesanías).
Norys solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles dinero que utilizará para comprar cincuenta libras de lana.  En su negocio trabaja sola, su esposo es maestro de obra.
Su sueño es tener un trabajo seguro y abrir un local para dar el servicio de cosmetóloga.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo por parte de Manuela y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Norys is a member of the communal bank named "The Untouchables", located in the district of Puno, in the province and Department of Puno. She is 28 years old, married, and she has 2 children. She has a high school education and she is now studying cosmetology.

She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past year. The first loan she requested was in the amount of S/.500 and she invested the funds in her business. She sells alpaca wool and crafts such as skeletons and dolls (crafts). 

Norys requests a new loan in the amount of S/.500 nuevos soles. The funds will be used in the purchase of 50 pounds of wool. She works alone in her business. Her husband is a construction worker. Her dream is to have steady work and to open a business providing cosmetology services.

She enjoys her communal bank for the easy loan process on the part of Manuela Ramos and the personal loans.

loans.use: to purchase fifty pounds of wool.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 39 años  y es madre de 3 hijos con los cuales vive junto con su esposo, en la zona rural del distrito de Reque – Chiclayo. La actividad principal de esta zona es la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores (pavos, patos, cuyes, chanchos, etc.).

Martina tiene una familia muy unida, sus hijos la ayudan con su negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos. Ella tiene aproximadamente 15 años dedicándose a esto y conoce muy bien las preferencias de su clientela, una clientela ya establecida. Martina realiza esta actividad en la parte exterior de su casa donde tiene sus corrales para cerdos.

Martina solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1700 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales y en el  mejoramiento del corral de estos. Martina tiene pensado mejorar la calidad de su cría para mayor productividad comercial. Actualmente se está asesorando cpn expertos en este rubro.

Martina quiere sacar adelante a su familia es una mujer trabajadora que estaría muy agradecida  con este crédito. Es una cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Martina, 39, is the mother of three children; she lives with them and her husband in the rural part of Reque District, Chiclayo.  The main activity in this area is farming and raising small farm animals (ducks, turkeys, guinea pigs, pigs, etc.)

Martina has a very united family; her children help her with her business raising and selling pigs.  She has about 15 years in this line of work and is very knowledgeable about her customers’ preferences, an already well established clientele.  Martina carries out this activity in her yard where her pig corrals are located.

Martina is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1700 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals and to make some improvements on their corral.  Martina intends to improve the quality of her herd for better commercial productivity.  She is currently getting advice from experts in the field.

Martina wants to move her family forward; she is a hard working woman who is grateful for the loan.  She is a recurrent client of our firm.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to make some corral improvements.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine.  She is 35 years old and is a resident of Lungos, Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rifolimio, a photographer, and is the mother to four children – three are in elementary school and the youngest is not yet of school age.  By the grace of God, Josephine has managed to support all her children’s educational needs.  At the present time she is working hard to be able to maintain the finances to meet her family's daily needs.

Josephine operates a photography/videography service.  She accepts orders to photograph/video wedding and other special occasions. Her husband is the main photographer/videographer while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. She also manages a business retailing electronic load/credits for all mobile users in her community.  Josephine has been operating these businesses for five years.  Monthly, she is able to earn an estimated net income of around Php7,000.

To help her continue the operations of her businesses, Josephine is requesting a loan for Php16, 000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional films, frames, and batteries for her photography/videography service. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Josephine dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her businesses. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy supplies for her photography business

loans.name: Rémède Plus Group

texts.en:
Rémède Plus is a Community Bank made up of 20 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is Riddy. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Riddy operates a drugstore in a northern suburban area of Kinshasa. He is 30 years old, the father of a son who is 3 years old. He began his business in 2003. With hard work and good management and by providing good customer service, Riddy’s business has prospered and has permanent customers to keep it up and it generates $40 in profit per week. 

Riddy is planning with the new loan to expand his business by buying more medicines needed by his customers. His ambition is to open another drugstore.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his drugstore.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr: Née en 1960 au Bénin, Edith est mariée à un certain Victor. Le couple à six enfants dont cinq restent encore à  leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assumées par Edith et son mari. Pour participer efficacement aux devoirs de mère de famille qui est le sien, Edith vend depuis sept ans, des bois de chauffage. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère de revenu, Edith vend du maïs. Edith s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Edith sollicite auprès de ALIDé un cinquième prêt. Edith avait obtenu antérieurement quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Bénin, Edith is married to Victor. The couple have six children of whom five are still dependent on their support. Some of the children are enrolled in school. The couple live together with their children. The various household expenses are assumed by Edith and her husband. 

To assume her role as wife and mother efficiently, Edith has been selling firewood for seven years. Alongside this income-generating business, Edith sells maize. She buys her supplies in one of the marketplaces of Bénin. Wishing to expand her business and better respond to the demand of her clientele, Edith is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé. She was granted four prior loans that were all correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy firewood and maize.

loans.name: Ngang Eunice

texts.en:
Ngang Eunice is married with 2 children. She lives in Mankon, North West Region, Cameroon. The family shares 2 rooms. She, as many other people, has faced major challenges in her life, especially when her parents and brothers died. She has also suffered from the hands of early marriage. She got pregnant at a stage when she did not expect and dropped out of school. 

With her first loan, Ngang Eunice expanded her business of sewing uniforms for school children, particularly those at the primary level. She was so happy with the fact that she was able to provide the school needs to her children, while many people around her find it difficult to do so. Given a loan, she plans to buy more fabric and produce more uniforms for school children that she will take to far-off villages. She will be able to sell there since very few persons go so far to do this particular business. Ngang Eunice hopes the business will succeed with the experiences she has in doing this for so many years and the location of her business site in the central town. Also, she is able to withstand the stress of traveling to far-off villages.

She will put the proceeds from this loan toward catering for her children's needs. She will ensure that her health and that of her children is taken care of by paying for their education. 

She prefers loans from GHAPE because of the training GHAPE gives and the ease of obtaining and paying back.

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: purchase materials for sewing uniforms

loans.name: Elias Roberto

texts.es:
Elias Roberto nació en el distrito de Echarate y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. La ciudad de Echarate es la ciudad capital del distrito de Echarate de la Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales.). 

Elias Roberto es una persona responsable y le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Nueva Luz de Echarate” de la Asociación Arariwa.  

Él es agricultor y trabaja en sus terrenos de cultivo donde tiene cacao y frutales, él contrata gente para que le ayuda a cosechar los cultivos entonces necesita el crédito para pagar el sueldo de los peones. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le está yendo muy bien gracias al empeño que pone  en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Elias Roberto was born in the Echarate district and lives in the same city where he was born.  The city of Echarate is the capital city of the district of Echarate, in the La Convencion province.  It is an important commercial center for the Lares Valley and La Convencion province.  The main activities here are the production of cocoa, coffee, coca leaves and orchard fruits.

Elias Roberto is a responsible person who was invited to participate in the communal bank “Nueva Luz de Echarate” in the Asociación Arariwa.  

He is a farmer who works lands where he cultivates cocoa and grows fruit in orchards.  He hires people to help him harvest his crops and he needs a loan to pay for their wages.  He has been a farmer for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work.

loans.use: to pay the wages of his workers

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José de 21 años de edad, soltero, vive en una vivienda alquilada, en el distrito de Sivia. Durante su infancia, José aprendió acerca de la reparación de motores de los vehículos por su padre, quien resolvía los problemas con gran eficacia y garantía para sus clientes. Lamentablemente, su padre no siempre poseía repuestos suficientes para su trabajo, por lo que  tenía que viajar a la capital para poder obtenerlos. Por esta razón, José decidió abrir una tienda de repuestos junto al taller de su padre, en la cual también brinda servicios de mantenimiento y reparación. José está feliz con el trabajo que realiza porque su negocio le genera buenas ganancias económicas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar sus planes. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles adquirirá repuestos.
texts.en: José is 21 years old, single and lives in rented housing in the Sivia district. During his childhood, he learned to repair car engines from his father, who very effectively and surely solved his customers’ problems. Unfortunately, his father did not always have sufficient spare parts on hand to do his work and would have to go to the capital to obtain them. For this reason, José decided to open a spare parts store next to his father’s shop, where he can also offer maintenance and repair services. José is happy with his work because his business generates a good income. This is his first loan with MFP and he is looking forward to your support to help him accomplish his goals. He will buy spare parts with the 2,000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widowed woman living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 56 years-old with 2 grown dependents. 

She is a farmer. She has been digging, plowing and planting for the last two years. Last harvest, she earned enough to compensate for all the time and efforts invested to make it fruitful. Despite fortuitous events that hampered the plants growth, Erlinda managed to stand still and think positively. The farm regularly gives monthly inflows of PHP 4,500.

In 2010, Erlinda joined Kiva partner GDMPC in order to haveeasy access on financial services. She has borrowed twice from the cooperative making the latest application the third one. The current loan is in the amount of PHP 7,000 which will be used to purchase farm fertilizers to haste growth. By putting in enough fertilizers for growth, Erlinda expects a good return on investment. She intends to lay aside a portion of her earnings and purchase a lot for gardening activity.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers to hasten growth.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman who lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past six years, she has operated a vegetable sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in her business. Halima dreams of establishing a larger shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes and potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru: Более 11 лет Одил занимается услугами таксиста на своём районе. Он женат и любящий отей 4 детей. Он любит свою семью и хочет, чтобы они жили, не зная бедности. Одил хочет обеспечить своих детей и устроит их в хороших школах и институтах. Он любит свой бизнес и с удовольствием занимается этим бизнесом. Одил хотел бы получить 10000 Сомони для покупки нового автомобиля. Он надеется, что Кива и Кива кредиторы будут поддерживать его и позволить ему осуществлять его мечту.
texts.en: Odil has been working as a taxi driver in his district for over 11 years. He is married and the loving father of four. He loves his family and wants their lives to be free of poverty. Odil would like to provide for his children and place them in good schools and colleges. He enjoys his business and likes working in it. Odil would like to receive 10,000 TJS to buy a new car. He hopes that Kiva and Kiva lendors will support him and allow him to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela, D. cuarenta y un años D. edad, casada, vive en casa propia en zona semiurbana al oriente del país junto a sus dos hijos uno D. 18 y otro D. 14 años D. edad, Karla y Alexis quienes actualmente sólo estudian, son su inspiración para día a día luchar por vivir mejor. Ángela hace cinco años después D. quedar sola porque su esposo se marchó al extranjero en búsqueda D. mejores oportunidades instaló una tienda en su misma casa D. residencia en donD. provee a sus vecinos y gente que pasa productos D. primera necesidad, con esta actividad logra el sostenimiento económico para su familia, Gracias a Dios a ellos no les ha hecho falta el pan diario. Pese a que su esposo envía remesa ésta no compensa las necesidades que cada año incrementan dado que ella desea darles estudios universitarios a sus hijos y que se conviertan en profesionales y resuelvan D. mejor forma sus vidas.  María Ángela a sabiendas que cuenta con excelentes referencias manejando prestamos, posee varios años manejando el negocio y la necesidad D. hacerlo crecer para mejorar las calidad D. vida D. su familia,  son todas estas juntas las razones por las que decidió solicitar a INTEGRAL crédito que permita comprar productos que demandan sus clientes y no ha podido hacerlo con recurso propio como son: Escobas, productos para el cuidado personal (desodorantes, gelatinas para el cabello, cremas para la piel, cosméticos), medicina, lácteos, carnes, embutidos, detergentes y además piensa comprar nueva vitrina para exhibir algunos D. éstos nuevos productos. Tiene la esperanza depositada en esta nueva inversión y espera que supliendo las necesidades D. sus clientes obtendrá mayores ventas y así ganancias.-
texts.en:
María Ángela, 41, is married and lives in her own home in a semi-urban area in the eastern part of the country along with her two children, 18 and 14.  Karla and Alexis, who currently only study, are her inspiration for struggling day by day to live better.

After her husband left her alone five years ago in search of better opportunities abroad, she installed a store in her house to proviD. her neighbors and passersby with basic household necessities.  With this activity she manages to support her family.  Thank God they have never lacked their daily bread.  Even though her husband sends remittances, they are not enough for the necessities that every year increase given that she wants her children to have a university education and become professionals and determine their lives in the best way.

María Ángela knowingly has excellent references managing loans.  She has managed her business for several years, and the need to make it grow to improve her family's quality of life.

All these together are the reasons she decided to request a loan from Integral, which will allow her to buy products that her customers ask for and that she has not been able to proviD. with her own resources: brooms, personal care products (deodorant, hair gel, skin cream, cosmetics), medicine, dairy products, meat, sausage, detergent, and a new display case to show some of these new products.

She has all her hope placed in this new investment and hopes that supplying the needs of her customers will obtain greater sales and so profits.

loans.use: to buy brooms, personal care products (deodorant, hair gel, skin cream, cosmetics), medicine, dairy products, meat, sausage, detergent, and a new display case to show some of these new products.

loans.name: Talaigul's Group

texts.en:
Talaigul is the leader of this group. She is 29 and unfortunately she is a widow. She is bringing up two daughters. The older daughter studies at school and the second is not in school yet as she is preschool age (under seven). 

This year, with an initial investment of 40,000 soms, Talaigul started to breed farm animals. In this way she earns money to meet the family's needs. Her monthly income is about 3,000 soms. With money received from the loan, Talagul plans to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and future reselling. In the future she wants to provide her daughters with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Narayan Devi

texts.en:
Narayan Devi is 36 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 15 and 14.  In 1998, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  

Narayan Devi has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

As a borrower, to improve living standards extra training is needed.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: buy grocery goods

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

Aquí conocimos a La señora Angélica, ella tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen una  hija de  15 años que está estudiando en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una farmacia.

Ella además de dedicarse al hogar y al cuidado de su hija también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta trabaja y los viernes, sábados, y domingos desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00, aunque si alguna cliente quiere algo ella la recibe en su  casa sin ningún inconveniente. Sus productos los compra en una distribuidora en Chone, ella vende al contado y también deja a crédito y cobra por semana. Lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad y lo que más vende es ropa de mujer y de niñas.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de mujer y de niñas. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya siete años y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado la institución.
 
Su sueño es  tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte (Portoviejo) the members of the communal bank Mujeres Organizadas meet twice a month. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the local people make and they are known throughout the country.

Here we meet Angelica who is 39 years old, married and she has a 15-year-old daughter from this relationship who is a school student. Her husband works in a pharmacy.

In addition to working at home and taking care of her daughter she also sells from door to door all types of clothing and works Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 8:30AM until 4:00PM, although if some customer wants to buy something from her at home it’s never a problem. She buys her products from a distributor in the city of Chone and collects cash or collects weekly payments. She has been doing this for more than 10 years and her best sellers are clothing for girls and women. 

She will use this loan to buy clothes for girls and women. She has been a member of the communal bank for seven years and she likes the help she has received from the institution. 

Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing for girls and women for resale

loans.name: Chandiru

texts.en:
Chandiru is a 32 year old married woman with five children.  She sells charcoal in South Sudan and has done so for four years.

Chandiru requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She says the extra income will helps her build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 37-year-old a married woman with six children between the age of 14 and 2 years old. Five of them are in school. 

She has had a business selling tea in Buluk, South Sudan, for two years. Joyce requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and milk powder for her tea business. 

She will use the extra income she gets from this loan to pay for the school fees of her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and milk powder to make tea for sale.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Janerose is the facilitator of the Umoja group. Janerose and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janerose and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Janerose takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With income from maize sales, Janerose will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Umoja group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Janerose with her group members and the person on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married with 4 children. Flordeliza is 40-years-old and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Flordeliza sells cospachem (health) products to earn a living and has had this business for 18 years. Each month she earns 10000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 25000 PHP to purchase cospachem to sell/retail.

Flordeliza has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cospachem (health) to sell/retail.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert used his previous loan to purchase water fitting equipment for resale purposes, and was able to earn additional money from this. However, he is faced with the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, and customers not paying on time. His personal goal is to build a permanent home, while his business goal is to expand into new markets.

Herbert needs the loan to buy more plumbing materials.

loans.use: to buy more plumbing materials.

loans.name: Cain

texts.es: Caín, de 27 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación, así como alegre y amable, es conviviente con Lety quien es comerciante, vive en compañía de su pareja, su padre, su madre y sus 04 hermanos, habitando la casa de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Caín es la transporte de pasajeros para lo cual cuenta con un mototaxi que compró con sus ahorros hace 01 año. Para realizar su trabajo se levanta muy de temprano para buscar sus pasajeros por las calles de la ciudad realizando su jornada hasta el medio día, hora en que regresa a descansar, para luego volver a salir por unas horas en las tardes. Le gusta su actividad ya que puede manejar sus tiempos libres, y comenta se decidió por ésta actividad por la necesidad de tener un oficio y por los ingresos económicos ya que tenía muchas necesidades y gastos que no podía solventar, ahora se siente más tranquilo y cómodo ya que tiene un ingreso permanente y cuenta con más tiempo libre. Por lo contario comenta que le incomoda un poco cuando llueve muy seguido ya que esto dificulta su trabajo, pero eso no lo desanima y continua trabajando. Tiene como proyecto adquirir un camión para dedicarse al transporte de carga. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP.  Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues se siente cómodo pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas amables y buenas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, tiene planes de invertir en los trámites de la compra de un camión de transporte de carga.
texts.en: Twenty-seven-year-old Caín is a hardworking man with a great desire to get ahead.  He is a happy and friendly person who lives with his partner, Lety, who is a storekeeper, his father, his mother, and his four siblings in his parents' home.  Caín works in transportation for a living with the mototaxi he bought with his savings one year ago.  He wakes up very early for work to look for passengers in the city's streets.  He works until noon, when he returns to rest, only to set out again later for a few hours in the afternoon.  He likes his work because he controls his free time and he tells us that he decided on this work because he needed a trade and income because he needed many things and he had expenses he couldn't afford.  Now he feels more calm and comfortable because he has steady income and because he has more free time.  On the other hand, he tells us that when it rains hard it's inconvenient for him because it makes his work more difficult, but he doesn't get discouraged and keeps on working.  His goal is to get a truck so he can work in trucking.  This will be his second loan with MFP.  As such, he is waiting for their collaboration to be able to carry out his plans.  He also tells us that he is happy with his communal bank because he is comfortable there and he thinks the other members are friendly, good people.  He will invest the sum of 1,000 nuevos soles in the process of buying a cargo truck.

loans.use: to make a down payment on a cargo truck

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is 58 years old and married with four children, three sons and one daughter. He and his wife support their family by selling food to the local community.

Diep would like a 15,000,000 VND loan from CEP, which will enable him to buy more furniture to set around his place of business and better food to sell at higher margins.

Diep hopes that through this loan he will be able to improve his family's living conditions and have more money to set aside for saving.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for his establishment and better food to sell.

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Aliou, âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants, évolue dans le secteur de l’agriculture. Il a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine car il a démarré très tôt en accompagnant son père dans les champs. Aliou est très actif et travaille toute la journée.
 Il est à sa première expérience de crédit et ce sera pour acheter des semences et de l’engrais car la saison des pluies est vite arrivée. Grâce aux revenus de l’activité, il nourrit sa famille et gère aux quotidiens leur besoins.
Dans l’avenir, il veut diversifier son activité en faisant de l’embouche.

loans.use: acheter des semences et de l'engrais pour préparer l'hivernage

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza owns a small shop where she sells a variety of items including: school supplies, home decorations, snacks, and soft drinks. Before opening her store she would have find work in house cleaning or door to door clothing sales. She decided to start her own business in order to have a more secure source of income and be able to take care of her son. She got married when she was 16 and got divorced 3 years later. She takes care of her only son by herself with the income generated from her business. She is seeking the loan because she wants to increase inventory and introduce new products like children’s toys.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking the loan because she wants to increase inventory and introduce new products like children’s toys.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Maria Inocencia Reme

texts.en:
"During the hot season, the sun shines directly on the front of my house and creates a lot of heat. During the rainy season, rain comes in the house everywhere. I would like to build an entryway that protects my house from the weather, to make my house safer and more comfortable. I am asking for $1000 to build a doorway."

Translated from Spanish by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

"En temporada de calor me da el sol directamente al frente de mi casa y provoca muchísimo calor. También en temporada de lluvia el agua se mete por todos lados. Me gustaría construir un portal que cubra un poco mi casa de las inclemencias del tiempo; así podré tener mi casa más segura y cómoda. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un portal."

loans.use: To build a doorway.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Business Description

Our friend Maria is dedicated to the sales of clothing, such as pants, t-shirts, blouses, dresses... etc. In addition to having 3 years experience working independently, she is also a teacher at a school in her community. In spite of the fact that her husband passed away she has faced the hardships of generating income for her family, taking care of her only child, and attending to her business from very early in the morning every day of the week.

Use of the Loan

Maria needs the loan in order to be able to buy more merchandise and offer a greater variety of products to her clients. In this way she will be able to gain new clients as a result of the hard work that she puts into her business day after day. Maria needs this loan in order to cover various costs of her business and in order to keep her clients satisfied.

Personal Information

Maria is 41 years old and lives alone with her 17 year old daughter, who, thanks to Maria's hard work and efforts, is able to continue studying. She also helps with the activities of the house which has a cement structure. Maria's dream is for her business to grow so she can increase her income and come out ahead. Maria is confident that as she continues to adapt her home on her own land, she will eventually be able to earn additional income by renting out her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Nuestra amiga Maria se dedica a la venta de ropa, como pantalones, camisetas, blusas, vestidos…etc. Teniendo como experiencia 3 anos, trabajando independientemente, también es maestra de una escuela de su comunidad. A pesar de que su esposo falleció desde este tiempo tuvo la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia, teniendo a cargo un solo hijo, atendiendo desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días de la semana

Uso del Préstamo

Maria necesita el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería y ofrecerles a su clientela variedades de productos, de tal manera que su numero de clientes aumente, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo, Maria esta en la necesidad de adquirir el préstamo para cubrir sus necesidades y la de su clientela y así mantenerlos satisfechos.

Información Personal

Maria tiene 41 anos de edad, en donde vive solamente con su hija de 17 anos de edad, en la que gracias al esfuerzo realizado por parte de Maria la mantiene estudiando. Donde también le ayuda con las actividades de la casa que es de estructura de cemento. Los sueños de Maria es incrementar su negocio de tal manera que crezca en su actividad e incrementar sus ingresos y así salir adelante. Maria tiene la confianza de seguir adecuando casa en terreno propio y poder de esta forma obtener otros ingresos por medio de arriendo de vivienda.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Zahir

texts.ru:
Zahir N. lives in Aksu. He was born in 1975. Zahir is married and has 2 children. For more than 2 years, he has been selling fruits and vegetables on the central market. In 2006, Zahir took a $500 loan to finance business expansion. Now he wishes to take another Normicro loan to continue growing his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нагиев Захир проживает в городе Аксу. Он родилься 1975 году. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. В центральном рынке более двух лет торгует фруктами и овощами. 2006 году взял кредит на сумму 500$. Этот кредит помогло ему расширять свой бизнес.Захир очередной раз хочеть взять кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old, single and raising 4 children of her own and 4 orphans.  She has a tailoring boutique, which she has operated since she was 15 years old.  She has developed a good sense of business over the years and has very defined goals and dreams.  

She plans to build a small commercial building that she can use as a workshop and rent the rest.  She buys high quality cloth from Dubai and stitches simple but elegant designs.  Today she shows me some of her work.  It is clean and classy and the material is of high quality.

Sarah has been a member of her lending group for one year.  With her loan she plans to buy more cloth, embroidery and colored thread.  She wants to increase her inventory of material to be ready for the holiday workload.

loans.use: Sarah plans to use her loan to buy more cloth and embroidery to be ready for the holiday season

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: I am Sughran Q. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married with eight children. My husband has had a scrap store for last few years. Last year he took a loan for his business and successfully repaid it.  He now desires to expand his business. He will buy scrap items in bulk. Therefore, I request a loan of $350 to invest in my husband’s business.

loans.use: To expand scrap business

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorr

texts.es:
Esperanza F. is a single mother with six kids all of which are in school. Some in elementary school and some in high school. For years ago she began her business selling ice cream. At the Ivan Monte Negro Market in Managua. When she began her business another lady shared her space with Esperanza so that she could sell her ice cream from it. However, as time went by she was able to rent her own space in the market place.

Now she works hard every day to be able to support her family and to give an education to her children. One of Senora Esperanza daughters works with her selling ice cream. This business makes it so Esperanza is able to earn a living with dignity.

For three years now she has received nine small loans and they have benefited her a lot because she has been able to buy more ice cream to sell and she has also been able to save her earnings so that she could remodel her space in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Estefany of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Esperanza F. es una madre soltera y con 6 hijos de los cuales todos estudian, algunos en la primaria y otros en la secundaria. Desde hace 4 años inició su negocio de venta de sorbetes (helados) en el mercado Ivan Montenegro de Managua. Al inicio vendía en un alojamiento que le proporcionó una dama para que pudiese vender los sorbetes pero a medida que el tiempo transcurrió, solicitó un local propio en el mercado y le fue obtenido.

Hoy en día, para poder salir adelante y brindarle la educación a sus queridos hijos, la señora Esperanza se esfuerza grandemente trabajando todos los días acompañada de una de sus hijas en la venta de estos helados y así ganarse la vida dignamente.

Desde hace 3 años ha realizado créditos con ceprodel (9 créditos) y según cuenta le han sido de muchísimo beneficio porque ha logrado comprar los helados para luego venderlos y de igual manera ha ahorrado para comenzar a remodelar su local en el mercado.

loans.use: Remodel her space at the market

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Realizing that her first business, a small grocery store, was not profitable for her and her 3 year old son, Esperanza decided to work in a textile factory with the little knowledge she had about sewing. While she worked there, she aquired a lot of experience and knowledge on textiles thanks to the constant training they provided. When the factory had a staff reduction, she was let go. However, she didn't allow herself to feel upset about the situation, instead she felt sufficiently trained and empowered to begin her own sewing business. Esperanza, with her only extra possession - a sewing machine, began to sew clothing for some of her family members and friends. Today, she sews clothing due to the many requests from her clients, which she is thankful she does not lack. Her goal within a few years is to run her own garment workshop, where she will work along with her youngest daughter and her nieces. To this end, she needs a variety of sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

A raíz de que su primer negocio, una pequeña bodega, no era rentable para ella y su pequeño hijo de 3 años, Esperanza decidió trabajar en una empresa textil con sus pocos conocimientos sobre costura. Durante el tiempo que ella laburo en este empresa adquirió mucha experiencia y conocimientos sobre el tema textil gracias a la constante capacitación que obtuvo. Luego de una reducción de personal en su trabajo ella fue despedida. Sin embargo, ella no se dejo abatir por ello y se sintió lo suficientemente capacitada y segura para emprender su propio negocio de costura. Es así que, Esperanza con lo único que tenía extra -su única maquina de coser- empezó a confeccionar ropa para algunos familiares y amigos. Hoy en día, hace ropa según los pedidos de diversos clientes, que felizmente no le faltan. Su objetivo dentro de unos pocos años es implantar un taller de confección donde trabajaría ella, su hija menor y también sus sobrinas. Para esto, ella requiere diversas maquinarias de costura.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of sewing machines so that she can start her sewing workshop.  (Comprar maquinarias de costura para implantar  un taller de confeccion.)

loans.name: Desak Putu Arsini

texts.id:
Desak Putu Arsini lives in a simple rental house with her husband and her two children, who are in middle school and high school. She pays $100 annually for her rent. Her husband’s income as a public transportation driver is insufficient to meet their family needs, especially now that it is declining because people have their own motorcycles. Desak Putu Arsini is determined to keep her children in school, and fights for this will by starting her business to make sweets for Hindu worshippers. She has this opportunity because people in her neighborhood are Hindu, and they need the ceremonial sweets almost every month.

With a starting capital of $100, Desak Putu Arsini started her business. She buys sweets ingredients, such as flour, sugar and sticky rice, as well as drying tools at the market. Since her capital is small, she can only produce small amount of sweets, and thus, she only gains small profits, which are just enough to bring food to the table. Because of this capital limitation, Desak Putu Arsini cannot serve her customers to the maximum, while there are many people who need the sweets. That is why she requested a loan from DINARI Foundation with hope that she can serve even more customers and gain more profits.
