Desak Putu Arsini wants to send her children to the highest education possible, and hopes to save up for buying her own house. She is very grateful for the loan given through DINARI Foundation.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Desak Putu Arsini tinggal disebuah rumah kontrakan yang sangat sederhana bersama suami dan dua orang anaknya yang kini sudah duduk dibangku SMU dan SMP. Setiap tahun Desak Putu Arsini harus mengeluarkan uang sebesar Rp.1.000.000.- untuk membayar sewa rumah. Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai sopir angkot tidak dapat mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga, apalagi sekarang muatan sudah sepi karena kebanyakan masyarakat sudah mempunyai sepeda motor sendiri. Karena keinginan Desak Putu Arsini supaya anak-anaknya bisa bersekolah, maka ia berjuang keras dengan membuka usaha membuat kue-kue untuk sembahyang umat Hindu. Peluang ini didapat karena dilingkungan Desak Putu Arsini semua masyarakatnya memeluk agama Hindu, yang hampir setiap bulan memerlukan kue-kue tersebut. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1.000.000 Desak Putu Arsini memulai usaha ini. Bahan –bahan seperti tepung,gula ,ketan ,alat-alat penjemuran dibeli di pasar. Dengan modal sedikit, tentu saja kue yang dihasilkan juga sedikit sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh tentu pula sedikit dan hanya cukup untuk keperluan dapur saja. Karena keterbatasan modal tersebut maka Desak Putu Arsini tidak dapat melayani pelanggan dengan maksimal,sedangkan masyarakat yang membutuhkan kue sangat banyak. Oleh sebab itu Desak Putu Arsini mengajukan pinjaman Modal Kepada Yayasan Dinari, dengan harapan dapat melayani masyarakat lebih banyak lagi sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih banyak pula. Dan Desak Putu Arsini dapat menyekolahkan anak-anaknya ke jenjang yang lebih tinggi,dan ia mempunyai keinginan untuk dapat menabung agar nantinya bisa mempunyai rumah sendiri. Desak Putu Arsini sangat berterimakasih atas pinjaman yang diberikan Oleh Yayasan Dinari.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for sweets and supporting tools for her business

loans.name: Ortense

texts.en: Ortense A. is 32 years old and the married mother of 3 children.  Two of her children are enrolled in school and one works with her in her shop, which is located in the central market of Adéta, a medium-sized town about 150 kilometers away from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Popular dress in Togo consists of a skirt and top cut and tailored from lengths of fabric called pagnes, and another pagne wrapped around the waist.  Selling pagnes is a popular business for women in Ortense’s region, so to stand out from her competition, Ortense decided to sell other miscellaneous items in her shop as well.  With her loan, Ortense would like to travel to Lomé with her daughter to purchase more pagnes to resell in the market in Adéta.  In addition, she would like to re-stock her supply of batteries, generic medication and soap.  With the revenues from her shop, she hopes to be able to continue to take care of her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: To purchase more pagnes (West African fabrics) and supplies for her store.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
In search of opportunities of development, making curtains was the main occupation of Mariluz. Two months ago she and her daughter decided to apply their needlework skills to make beautiful decorated curtains in a shopping mall with the goal of satisfying the most urgent needs of Huancaína families. Marliluz has great expectations for her business because their enormous efforts have rewarded them so far. It is for this that she asks for a loan to be used for the purchase of fabrics and thread to continue producing the beautiful curtains that adorn the homes of many families.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En búsqueda de oportunidades de desarrollo, la confección de cortinas era la ocupación principal de Mariluz que hace dos meses en asociación con su hija decidió aplicar sus conocimientos de costura para elaborar bellas cortinas decorativas en un centro comercial con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades más exigentes de las familias huancaínas.Mariluz tiene grandes expectativas de su negocio porque hasta el momento le retribuye sus enormes esfuerzos, es por ello que solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos para seguir elaborando las bellas cortinas que adornarán los hogares de muchas familias.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and thread

loans.name: Chanthu

texts.en:
Mr. Chanthu T. is a fisherman in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province. His wife, Mrs. Tren Long, is a subsistence farmer who cultivates her crop on a small piece of field. They have two children and both of them are too young to work or study.

Mr. Chanthu T. and his family now live in an old house. He and his wife try to earn more money to build a new house but they still have insufficient funds to build it. Thus, Mr. Chanthu T. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Last year, Mr. Chanthu T.’s youngest child got a dengue fever and he spent $100 to get cured. His wife is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn Y., 32 years old, is a farmer who raises ducks while her husband is a rice wine maker. Mrs. Y. makes around $4.13 per day and her husband earns about $3.33 per day. They have four children, all of whom live at home in Daunley Village in Siem Reap Province. Her duck breeding business is expanding and Mrs. Y. would like to ask for a loan to purchase more ducks to breed. She would like to use the remainder of her loan to help her husband fix his wine making kiln.

loans.use: To purchase ducks and fix wine making kiln

loans.name: Phok

texts.en:
Phok P., 40, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their four children. She and her husband are farmers who work on their vegetable farm earning around US$2 each day. Their daughter is employed at the local garment factory and her salary of US$3 each day, which is also contributing to support the family.

Phok P. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase seeds for her field to expand her crop inventory. High inflation has created a lot of difficulties for many Cambodians and the local farmers have not seen the returns on rising food prices. Phok P. believes this investment can truly help her business and can improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 38 años, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos mayores. Está dedicada a la agricultura, sobre todo al cultivo de gladiolos que es lo más rentable, y lo que más demanda tiene en los mercados de su ciudad, el problema es que sus terrenos se encuentran en zonas lejanas, entonces tiene que levantarse muy de mañana para preparar los alimentos y luego llevarlos para que pueda comer junto a su esposo en su chacra, porque  dicha actividad le toma gran parte del día, teniendo así, que regresar a su casa al atardecer.Lo que le agrada, es que cuando los gladiolo florecen son muy hermosos y dan un magnifico paisaje al lugar, pero lo difícil es la extracción, debe ser con sumo cuidado y el trasladarlo a los mercados para su venta, aun más.
Ofelia tiene en su pareja su mayor motor de amor y de trabajo.
Ahora, desea comprar mayor cantidad de semillas de flores para incrementar sus ingresos  y con el tiempo abastecer a las florerías, y sobre todo, a los puestos que están en los cementerios.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 38 years old; she leaves with her couple and two of her oldest children. She works farming gladiolus which are very profitable, and in high demand on near by markets, the problem is that her farming land is located very far away, so she has to wake up very early in the morning to prepare food and then take it to his husband at work, so they can eat together, and this takes most of her day, so she gets back home at dust. She likes when the gladiolus are in bloom, because they are beautiful and provide a fantastic view, but harvest is difficult, as it has to be done very carefully and transportation to sales places even more. Now she wants to buy more seeds to increase her income and with time to supply also to flower shops and shops near by the cemetery.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of flower seeds for her farm

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
Susitina F., 40, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the food market business. She sells to the village people, five days per week. She has had five previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately 166 USD).  

SPBD loans are Susitina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy sacks of flour, mutton flaps, chicken legs, foam plates, foam cups, and soya for her business. Her husband is one of her great assistants in running her business.

loans.use: Purchase to buy sack of flour, mutton flaps, chicken leg, foam cups and soy-souce

loans.name: Marie Cica

texts.fr: Néé le 05/06/1966 à Cotonou, elle est originaire de Ouidah. Dame G. Marie Cica n'a jamais été à l'école ni appris un métier. Avec sa maman elle a commencé, alors adolescente, à vendre des boules de pâte préparée à base de maïs (communément appelée Akassa) avec du poisson frit. Il y a 7 ans elle fit un changement d'activité et se mit à vendre de la farine à base de manioc (gari), de l'arachide grillée et de cacahuètes. Ce changement d'activité est intervenu du fait de la mévente qui est devenue de plus en plus croissante avec sa précédente activité. C'est pour augmenter le capital de la nouvelle activité et mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle qu'elle sollicite ce troisième prêt de 100000fcfa. Marié, elle est mère de quatre enfants dont seule la benjamine Sylvia est encore à sa charge.
texts.en:
Born on June 5, 1966 in Cotonou, Ms. Marie Cica G. is originally from Ouidah. She has never attended school nor learned a trade. At her mother's side, she started as an adolescent selling balls of "pâte" , commonly called "akassa" (similar to polenta made with boiled corn meal) and served with fried fish. Seven years ago, she switched her business to selling cassava flour (gari) and two types of roasted peanuts (arachide and cacahuète). This switch came about in her previous business due to an accelerating drop in sales. So, increasing the capital of her new business and better meeting customer demands are the reasons why she is requesting this third loan of 100,000 francs CFA. Ms. G. is married and the mother of four children, of whom only the youngest, Sylvia, is still in her care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of cassava flour and a half-sack of sugar

loans.name: Mrs. Chhorn Khum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank loan, led by Mrs. Chhorn K., consists of eight people residing in Tropang Orn Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. The members will use their share of the loan for a variety of purpose. For instance, Mrs. Chhorn K. wishes to purchase more chickens for her breeding business which is doing well.

Chhorn is 46 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Suon Vanna, is a village chief who makes a small salary that helps to support the family.

This village bank loan consists of both end-of-term loans and monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Echim

texts.en:
Ms. T. is a cook by profession. She lives in the village of Cetireni, along with her husband. Ms. T. worked as a cook in the school in the village, then she worked for nearly 2 years in Moscow. Because of the instability of jobs in Moscow, Ms T. returned to her own country. And because she has a lot of land, 3 hectares, and room for animals, she decided to grow pigs. Last year she sold 4 pigs, but she currently owns 15 pigs, 3 of the biggest pigs and 12 small pigs.

Ms. T. began to grow pigs about a year ago. She has requested a loan worth 10,000 lei, 5000 lei of which will be used to rebuild her pigpen (she wants to increase its size), and 5000 lei to buy feed for pigs, sheep, and cattle.

Pigs are kept till they reach the weight of 100-120 kg, bringing a price of 40 lei / kg. So a mature pig can bring in about 4000 lei. Expenditures for growing pigs and maintaining them are reduced, because she has agricultural land which mainly provides food for the pigs. At the end of the first year of ACTV, calculated, she will collect a cumulative net flow of 11,480 lei, and at the end of the second year's activity, the cumulative net flow will be worth 40,460.

Ms. T.'s business advantages are: a stable demand for pork at the market in Ungheni; reduced maintenance expenses for pigs; business may be released in small proportions (with small investments) and extended as possibilities appear; pigs easily accommodate the different technologies and increased exploitation.

loans.use: expanding her pigpen and buying feed

loans.name: Sibia

texts.es: Sibia cuenta con 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y adora a su niña de 4 añitos, por el momento está viviendo en la casa de sus padres, mientras pueda comprarse un terreno o una casa. Desde sus 17 años vendía productos de belleza a todas sus amistades, ella estudió secretariado ejecutivo en un instituto técnico, en este tiempo conoció a una proveedora de zapatos de la ciudad de Trujillo, famosa por la calidad y variedad de zapatos que fabrican, y muy ilusionada empezó con este negocio, al principio no tenia clientes, pero desde que empezó a trabajar en la municipalidad de su localidad, se han incrementado los pedidos de zapatos. En su centro de trabajo ofrece sus artículos, anotando los números y modelos que cada cliente requiere, y una vez que sale de su trabajo, en horas de la noche los reparte y atiende de 7 a 11pm a las personas que conocen de su negocio y la buscan. Nos comenta que hace poco trajo varias docenas de zapatos y los ha colocado al crédito, sus clientes le compraban con motivos de las diversas fiestas de promoción escolar y para navidad, en esa época, su negocio ha sido muy rentable, ya que por cada par dejado a pagaré puede ganar hasta el doble, por ello es que ahora se está dedicando a cobrar y de paso a hacer algunos pedidos, para realizar su próximo viaje. Cuando las reuniones de su banco comunal son los fines de semana ella participa en todas, pero cuando son días de laborales, envía un reemplazo, quien lleva los pagos de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para pagar los zapatos que compró al crédito, de los cuales, aún le falta realizar las cobranzas, y cuando tenga la cantidad necesaria, volverá a traer más mercadería de la ciudad de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Sibia is 28 years old and a single mother who adores her 4-year old daughter. Currently, she is living in her parents’ house, until she can buy herself a plot of land or a house. Since she was 17 years old, she sold beauty products to her friends. She studied to be an executive secretary at a technical institute and, during this time, she met a shoe supplier in Trujillo famous for the quality and variety of shoewear they make. With a great deal of hope, she started in this business but at first did not have customers. Since she started working at her local municipality, her shoe orders have increased. She offers her products, noting the style number and size that the customer requires, and at night after work she delivers her orders taking care of customers who know her and seek her out from 7 pm to 11 pm. She tells us that not long ago she brought several dozen shoes that she placed on credit, and her customers were buying them for various occasions such as school functions and for the holidays. During this season, her business has been very profitable given that she can double her investment on each pair of shoes. For this reason, she is now collecting for the shoes she has delivered as well as taking new orders so she can make her next trip. When the meetings of her cooperative bank take place on weekends, she likes to attend every one. When they are on workdays, however, she sends a replacement who delivers her loan installment payments. The funds she is requesting are to pay for a shoe order that she placed on credit, and from which she has yet to make any earnings. When she has the necessary amount, she will return for more merchandise from the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her latest shoe order.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trần Thị Cúc năm nay 45 tuổi,  chồng chị không may mất sớm, hiện chị đang sống cùng 3 con  tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Năm 1997 chị tham gia quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt.  Hiện tại  ngoài  trồng trọt gia đình chị C. đang chăn nuôi 200 con vịt, đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị Cúc  mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm vịt và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tran Thi C. is 45 years old. Her husband passed away early. She lives with three children at Kim Dong district, Hung Yen province. In 1997, she joined TYM Fund to borrow loans for raising ducks. Currently, in addition to farming, Mrs. Tran raises 200 ducks, which, at 1,500,000 VND per month, is the main source of income for her family. She would like to borrow 12,000,000 VND to buy more ducks and feeds for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Mrs. Son M. is a villager in Kbal Damrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Tob Chron, helps her in the farming. Mrs. Son M. is 57 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Donesa

texts.en:
Mrs. Donesa P., 26, is married and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is blessed with three children. For her, in order to survive in the present challenges, both husband and wife must work. Her husband is a collector for a lending institution. The only way for her to earn was to open a “sari-sari” (general) store while at home. It started with only a small amount of capital. Her goods were displayed on a table adjacent to their house.

Last September, she joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to avail herself of additional working capital. After paying her previous loan, she now applies for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store. In the future, she wants to expand her sari-sari into a grocery store. She also hopes that she will be able to send all her children to a decent school.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for sale

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur A. is a 31-year-old trader who sells goods for home repair. He sells a wide variety of goods, which is why his store is always full of customers. Teymur's business, which he's run for the past four years, is the sole source of support for his wife and his two adorable daughters. The shop is his family's only source of income.  Teymur has applied for a $3000 loan so he can diversify his store and increase the number of items he stocks.

loans.use: Purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is 48 years old. She is a wife and mother of two children. Currently both the children are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her source of livelihood. She has been supplying and retailing tiger nuts (edible tubers) for five years to support her family.

Tiger nuts have medicinal properties used in preparing local medicines for treating minor ailments. People also enjoy eating them for their good flavor. Veronica treks to Dambai in the northern part of Ghana to buy her stock of tiger nuts from farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy a bulk supply of tiger nuts to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay for her kids' schooling. Veronica is a member of a community group called "shining star" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase tiger nuts in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. sells maize, gari, and oil at Yamoransa in Cape Coast and has been doing so since 2000. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is an operator. Mercy completed senior high school. She is responsible for paying the family's light and water bills. 

Mercy will use her her loan to improve her business by buying more food supplies to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies to sell and expand her business.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del Bancomunal Maria Elena Moyano.
Maruja es conviviente tiene 30 años, un hijo de 2 años que esta al cuidado de ella.
Maruja trabaja con su esposo, el inicio el negocio por que el trabajaba en una carpintería, y decidió independizarse alquilo un local y se pusieron a trabajar,  han puesto una carpintería, ella también ayuda en las compras y en algunos trabajos.
Desde que esta en Finca, puede invertir en mas mercadería, en cada reunión aprende algo nuevo y se distrae mucho por que ha hecho nuevas amigas.  
Maruja necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para  de una compresora. 
 
El sueño de Maruja es comprar un terreno para poner su taller de carpintería por que donde están es alquilado.
texts.en:
Maruja, 30, is a member of the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank. She has a 2-year-old son in her care. Maruja works with her husband, who started the business because he was working as a carpenter, and decided to become independent. They rented a place and started to work as a carpenter's workshop. She also helps with purchases and in certain jobs. Now with Finca, she can invest in more merchandise. In every meeting she learns something new and is distracted often with the number of new friends she's made. Maruja needs a loan of 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency), for a compressor. Maruja's dream is to buy land for her carpenter's shop, since it is currently rented.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a compressor

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor J. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Eleonor is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling various delicacies and viands within the Cagayan de Oro airport. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Eleonor joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleonor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating the business.

Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Eleonor from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to finance the education of her children and supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marielith

texts.es: La señora Marielith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Bandinas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de anticuchos en las fueras de su casa donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. Sus ventas lo realiza  diariamente  por las noches. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Marielith,  se siente tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Marielith is a client of the Community Bank “Las Bandinas II” in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, San Martín. She is married, 38 years old, and has 2 dependent children. Her fighting spirit and desire to succeed motivated her to start her own business selling anticuchos (a traditional Peruvian meat dish) outside of her home, where little by little she became well known to her customers. Today Marielith tells us that that this business is going very well. She makes her sales every night. Marielith has been working in this business for years, and is very content with what she does. With this loan of S/ 2,000.00, Marielith will buy ingredients like bags of rice, eggs, chickens to make juanes (a traditional chicken dish) and chickens for her anticuchos, as well as kitchen utensils to provide quality service. Marielith is content and happy with her business and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare meals

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Lantay, Valencia City Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Teresita is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional business capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and supplement her income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo Osvaldo y sus 2 hijos: Edwin de 23 y Marlon de 12 años de edad. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de alimentos en la pequeña tienda que instaló en su casa para poder solventar los gastos de su familia. Pues este negocio resultó mucho más cómodo y eficaz, ya que paralelamente puede realizar las labores de su hogar; felizmente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos para atender la tienda en su ausencia. Abastecerse de nueva mercadería es lo que le resulta cansado, pues es muy complicado llegar desde el mercado hasta la zona donde vive. Erlinda quiere crecer y ser la tienda más concurrida de su barrio para obtener más ganancias, con las cuales pueda construir su casa de material noble y trasladar su tienda a un espacio más adecuado donde ordene sus productos y tengan una mejor vista para la clientela, ofreciéndoles comodidad y variedad. Este es el tercer préstamo individual de Erlinda con MFP, siendo siempre muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mercadería para abastecer su tienda de mayor cantidad de productos.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Kossé Agbemébia

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est spécialisé dans la vente des cartes de recharge cellulaire. Ce revendeur ambulant a débuté cette activité génératrice de revenus depuis 2007 à Lomé. Il vend le plus souvent dans le Grand Marché de Lomé où il est très connu des femmes d’affaires vendeuses de pagnes de qualité. Il distribue aussi ses cartes dans les bars et restaurants de la capitale. Il dispose en plus comme clientèles les cabines téléphoniques et cellulaires de la ville de Lomé. Actuellement il n’a plus presque de stock ; il sollicite donc un crédit de WAGES  pour commander 50 cartes de recharge de 1000Fcfa, 100 cartes de recharges de 2000Fcfa et 11 cartes de recharge de 4500Fcfa. Il n’est pas marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This young man is specialized in the sale of rechargeable phone cards for cell phones. He makes his sales by walking through the streets and began the business in 2007 in Lomé. He makes most of his sales in the Big Marketplace of Lomé where he is well-known among the women who sell high quality "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth). He also distributes his phone cards in the bars and restaurants of the capital. He also counts telephone booths and cell booths of the city of Lomé among his customers.

Presently he has no more cards in stock; he is thus asking WAGES for a loan to buy 50 rechargeable cards for 1000 F CFA, 100 cards for 2000 F CFA and 11 cards for 4500 F CFA. He is not married and not raising any children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina's business is raising hogs.  She is 45 years old and married with six children, two of whom are already married and four are still studying.  They are living in Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. Hog raising became her family's alternative source of income and it has been a big help in meeting their needs. 

She wants to improve her business.  She is asking for a loan of PHP8,000 from the Kiva lenders.  This amount will be of great help for her small business.  She believes that her business will pave the way to success and uplift their life from poverty.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sokit Chann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people who located in Thnal Teaksen village in Takeo province made up the village bank loan and Mrs. Sokit C. is a village bank president. She owns a small restaurant in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to bU. more ingredients for her current business so she decided to ask for a loan to bU. them. Her husband, Mr. Ven Na, is a farmer and he also helps his wife on the current business. Mrs. Sokit C. is 37 years old and the mother of three children two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of two years old. Mrs. Phuong Dara who is a group guarantee is also presented in the picture with the village bank loan.

Two members in this village loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her current business.

loans.name: Busirat

texts.en: Busirat sells food very close to her house. She has been in business for the past five years. She is 37 years old and married with two children. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more food to sell. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more food for resale

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Felicia is a 61 year old borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Desarrollo (Women in Development), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Specifically, Felicia and her fellow borrowers live in Batey Margarita. Bateyes are small, rural communities built by sugar companies for their field workers. They are isolated, have no running water, and have unreliable electricity at best. Felicia lives with her husband and one of her grandchildren; she has seven children, but all have married and moved out of her home. 

Felicia runs a successful eatery which serves traditional Dominican foods (rice and beans, plantains, stewed chicken and beef). On the siD., she also sells clothing to add to her income. Felicia says that she really enjoys working and loves the loans she has received from Esperanza, saying that if there is anything available to help her business, she would want it.

Unsurprisingly with the work ethic she brings to the table, this is Felicia’s ninth loan overall with Esperanza International. She has a perfect repayment record so far and hopes to continue using the financial services available to her. Thank you for lending to Felicia and the Mujeres en Desarrollo group!

loans.use: Rice, beans, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Libertad En Progreso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Libertad en Progreso se encuentra en la comunidad de Zhizho perteneciente a la parroquia de Victoria del Portete, se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, Zhizho nos ofrece una belleza natural demostrando lo hermoso de la naturaleza, sus socias son muy amables y siempre están dispuestas a salir en adelante para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

La Sra. María C. es socia del banco comunal Libertad en Progreso, vive en la comunidad de Zhizho, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 10 años de edad y estudia en la escuela Ana Fidel Hidalgo en la comunidad, su hija si es reconocida por su padre, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres.

María se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, pollos, chanchos y ganado, lo realiza desde hace mucho tiempo, sus animales los vende en la comunidad y hay veces que vende en la Feria Libre mercado de Cuenca, pero por el momento se encuentra un poco malo por el verano ya que no hay hierba para sus animales, también tiene una tienda hace 8 años nos comenta que le va bien pero necesita ampliarla, es una muy buena socia de la banca comunal y se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en la banca comunal y nos comenta que le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, va a surtir su tienda, su mayor sueño es de tener una casa propia.

La Sra. Claudia Marca tiene 23 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal a procreado 3 hijos de 8, 4 y 3 años de edad, su hija se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de Zhizho, su esposo trabaja en la construcción, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá ayudándole económicamente.

Claudia se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cuyes, lleva 2 años en este negocio nos comenta que hay veces que le va bien y mal, sus animales entrega a sus clientes y hay veces que le vienen a compra en su casa, tiene una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras del bankito, se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo y nos comenta que le han ayudado para engrandecer su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, lo va a invertir en comida para sus pollos, vacunas y vitaminas, su sueño es de llegar a construir su casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Libertad en Progreso” (Freedom in Progress) is located in the community of Zhizho, which is part of Victoria del Portete Parrish in southern Cuenca. Zhizho is surrounded by natural beauty. The members of this Communal Bank are extremely friendly and always willing to get ahead so that they can have a better quality of life.

Sra. María C. is a member of the Libertad en Progreso Communal Bank and a resident of Zhizho. She is a 42 year old single mother of a 10 year old daughter who attends the Ana Fidel Hidalgo School in the community. The father of the child accepts responsibility for her. María lives with her parents since she does not own a home.

María has been raising guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and cattle for a long time. She sells the animals in the community and occasionally at the open market in Cuenca. María experienced a bit of difficulty this past summer because of a shortage of grass for the animals. She also has a store that was established eight years ago, which she says is doing well but would like to expand it. María is a good member of the Communal Bank and gets along well with the rest of her cohorts. She is participating in her second loan cycle and says that her business has benefited. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will restock her store. She dreams of having her own home.

Sra. Claudia Marca is 23 years old, married, and has three children (ages 8, 4, and 3). Her oldest daughter is a student at a school in Zhizho. Her husband works in construction. Claudia does not own a home so she lives at the house of her mother, who is helping her financially.

She has been raising chickens and guinea pigs for two years. Claudia says that her business at times does well and other times poorly. She delivers the animals to her customers and sometimes they come to her house to get them. Claudia has become friends with the other members of her Communal Bank. She is participating in her fourth loan cycle and says the funding has helped her expand her business. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will purchase feed for her chickens, vaccines, and vitamins. Her dream is to build a home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Matida

texts.en: Matida is married to a teacher and they are blessed with four children. She is 32 years old. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. Her customers are mostly women and young ladies. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. This is the festive season and she is happy because her profits will increase. She needs a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Tukwatirewamu Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Zaituni N. is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is an older woman with a restaurant business that she has owned for over 15 years. She is happy that she has reaped big rewards from her transactions. Her restaurant is located in Jinja Town and, because she has experience in preparing local food, she has attracted many customers who spread the word about her cooking. She has been able to pay school fees for her children and, during the holiday seasons, she works closely with her children and her staff at the restaurant. She also sells soft drinks as an accompaniment. 

Zaituni needs a loan to help buy more food for her restaurant. She buys in bulk whenever she needs food.

loans.use: To buy more food for her restauarnt

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: Marème M. est âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle commercialise divers produits alimentaires comme le lait,le cucre et l'huile. Son objectif est de renforcer son capital.
texts.en:
Marème M., 55, is married and the mother of one child. She sells various foodstuffs such as milk, sugar, and oil. Her objective is to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling various foodstuffs

loans.name: Arnelyn

texts.en:
Arnelyn P. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, ZN. She is 23 years old. Arnelyn is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Arnelyn sells basic commodities like rice, shampoo, soap and many others. Arnelyn has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arnelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arnelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Arnelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Nora A. is from the village of San Juan. She is 49 years old. Nora is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nora is married. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2009, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Nora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira, de 36 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Abel, de 40 años, quien trabaja junto a ella en el cultivo de sus tierras, y sus 2 hijas; Yanilin de 18 y Yasmin de 16 años, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras; como alverjas, zanahorias, tomates, etc. Su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que sus productos son frescos y tienen un precio asequible, lo cual ha hecho que se vuelva una de las vendedoras más solicitadas por los clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto cuidándolo. Para más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorar su negocio poco a poco.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Edelmira con MFP y está segura que el dinero del crédito la ayudará bastante en el desarrollo de su negocio. A su vez, dentro de su banco comunal trabaja muy duro junto a sus compañeros para que las cosas les salgan muy bien. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más verduras para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Edelmira, age 36, is a simple and hardworking woman. She lives in a rented house with her 40-year-old husband, Abel, who works alongside her cultivating their land, and their two daughters: 18-year-old Yanilin and 16-year-old Yasmin. What she wants most is to improve their quality of life. Her business is located in the city market. She sells vegetables like peas, carrots, tomatoes, etc. Her booth is very busy, as her produce is very fresh and reasonably priced. This has made her one of the most popular vendors among the customers. What she likes most about her work is talking to her fellow vendors, because this makes working long hours more pleasant. She has been doing this work for six years, and she considers staying in her booth all day to be the most difficult part. In the future, she hopes to keep working hard and improve her business little by little. This is the third loan Edelmira has sought from MFP, and she is sure that the credit will help her a great deal in developing her business. She works very hard in her communal bank along with her partners to ensure that everything goes well. With the 1,000 soles she is requesting, she will purchase more vegetables to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Las Estrellas Fatima Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Las Estrellas Fátima” esta representado por la señora Ana Karina y conformad a por 10 miembros compuesta por 7 mujeres y tres varones. La señora Ana Karina es casada y tienen dos niños uno en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta D. artesanías en el mercado tales como mantas, manteles con motivos andinos y productos D. madera y bronce, su esposo se dedica al transporte público D. pasajeros y juntos tratan D. sacar adelante a su familia  para poder tener una mejor calidad D. vida, su mayor deseo es poder tener dinero para hacer construir una casita en su lote D. terreno en la ciudad D. El Alto y así poder darles a sus hijos una mejor comodidad ya que ellos actualmente viven en la casa D. los padres D. la señora Ana Karina. El resto D. los socios se dedican a actividades como el servicio D. amplificaciones y filmaciones, la venta D. abarrotes, tapetes, Licores, cosméticos, comida y electrodomésticos. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra compras D. materia prima tales como telas, hilos y mercadería D. temporada y herramientas para efectuar un mejor trabajo que pueda traducirse en un mejor ingreso para el sustento D. sus hogares. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cursando varios ciclos juntas por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo en grupos solidarios con la fundación Agrocapital quien les brinda un apoyo económico para que sigan creciendo y trabajando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Las Estrellas Fátima” (The Fatima Stars) group is represented by Ana Karina and is composed of 10 members: 7 women and 3 men. Ana Karina is married and they have two, school-aged children. She sells handicrafts like: blankets, tablecloths with Andean designs, wood and bronze items in the market. Her husband provides public transportation services. Together, they strive to move their family forward in order to have a better quality of life. Her greatest wish is to have money to build a house on their lot in the city of El Alto to give their children more comfort; they currently share Ana Karina’s parents’ house. The rest of the members are engaged in a variety of commercial activities, such as: sound and film services, grocery sales, mats, liquor, cosmetics, food and home appliances. The funds will be used to buy raw materials and supplies like: fabric, thread and seasonal merchandise as well as tools that will make better work possible and translate into higher family income. With respect to experience, the members have gone through several loan cycles together so they are well aware of group dynamics within Agrocapital, which provides them with economic support so that they can continue to grow and work to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy arts and crafts supplies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is part of the Los Diamantes communal bank. This bank, whose name means “The Diamonds” in English, consists of 32 members, all hailing from the Cuzco area. Alberto is 38 years old and lives with his spouse and their 1-year-old child. 

Alberto makes his living in the construction business as a topographer. He is involved in the construction of houses and is currently also working near Machu Picchu to fix damage done by the recent flooding there. 

Alberto will use his loan from Kiva to help his construction business. He is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build more classes for a school

loans.name: Sr Cautivo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR CAUTIVO”; Nuestros socios viven en el valle sagrado de los inkas, en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. Abel, Nuestro socio nació en el distrito de Lares, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca; Nuestro socio tiene 4to de primaria y no pudo estudiar ninguna carrera, desde muy temprano el socio se dedicó a trabajar para ayudar a sus papas en la crianza de sus hermanos menores, el es conviviente y tiene 2 pequeños hijos, Nuestro socio trabaja como albañil el en el colegio arcoíris, en su tiempo libre se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, el socio compra cuyes en Lares y los lleva a vender a Urubamba el tiene una casita acondicionada para criar cuyes al por mayor. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y el transporte de los mismos.
Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio de yeso, obrero, artesano, venta de productos secos, construcción civil, venta de chicha, crianza de animales menores, venta de golosinas, empleada en restaurante.

 Los socios agradecen y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank 'Sr Cautivo'. They live in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, in Urubamba province, in the Cusco department of Peru. Abel was born in the Lares district, Calca province. He finished the fourth year of primary school and couldn't study a career, so from a very young age he worked helping his parents raise his younger siblings. Abel lives with his partner and has 2 small children. He works as a builder in the Rainbow College. In his spare time he works breeding small animals. He buys guinea pigs in Lares and takes them to sell in Urubamba. Abel has a small air-conditioned house to breed his guinea pigs in. He is seeking a loan to purchase more guinea pigs and transport them. The other members work as plasterers, labourers, artisans, selling dried production, civil construction, selling chicha, breeding small animals, selling sweets, and working in a restaurant. They are all thankful and value the support given by the bank. They promise to meet their debt repayments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and transport guinea pigs

loans.name: Arsénio

texts.pt:
Arsénio H. V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 40 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 11, 09 e 04 anos de idade, os 2 primeiros vão a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta os pais enviando algum dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Maputo para Nampula quando seus pais foram transferidos pelos serviços. 5 Anos depois regressa a Maputo no Distrito de Boane e constitui uma família. Trabalha num orfanato na área agro-pecuária ha mais de 1 ano. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 3.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do rendimento do seu negócio consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmão que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, cervejas, bolachas, biscoitos, pipocas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e construir um murro de vedação na sua casa.
texts.en:
Arsenio H. V. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. He is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 11, 9 and 4 years old. The two older children attend school. Arsenio only studied through 10th grade, and didn't continue because of his parents’ lack of financial resources. He lives with his family in their own house and helps to support his parents by sending them money to help with their household expenses. He left Maputo for Nampula when his parents were transferred for work reasons. 5 years later he returned to Maputo and the district of Boane, where he started a family. He has worked in an orphanage in an agricultural zone for more than a year, and doesn’t employ any household help. He earns a monthly salary of 3500 Meticais, which he uses to cover household expenses. He also saves some in his bank account. Arsenio has never taken out a loan with another bank. He found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through his brother, who also works with the institution. This is his 5th loan, for the amount of 25,000 Meticais. He plans to use this money to buy products (soft drinks, beer, cookies, crackers, popcorn and other items) in order to increase his stock of merchandise. He promises to repay the loan as indicated in order to be eligible for other loans later. In the future he would like to apply for more loans to finish his house and build a security wall around it.

Translated from Portuguese by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer, soft drinks, cookies and popcorn

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth R. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 48 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ramiriza Group

texts.fr:
Marie Claire N. est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite la Commune de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de charbon au quartier Kanyosha à Bujumbura. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 2 ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 7e année. Son époux, N., est un chauffeur. Elle arrive au 6e cycle avec le crédit de Turame. 

Elle est mère de 3 garçons âgés respectivement de 6 ans, 3 ans et 1 année  3mois. L’aîné est à l’école. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour changer le type de business en achetant des habits pour les revendre au marche Central de Bujumbura. Elle espère ainsi que cela lui permettra d’acquérir une plus grande capacité de générer du bénéfice pour parvenir à construire sa propre maison. Elle a l’espoir que ses enfants finiront les études avec succès et  être capables de lui venir en aide dans le futur a cote de mener une vie meilleure. Elle va continuer à demander le crédit Turame car il est le plus préfère aux autres institutions financières car les conditions d’accès et de remboursement sont plus faciles. Elle conseille à tous ceux qui veulent pratiquer le commerce que la persévérance est la clé du succès dans ce métier 

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Ramiriza » qui veut dire « Continuer ».
texts.en:
Marie Claire N. is a 29-year-old merchant living in Kanyosha, a borough which is part of the Bujumbura mayorship. She has been selling coal in Kanyosha for the past two years, before which she was a cash crop farmer. She went to school until the 7th grade. Her husband N. is a driver. She is now in her sixth loan cycle with Turame. She is the mother of three boys who are 6 years, 3 years, and 1 year and 3 months old. The eldest attends school. She is requesting the Kiva loan to change her business activity and buy clothing for resale at the central market in Bujumbura. She hopes that this will increase her ability to generate revenue so that she can eventually build her own home. She hopes that her children will successfully complete their schooling and become able in the future to help her lead a better life. She will continue to request loans from Turame because their terms for loans and repayments are easier to handle than with other financial institutions. She advises those who wish to practice a commercial activity that perseverance is the key to success in this profession. She is a member of the “Ramizira” community group, which means “Continue”.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: changer le type de business en achetant des habits pour les revendre au marche Central de Bujumbura

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. R., 35, sells various kinds of vegetables in a local market to earn a living. She buys the vegetables in bulk from farmers or wholesale suppliers and sells them retail to people who come to buy something for their cooking. She is able to generate $4 a day to cover the family expenses.

R. is married to Sochea, age 38, who shares the responsibility for his family by working as a construction worker. They are good parents to their four children who are young and attending the public school.

R. is concerned that her business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient capital. She wishes to obtain more money by requesting a loan to use towards increasing her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. She will use any remaining money from the loan to mend her old house.

loans.use: To increase her business capital and to mend her old house

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: In Chamkar Tieng village in Takeo province has a person, Mrs. Vann B. was born in 1966. She is a Khmer noodle seller in local village where she can earn some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Sat Touch, is a construction worker and he is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Now she has a problem because her husband’s field is time to plow, but she did not have two oxen to plow. So to improve production, Mrs. Vann B. is applying for a loan to buy an ox to enough two oxen for plow. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are construction workers, while the other two are helping the parents’ businesses, and the youngest one is studying in local public school. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an ox to enough two oxen for plow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies that she’ll use to seal the walls of her house; and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Shirley Antuanet

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Las Mónicas, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande,  zona productora de frutas para exportación que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, situada a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace seis meses, ella cuenta con un terreno de cultivo que recibió como parte adelantada de una herencia de su madre, en este terreno tiene instalado limón, esta fruta la cosecha semanalmente y las vende a las diversas plantas procesadoras que se encuentran instaladas en la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su familia.

Shirley desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, de esa manera ella espera obtener una mejor producción y así obtener mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniento solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Shirley es una mujer tranquila y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder adquirir mas terrenos de cultivo. En la zona donde vive ella es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Shirley, 18, is single and lives with her parents in Las Mónicas, a rural area of the agricultural Tambogrande district which is an area where fruit for export is produced and is located in Piura province, Piura region, more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region. Shirley has been farming for the last 6 months. She has a field that she got as a pre-inheritance from her mother. She has planted lemons which are harvested weekly for sale to various processing plants in the area. The income she earns is used to pay for personal expenses and to help her parents to support the family. Shirley would like to acquire fertilizers to provide her crop with care and maintenance so that production will be improved thus obtaining higher income. To reach this objective she has deemed it convenient to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time in the amount of 700 new soles. Shirley is a levelheaded, responsible woman whose greatest wish it to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to be able to acquire more land to farm. She is quite well-known and esteemed where she lives and her neighbors consider her to be an honest and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for lemon crop maintenance and care.

loans.name: Fedelina's Group

texts.en:
Fedelina B. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Fedelina is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fedelina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fedelina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Fedelina is just starting this business.

In 2010, Fedelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fedelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fedelina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fedelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh T. N., 52, is the mother of two high school students. She is a rice and vegetable farmer.  Anh also raises and sells pigs to support her family.

She has received loans since 2004 to expand her business.  Currently, Anh wants a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy 200 hens and hen food.

loans.use: Buy 200 hens and hen food.

loans.name: Dorfina Filipe

texts.pt:
Dorfina Filipe C. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 2 filhos. Fez somente 7ª classe não continuou devido a falta condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria e sustenta seus irmãos que vivem com ela. 

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a fim de continuar com seus estudos a residir com a sua tia. Trabalha como operaria agrícola numa empresa de produção agrícola ha mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salario de 1.690.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancaria.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (portas, cimento, barrotes, pedra, areia, chapas de zinco e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência.

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para concluir sua casa.
texts.en: Dorfina Filipe C. was born in Massinga, province of Inhambane, in Southern Mozambique. The mother of two, she left Inhambane to go live in Maputo with an aunt, in order to continue her studies. Her schooling was interrupted when she was in 7th Grade, due to financial constraints. She lives in a house she owns with her children and brothers, whom she supports. For the past four years she has been working at an agricultural factory, currently earning a monthly salary of 1.690.00mt, which allows her to take care of household expenses as well as save some money in the bank. Dorfina has never requested loans from other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are clients of the institution. This is her third loan and she plans to use the money to buy construction material (cement, iron, stones, beams, sand, zinc plates, etc) to continue the construction work on her house. She's confident in her ability to pay back the loan and plans to apply for more loans in the future, to finish the house.

loans.use: to buy construction material (doors, cement, beams, stone, sand, zinc plates, etc)

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El  Sr. Icavalceta es  originario del municipio de El SAUCE comarca el pilón tiempo en que ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente con tres  crédito consecutivo para compra de ternero.
En cuanto a este  financiamiento será utilizado para mejora de su finca  como  asegurar más su finca con el propósito de evitar que se le salgan sus animales y se les pierdan. 
Esto le permitirá al cliente y su familia  tener  mejores condicione de su finca y le rinda su pasto para sus hato ganadero.
texts.en:
Mr. Icavalceta is originally from the El Pilón hamlet of the town of El Sauce, where he has proven to be an excellent client, with three previous loans that he used to buy land.

He will use the money from this loan to make improvements so that his animals will not escape and get lost.  This will allow him and his family to have better conditions on the land and provide grass for his livestock to graze in.

loans.use: Build a fence

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Para la señora María este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le encantan las reuniones ya que además de aprender con las charlas educativas también se divierte. Tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y los otros tienen 17 y 12 años los mismos que estudian en colegio. El esposo trabaja de conserje en una casa deportiva de la ciudad.

Tiene un negocio de preparación y venta de corviches, empanadas y helados de varios sabores, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende todas las tardes las empanadas y los corviches ya que los helados los vende todo el día, trabaja en las mañanas en la producción de sus productos y en las tarde los vende. Nos cuenta que lleva 5 años en esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos como maní, plátano y especias para la preparación de los alimentos. Además de una mesa y cuatro sillas para darle mas comodidad a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un restaurante o un bar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is the most populated section of the city and known for being the location of the Portoviejo Women’s Prison.

Sra. María is participating in her fourth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and enjoys the meetings as well as the things she has learned from the educational seminars. She is 42 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are grown while the other two are 17 and 12 years of age and attending high school. Her husband works as a janitor at a sports facility in the city.

María has a business preparing and selling seafood cocktails, turnovers, and ice cream of different flavors. She has a small shop in her home where every afternoon she sells turnovers, seafood cocktails, and ice cream every day. María spends her mornings preparing the food that she will sell in the afternoon. She says she has been in business for five years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more supplies such as peanuts, bananas, and spices used in preparing her food. In addition, she will purchase a table and four chairs so that her customers will be more comfortable. Her dream is to open a restaurant or bar.

loans.use: Purchase peanuts, bananas, spices, a table, and four chairs

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S., 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. S. is a housewife while her husband manufactures wooden furniture, earning an income of about USD 3.33 per day. S. has to spend USD 56 on food, USD 12 on electricity and water, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase hairdressing equipment to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: buy hairdressing equipment to start a business

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana del Carmen Pavón de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien vende calzado hace siete años la cual inicio con unos ahorros y ha continuado por medio de los préstamos. Ella con el crédito comprará calzado ya que en esta época por las fiestas navideña, los quince años, bodas, bautizos, promociones la población compra más. 
Pavón junto con su compañero de vida cría a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 12. 6 y 3 años por los cuales trabajan arduamente.
texts.en:
Johana del Carmen Pavón, 31, is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who has sold footwear for the last 7 years.  She started the business with some savings and has continued it using loans.

She will use the loan to buy footwear because during this Christmas, fifteen-year birthday parties, weddings, baptisms and school graduations season people buy more.

Pavón and her spouse are raising four children who are 13, 12, 6 and 3 years of age and for whom they work arduously.

loans.use: For footwear.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino A. necesita comprar celulares de gama baja ya que tiene mayor solicitud y quiere responder oportunamente a su exclusiva clientela, para no dejarla esperando mientras logra las ventas de contado y recupera su cartera.  Él con sus 26 años de experiencia,  sabe que si tiene un capital en efectivo para comprar permanentemente,  su dinero rota rápidamente y sus utilidades se incrementan. Eso es justamente lo que quiere hacer  con su credikiva: manejar un nuevo capital para comprar celulares de gama baja al por mayor y actualizar los accesorios, porque en navidades sus ventas se incrementan y necesita estar preparado. Este es  su financiamiento número 26 con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que lo ha apoyado durante 14 años , desde cuando inició su  primer negocio que fue la venta de gafas y monturas para lentes,  en un sector muy comercial  donde ubicó  su  primer punto de ventas; él es un hombre satisfecho porque con el fruto de su trabajo en el negocio, pudo ahorrar para comprar su vivienda y ampliarlo y en estos últimos años con los cambios tecnológicos, ha agregado celulares, y adecuados accesorios hasta convertirlo en un sitio muy conocido llamado el "Primer Elemental", ubicado en un nuevo local, donde interactúa con la competencia y todos están en pequeños espacios, que cada uno ha logrado como producto de sus esfuerzos. Paulino es un hombre casado y ejemplar, tiene 62 años y 4 hijos en las edades de 28 a 34 años y es muy participativo en todos los eventos estructurados por la Fundación cuyo objetivo es su crecimiento empresarial. Con sus créditos anteriores ha logrado adquirir su nuevo local, ampliar su negocio, tener un inventario mayor y moderno que mostrar, adquirir vitrinas y enseres, lo que  hace que cada día su microempresa luzca mas armoniosa y capte la atención de nuevos clientes y conserve los actuales.
texts.en:
Paulino A. needs to buy low-range cellular phones, since he has increased requests for them and wants to respond in a timely way to his exclusive customers, so that he doesn't leave them waiting while he sells his current stock and recovers his investment. With his 26 years of experience, he knows that if he has permanent capital in cash for making purchases, his money revolves rapidly and his profits grow. This is exactly what he wants to do with his Kiva loan: manage new capital to buy low-range cellular phones wholesale and update the accessories, because at Christmas his sales increase and he needs to be prepared. 

This is his 26th loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, an organization that has supported him for 14 years, since he began his first business, which was the sale of eyeglasses and frames. His first sales location was in a very commercial sector. He is a very satisfied man, since with the fruit of his business labors, he was able to save to buy his home and enlarge it. In recent years, with all the technological changes, he has added cellular phones and suitable accessories, and he has converted his shop into a very well known place called "Primer Elemental. It is in a new location, where he interacts with the competition and all the merchants are in small spaces, which each one has achieved through his efforts.

Paulino is a married and exemplary man.
